title: So elegant and visually appealing
body: What a gorgeous app- that alone makes me want to open it and track. I love that it there's a water tracker, daily fruit and vegetable and weekly seafood tracker and that they give you a life score with details on what to improve each week. Sure, a few glitches like not currently syncing with Health app (I open both then close both and open once more then it tracks), and the recipes and sometimes the database doesn't have the exact food but does have something comparable, just takes a smidgen more work. The beta camera isn't the greatest if you have a deep dish as opposed to a plate but it sure is handy and easy enough to adjust. And there's not many recipes, but the ones available are easy to follow and pleasant to eat, plus how often does one follow a recipe to a T? I've tried other tracking apps (looking at you MFP) and all the ads and monotone color scheme make them too unidimensional- this is beautiful, too beautiful not to use. And the step counter that equates steps to what you burn makes me just competitive enough with myself to make me want to walk even more (I burned 1.5 croissants?!? Bet I can burn 2!). I'd like to buy the app developers a beer. Then go walk said beer off. I saw a couple of review that say the app is rigid in terms of certain foods like sunflowers, and though I appreciate the sentiment, I am using the app for weight loss and do indeed want to know if a food is high in caloric content.
response: Thank you very very much for your detailed feedback! We are glad to hear that you like Lifesum!

title: Beautiful! But could use customized notifications.
body: This app is gorgeous! I love the articles and the recipes look absolutely scrumptious. The aesthetics alone are what make this the most effective app, and it is super smooth! Even on this old phone, where everything else crashes. Huge thanks to the devs for achieving this. Now, I turned on notifications expecting reminders to update my water or add my meals and exercise, which would be really nice! Sometimes you get busy and don't track anything; it is the LAST thing on your mind. I did, however, get constant reminders to update my weight. As someone who has a Lifesum of 119 (almost completely perfect! ðŸ˜²), I find that a little unhealthy. No-one should be weighing themselves every day, especially if you already have an unhealthy relationship with your weight, body fat percentage, or food. Even on a practical level, it doesn't make much sense. So I turned off the notifications, but it would be nice to be able to select what kind of notifications we get in the future! Such as for new recipes or articles, and reminders in other areas of body and health maintenance. Or a way to change the frequency: Weighing yourself every X amount of days. If there is already a way to do this, I hope the settings for it become easier to find. â¤ï¸ Thanks for reading!

title: Beautiful and easy to use with some adaptability issues
body: First of all, the visual design of this app is incredible. Other similar apps have designs that make it feel outdated, which in turn can make the data or plans feel outdated even when thatâ€™s not true. Gorgeous color scheme, icons, motion design, etc, and lots of great features like the barcode scanner and ability to quickly select previous daysâ€™ meals.
response: Thank you so much for your positive feedback and kind words, we have shared it with the teams in charge! Furthermore, we really apologise for the issue you are experiencing. Please feel free and contact us with details, step description and screenshots at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Please also include phone model, OS and Lifesum version. Thank you and have a great day!

title: Meal plans impractical
body: Just downloaded this today and got a premium subscription for 3 mos. Havenâ€™t been able to do much but most of the features seem nice! I like that it tells you how good certain foods or meals are for you and tracks how â€œon trackâ€ you are. It puts it a step ahead of most other trackers Iâ€™ve seen.
response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts on our app! The meal plans are designed to be a kick-starter to your diet and are supposed to last a short period of time. It is possible to swap meals throughout the week in order to eat the same meal each day, so there are small adaptations possible. Thanks again for your feedback and good luck with your goal!

title: Delete My Fitness Pal!
body: I donâ€™t normally review apps but this is one EVERYONE should definitely try. This is the first app that Iâ€™ve actually lost weight with.. it actually helps you develop better eating habits. I know that thereâ€™s a lot of hype behind My Fitness Pal, but I swear, after trying both, LIFESUM BEATS MY FITNESS PAL HANDS DOWN. Nearly everything since the app has gone through updates is perfect. The user-face is simple and easy to use, without the annoying ads other apps have. You can adjust everything to fit your personal goals, even if they go beyond what the app recommends. They even include a macro calculator that makes things easy to calculate. The grading scale is really helpful to see where you can improve. It takes everything into account, calories, macros, sugar, fiber... itâ€™s pretty comprehensive. Also, I love that I can keep everything private, itâ€™s not necessarily a competition against all of my Facebook friends. The graphs and diagrams make seeing long term trends quick and easy. One thing I would love to see is something that suggests meals or specific items that would meet the goals of the meal. If I have 200 calories left and havenâ€™t met my protein, fat, or carbs goals, what can I add to my meal that fits my goals? Other than that, the developers have done an absolutely stellar job.
response: Hi, thank you very much for your 5 star rating and awesome feedback! We were very happy to read that our app has contributed to your healthier lifestyle and we truly appreciate you sharing your success with us. Our developers are collecting all feedback here https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd - we really appreciate all ideas and suggestions for improvement!

title: Fun Macro Tracker
body: I really love the design of this app and that you can follow plans that will adjust your macros for you. I also like like that you can capture a photo of your food for each meal, however, unfortunately, this functionality doesnâ€™t work most of the time. Once I take a picture it doesnâ€™t show in the app right a way, most of the time I have to take the pic a couple of times, close the app, reopen it and then the pic may or may not show up. So it would be nice if that could get fixed. Also, there isnâ€™t an easy way to copy a meal from another day to a different meal. So if I ate something for breakfast yesterday, thereâ€™s no  easy way to copy that to lunch the next day. And when searching for foods, your recents donâ€™t come up. For example, if I wanted to add a food and itâ€™s not showing in my most recent but Iâ€™ve logged it before, it would be nice to have it so up in my search when I go to search the food in the search bar. Another thing this app is missing is the ability to see what foods were highest in each macro. So if I wanted to see what foods I ate that day where highest in fat or protein.. Other macro apps have this, which was nice because then you could see what foods may be bumping up a macro too much or vice versa. Overall I have enjoyed this app and really like the design. However there are a few functionalities that are missing.
response: Hi there, thank you for the valuable feedback! Please feel free to leave suggestions for improvement on our UserVoice: https://lifesum.uservoice.com. Regarding the photo feature please feel free to email us more details directly at contact@lifesum.com so that we can take a closer look at the matter. Thank you!

title: Awesome, but there are some errors.
body: Iâ€™ve been using this app for as long as I can remember and I recently just upgraded to the Premium, which I love! I love the aesthetic of the app and the visuals and colors it uses. I love the wide variety of recipes, even thought I donâ€™t use them that much. I love the weekly rating I get so that I can look at my past week and see what I need to improve on for the next one. However, there are a couple things I find I have trouble with. The main thing is that when I go to update my weight, I check on it the next day and it says â€œNothing lost, nothing gained.â€ So whenever I update my weight and maybe iâ€™ve lost a pound or two, iâ€™ll update my weight. But the next day when I go to look at my weight it erased it or changed it back to the starting weight. It does this almost all the time and is pretty annoying because I have to delete the starting weight that it put it back on for that day, at the same time deleting the weight that I put in. Another thing thatâ€™s minor is that when I go to take a picture of my food, sometimes it doesnâ€™t work and the picture never shows up. I do really love this app but I donâ€™t know if anyone else has the weight changing itself issue or not.
response: We apologize for the issue you are experiencing. Please feel free and contact us with details, step description and screenshots at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Please also include phone model, OS and Lifesum version. Thank you!

title: Love the app as is but would also love upgrades
body: I started using Lifesum to track my intake.  It is easy to use and very visual.  However, there are a couple of upgrades I would like seeing.  First, I would like to see Fat broken down into Total, Sat, Monounsaturated, and Polyunsaturated.  I would also like to see Carbs broken down into Total, Fiber, Sugar Alcohols, Added Sugar, and Net Carbs.  (Currently, the app simply subtracts fiber from total carbs to calculate net carbs.). Also, since I work with a functional medicine professional who is interested in seeing my intake, I would like to see the ability to export data.  As I used to program (albeit mainframe),  I know how long upgrades take to implement; it is possible some of these are already in the works.  They were meant only as suggestions.  Long story short, I am very happy with the app as it is even if it misses some of my personal desires.  Thank you for the work you put in to bring such a useful app to market.  Oh, last but not least, I think it would be better to let users know that full, continued use of the app requires a subscription.  The cost is nominal for the usefulness, but it was frustrating when I first found out about the cost after downloading the app.
response: Thank you so much for your valuable feedback, we much appreciate it! We have sent your feedback to the responsible teams for their knowledge!

title: Itâ€™ll get the job done, but it could be better
body: Calorie tracking and dieting options work well and seem to cover a wide variety of needs. It is cumbersome to find the food and/or measurement needed for accurate tracking at times; requiring the user to do some creative math or mental gymnastics to figure out what should be entered. I paid for a membership and feel itâ€™s okayâ€”I wonâ€™t likely be renewing. The recipes offer some tasty and decently filling alternatives, but are HORRIBLY written, as often as not. If youâ€™re not familiar with finagling and â€œfiguring outâ€ a recipe or if that type of this is frustrating, this is not the app for you. This feels most functional for a few scenarios: first, the casual user who already has a decently healthy understanding of food, quantities, cooking, etc., and is just looking for a little guidance, new ideas for recipes or to literally track calories. Second, any of the diets, Iâ€™d bet, would work if youâ€™re a person who can follow the recipe EXACTLY (I follow â€œclassicâ€ and â€œveganâ€ but would struggle with both if I didnâ€™t already have experience eating/cooking alternative foods).  This WOULD NOT be for the user who doesnâ€™t really know at least some about healthy eating (novice) nor would it be for the serious weight loss/health person (expert) as it just doesnâ€™t support specifics well enough.
response: Thank you for the feedback! Please contact us at contact@lifesum.com with more details about your experience so we can understand even better what you do not like about the app.

title: Support unavailable
body: Loved the interface of this app and found it easy to navigate my way around pretty easily when I did use it. The one star rating is due to my recent experience today. I have tried several times now to contact support through the Contact Us (in app chat) link and it continues to crash. The app is updated to the most recent version and so is the software on my phone. Have tried to resend the message several times and the app keeps crashing. I want to cancel my subscription and plan on deleting the app TODAY. I purchased the Premium version of the app about a year ago at a discounted rate during a promo offer they had at the time. They seem to have it set it up where you subscribe to their Premium services outside of iTunes so the subscription is actually processed through their own website. Renewal dates or expiration dates of said Premium services are nowhere to be found anywhere in the app. They then attempt to auto renew it later on at almost $50 USD with no communication beforehand via email or otherwise that they will be processing this amount. I did not even locate the option to downgrade my account or cancel anywhere within the Settings option within the Lifesum app. Luckily my bank caught the attempted transactions as fraud and did not allow them through. Iâ€™ll stick to apps that allow me to manage my subscriptions within iTunes to avoid headaches like this.
response: Thank you very much for reaching out to us!

title: Wonâ€™t let you choose water bottle size
body: Update 2: Finally responded to my actual review. But they still are not going to implement the simple feature. Iâ€™m extremely disappointed that they are not prioritizing customer concerns.
response: Thanks again for your feedback! We are very sorry that you feel that way. Currently there are no plans to implement any changes when in comes to the bottle size in the near future. We are sorry that we cannot be of more help in this case.

title: Great app thatâ€™s sure to get even better
body: Ive been using Lifesum for a couple months now. Honestly I donâ€™t use it everyday (I donâ€™t track on weekends) but I love it! I love the look of it and the fun and encouraging tone. Love being able to see my macros front and center and seeing how my meal is looking on carbs, fat and protein. Two edits: as a previous review stated, notifications could use some work. Donâ€™t need to weigh myself every single day, and also donâ€™t need notifications for things Iâ€™ve already done (like log breakfast, etc.). Also get a note at 6 asking how my dinner was and I donâ€™t eat til about 7:30 bc of my commute (this notification reminds me how much I hate it!! lol).
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: New user- Edited
body: I just started using this app, trying to really kick off my dieting. I like organization when I diet and i just wish you could more closely edit your planner from day to day. How it is set up now- you have to scroll through all of the days and once you finish one day you have to scroll alllllll the way back down to the next day. Also, not sure if itâ€™s just a diet they are trying to promote, but no matter what answers I choose when taking the quiz I always get the Keto Burn. I donâ€™t necessarily have a problem with this diet, I just would like to see what other diets I could choose from that would also be recommended. If I am just overlooking how to do this please let me know! Other than these two things I am very impressed with the app and how affordable it is!
response: Thank you for rating our app - we truly appreciate your feedback! You can select any plan you want to follow, as well as the Classic plan in which you can customise your calorie allowance and macros. Good luck with reaching your goal!

title: Good - Needs To Be More Regulated
body: The interface of this app is great, there is little I would change about its functionality. Iâ€™ve been using it since late December and recently switched to premium a couple weeks ago. While I donâ€™t regret going premium because of all the additional features, this app is far from perfect. My main complaint is that the entries could stand to be more consistently regulated across the board. Often times Iâ€™ll see multiple entries for the same product, all different from one another, yet still all somehow verified by Lifesum with the blue tick. Sometimes the difference in nutrition info between these listings has to do with how the person entered in the serving size, but other times all the nutritional information is out of whack on two or more listings of what is allegedly the same product. This kind of negates the convenience of being able to just quickly search up a food and add it to your diary. I end up adding most of my food manually in order to be sure my entry is accurate. Even when I scan barcodes, I double check the entered nutritional info with the info on the label. All in all, unless this changes and the info on the app becomes more reliable, Iâ€™ll probably try another similar app when my membership is up, maybe MyFitnessPal.
response: Thank you for your review. We are sorry to hear that you have had these issues with our database.

title: Beautiful App and Great Plans with room to grow
body: This app is absolutely beautiful.  If a smooth flow and  easy navigation is important to you this might be a great place to start in your search for the perfect dieting app.  In addition to the look and feel it also has some great content.  My wife and I both tried the Paleo Diet for the first time in our lives. We loved the diet and everything it had to offer.  We also both experienced incredible results in both energy and weight loss.
response: Thank you very much for your review! We will inform the responsible team regarding your feedback. This is definitely valid points. We will be continuously working on more features so hopefully we will be able to soon improve your experience.

title: Awful navigation, terrible tracker
body: This hets 2 stars instead of 1 because i do actually use it to track, mostly because thereâ€™s little better out there. But the rest of the app is total garbage. It is inaccurate and poorly sourced, confusing to navigate if you want to change your plan, and the nutritional meals are extremely confusing. First, it only allows you to choose one dietary choice. For example, i try and eat a low carb diet but i ALSO want to keep that diet by eating clean and whole foods. But i have to choose one or the other. I am a pescatarian, and for some reason I still get recipes that suggest chicken or other meat. Also the â€œnutritional trackerâ€ is literally never happyâ€”you could have the healthiest meal and it will say you are nutritionally off track because you didnâ€™t hit *exactly* the nutritional intake it demands to the exact gram. If you have baked salmon, an extremely healthy food with lean protein and omega 3â€™s it says the meal is â€œtoo high in fat,â€ the same as if you had pizza. It doesnâ€™t differentiate between good fats and bad. Thereâ€™s no pleasing the nutritional tracker. It is annoying to search for recipes, and it seems like just a way for celebrity fitness influencers to make even more money when this could be an actual social app for real users to share recipes, exercises, and fitness data. What a waste.
response: We are very sorry to hear that you feel that way! We will make sure your feedback reaches the responsible teams. Please feel free to contact us directly at contact@lifesum.com for assistance, or if you have further questions. Thank you!

title: Keep Improving This App
body: I use a few apps for recipes already. Those apps all include nutrition values and labels. It would be nice if I could import/share those into lifesum without having to manually enter everything one at a time. A few of them have options to add those values to Apple health directly from the app. Lifesum writes data to health, but does not read. I think it would almost be better to separate functions out to apps. Have food apps handle entering / removing data into health and then have trackers reading and analyzing what you just ate so you can make informed decisions. Iâ€™d rather have two clean apps rather than one bloated app. I would imagine narrowing the scope would take out a lot of the overhead needed to maintain and update the app, thus making it even more clean and user friendly. Anyways, this is just my observation after using lots of food tracking apps. The interface may be different but functionally they are all kinda doing the same thing. I would also like to see more support for the Apple Watch when it comes to simple things like adding water and quick calories. The front end of this app is really beautifully done. If the back end was doing something unique then I could see myself paying for this app.
response: Thank you very much for taking the time to share your thoughts on our app - it is very appreciated and your feedback has been forwarded to the team! Feel free to send us your registered email through contact@lifesum.com for a free trial, in case you interested in trying our Premium version with no strings attached!

title: False Advertising & Poor Diet Poor Diet Entry Choices
body: Images displayed on Apple Apps fail to reflect the reality of the images and options offered in the app after purchasing premium version in all sections. For example I purchased the premium version yet was NEVER offered choices between diet plans as the first image on advertised app provided. I was never offered Keri, sugar free or other types of diet options as advertised. I was only offered choices of goals for weight
response: Hi there, thank you for your review. We are very sorry to hear that you feel this way. When you sign up you get to choose your goal, food preferences and allergies, from that the app will show you suitable diets and meal plans. In order to see all plans, please go to settings and choose no food preferences. You can also see all settings required for each plan here: https://lifesum.helpshift.com/a/lifesum---healthier-eating-better-living/?l=en&p=all&s=diets-meal-plans&f=overview-of-all-diets-meal-plans-in-the-app

title: Easy to use but not enough info
body: Fun and easy to use with a lot of foods in their database. Sadly it really does not provide enough nutritional information and goes against a lot of info Iâ€™ve gotten from
response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts on our app - it's very appreciated! Our meal plans offer a full daily menu for 21 days, recipes included. You can find out more here: https://bit.ly/2WZ3Dsm. The Snack category is there for you to track all snacks throughout the day; it doesn't mean that you can have only one entry. We just provide you with a suggestive snack calorie allowance. Regarding food rating, please find out more here: https://bit.ly/2U04Pex - it depends on several factors. Please, feel free to send us your concerns in more detail through contact@lifesum.com if you wish to have a personal approach to them. Thank you in advance!

title: App is just ok.
body: This app is ok for tracking. However, when you go to enter the food choices several different versions of that food pop up all with caloric differences for the same food. I weigh my foods, & I see different caloric amounts for the weights of the same food. For example, Red grapefruit will have a few different choices to select from but no matter the ounces, the calories will slightly differ 30-50 cals. I donâ€™t understand this & it can be very frustrating. & makes me feel as though my efforts are not always accurate & ultimately a wasteful purchase. The app has a nice design but could be better. Another feature that is annoying is if you want to review past food logs, & u leave the app open & go to do something else on your phone if you click back to the app it will reset to you viewing the food log of the current day. Which if you had to scroll back 8 days, youâ€™d have to scroll back 8 days again even if you just go to do something else even though the app is open which again is annoying & there should be a better way to compare past to future logs. The app does have nice recipes thought too. Im not sure Iâ€™ll be renewing it, I might look for another food log app before my subscription is up.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! Please feel free to leave suggestions for improvement on UserVoice: https://lifesum.uservoice.com - out team is regularly browsing through the information there to make sure we are aware about the different demands.

title: Beautiful but needs work
body: I got this app after seeing several ads for it in my Facebook feed. I like that it offers many different plans and gives you instant feedback on the quality of food you are eating, but many of the features advertised do not work properly. For example, I chose the three week weight loss plan. It generated recipes and a shopping list, which I thought was cool. But it does not let you add the recipes directly to your food diary -- clicking on the recipe did not do anything and I had to enter each ingredient manually, even though I followed the recipe exactly. This seems like a waste of time and a pretty big thing to overlook. Searching the recipe database for the recipe did not work either, as they are organized by tags and not by title or ingredient, making it even harder to find what you're looking for. I had to delete and reinstall the app to even get the water tracker to show up. There is also no way to manually sync the app with Fitbit; it just kind of does it when it wants to, which I also see as a major flaw. It's a beautiful app, but very clunky and full of dead ends. I paid for premium and at this point I wish I hadn't.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! The idea behind the 3 weeks weight loss is that the user just has to track by clicking on the meal and not think about calorie counting. That's why the calories are not mirrored in the Diary. But it seems that we have to make that clearer so thank you for your feedback. The trackers do not show in the plan as well but will appear again as soon as you finish the 3 weeks weight loss.

title: Will Not Sync with Apple Health App
body: I really like this app a lot. Itâ€™s very nice looking and motivating. I have been a paid subscriber for about 4 years now but am thinking that I might not be renewing this year. Iâ€™m not sure if the problem is with the Lifesum app or the Apple Health app, but the nutrition data will just not sync properly from Lifesum to the Health app. I am using the Health app to aggregate all of my health data which syncs properly from my sleep app, glucose app, exercise apps, etc., but not my diet/nutrition app which I consider to be essential for getting a complete health picture. I contacted the developer about this issue but was just told that they were working on it and informed as to how to get a refund and cancel my subscription. That was definitely not the answer I was looking for but may just take them up on it. What I really wanted to hear was a timeframe for getting this right. What I got from the response was that it wasnâ€™t really a priority for them. I would like to know whether it is or not because if it is and they are expecting a breakthrough in the near future I would definitely stick with the app.
response: Users are currently experiencing issues with the data sync between Health and Lifesum. That problem is related to operating systems older than 11.4. on your iPhone.

title: Pretty, but all the features require premium upgrade
body: So far I like the layout and the user friendly nature of this app. Itâ€™s easy to use and it has a nice aesthetic. The versatility of this app separates it from other fitness apps.
response: Please find more information about Premium here:

title: My perfect health app!
body: So far I have been using this app for about two weeks, and itâ€™s actually very impressive. I am coming from Samsung Health, which has helped me a lot over the past year and a half. However, after comparing the two, this app has so much more versatility and itâ€™s very acute regardless of which diet you choose. I decided that I was going to go with the diet plan Clean Eating, and in doing so realized how off course my diet was. More specifically, my sugar addiction problem. I have been working on improving my cooking and reducing my sugar consumption so that I can live a much healthier life. With everything that is offered, I definitely believe that this app is worth paying for.
response: Thank you very much for your positive feedback!

title: The only health app Iâ€™ve stuck with
body: Iâ€™ve tried lots of different apps to help me along my fitness journey and this is the only app I have been able and have wanted to stick with. Itâ€™s awesome when you track your food and are able to see a rating beside what youâ€™ve had. Also, itâ€™s very easy to track your exercise. As of recently, I have purchased an Apple Watch and it makes it even easier because it just takes the activity information from my watch and coverts it into the app. There is also a cool weight tracker you can use to count towards your weight goals. Tracking water intake is also nice and the app even gives you tips and encouraging words to reach your water, calories per meal, and exercise goals. I thought every app like this was the same and they all seemed so hard to figure out. Lifesum is short, sweet, and simple and I give the creators and developers of this app major props because usually I get bored within this category of apps, but this one has kept me focused and excited to use it. Thank you, Lifesum!
response: We were extremely pleased while going through your review and we thank you very much for taking the time to share your positive thoughts on our app! All the best with reaching your goal! :-)

title: Not Great
body: I bought the premium version because I thought it would be friendlier and more helpful than apps like myfitnesspal. Its not very smart, it doesnâ€™t have a lot of foods in its database, and the recipes provided are few and not impressive. Thereâ€™s no way to find easy meals, it seems to be time consuming and not super appetizing. For example, a suggested recipe to me was a tomato and buttermilk shake?? While that might not be hard to make, it sounds disgusting. Most of these recipes seem to be more about looks and â€œinstagramâ€ quality than nutrition and simplicity, which is what most people loom to food trackers for. In the appâ€™s attempt to be more millenial-geared and well-rounded, they made a complicated app with a few flashy features (choosing your type of diet, taking a picture of your food to log it-which didnâ€™t work when I tried-, and recipes-which have limited options and seem complicated). I wish they offered a trial of the premium but I understand why they donâ€™t because I definitely wouldnâ€™t have bought premium if I knew that not much would change, and the additional features are less than satisfactory. I absolutely regret purchasing this.
response: Thank you for your feedback. Itâ€™s a big challenge for us to allow people all across the world to track their everyday foods. Our users help by contributing missing foods to our database. Unfortunately, these contributions can have errors, as you discovered. We are constantly working to fix these errors, we hope youâ€™ll try us again in future.

title: Great for tracking calories. Overall discouraging.
body: I read so many reviews to find an app to help me keep track of my food intake when I restarted the 5-2 Intermittent Fasting plan. This app does that, but overall is really discouraging and unrealistic. In 7 days of tracking, I have not had ONE meal that was not labeled â€œimbalancedâ€ on this app. Iâ€™m either too high on protein or too high Iâ€™m carbs or too high on sugar (ANY meal that includes fruit) and frankly I am already sick of all their frown face icons and impossible standards. Today is my 500 calorie day â€” just finished dinner of a piece of broiled tilapia and a cup of broccoli with a tiny bit of garlic sauce.  Too high in protein and not enough carbs! For goodness sake, Iâ€™m limited to 500 calories! Almost all of my breakfasts have â€œnot enough proteinâ€, yet I looked through all their breakfast recipes and NONE of the low calorie recipes have the amount of protein they recommend.  Last week on my fast day it said I was too low in protein so I ate a hard boiled egg as my snack â€” and it said it was too much fat. There are no suggestions about alternatives that would be a better choice.  I fear this app has the propensity to lead to disordered eating and obsessing.  Very disappointed and I regret buying a six month membership that is not refundable.
response: Hi there, thank you so much for your feedback, we much appreciate you sharing it. We are sorry to hear you feel this way. Since we do not have your email address please feel free to email us directly at contact@lifesum.com for further assistance. Thank you!

title: Changed my life
body: This app is so great! I have lost 10 pounds with it so far and Iâ€™ve only been using it for a little over a month! I donâ€™t have the premium plan so you can lose weight on it without having to pay for it which is amazing! I will continue to use this app until I reach my goal weight and I truly believe I can do that using This app. I highly recommend this to anyone who wants to lose weight while still feeling in control with the classic weight loss plan.
response: Boom! Congratulations! You can be very proud of yourself! :)

title: Many errors in the food database
body: This has a beautiful Interface, super easy to use. However I really have many issues with their nutritional content, so if youâ€™re needing this for something like diabetes where youâ€™re doing insulin to carb ratioâ€™s, or specific dietary needs gastroparesis, reduced fat things, I donâ€™t think I would recommend it. There are many times where I will scan an item in and what presents on the screen is not what is on the label itâ€™s really strange. There are other things were a number of carbs the serving size whatever or just incorrect. Not just of labeled items but regular things like banana whatever. Anyway it doesnâ€™t work all that well when you donâ€™t have exactly the serving size and even then a lot of the time itâ€™s just not right. If you donâ€™t need that level of detail itâ€™s very easy to use and adds everything up for the day for the meal. They only offer one snack per day so if you have three small meals three small snacks, you just have to lump all your snacks into one snack. So if youâ€™re looking at your finger across the day itâ€™s a little in accurate. If it were only that I would recommend it, but there are too many other issues for me
response: Thank you for your feedback. Itâ€™s a big challenge for us to allow people all across the world to track their everyday foods. Our users have helped by contributing missing foods to our database. Unfortunately, these contributions can have errors, as you discovered. We are constantly working to fix these errors, we hope youâ€™ll try us again in future.

title: Needs an update!
body: I have used this app for about a year. It has helped me lose 52 pounds. The app works, so it gets 5 stars for working. However, I just upgraded my phone to an iPhone 12 Pro Max. I am finding several issues when going into certain screens where the text at the bottom if the screen is â€œrunning offâ€ the screen, and I am unable to get out of certain screens because the â€œXâ€ that you press to close the screen is in the upper left hand corner and it is partially off of the screen and you are unable to push it (the iPhone 12 Pro Max screen is .2â€ larger, so an update is needed.).
response: Hi Robert, thank you for your feedback. We are happy to hear you find the app helpful! Of course, we are very sorry to hear about the issues you are experiencing. We have sent your feedback to the teams in charge for their knowledge, and if possible it would be very helpful if you could send more details to contact@lifesum.com, such as: Lifesum version, OS version and screen shots describing the problem. Thank you so much and again, apologies for the inconvenience.

title: Iâ€™m FINALLY making progress with my weight loss
body: I really like this app, it might sound silly but I think part of why it really works for me is how good the app looks, and itâ€™s much simpler (in my opinion) than my fitness pal. Iâ€™ve read that the database isnâ€™t as big as MFP but I havenâ€™t run into any problems with being able to track my food or scan barcodes. When I first started using the app I lost 8 pounds in the first few weeks, so Iâ€™m finally under 160lbs! I havenâ€™t been very consistent recently but Iâ€™ve just picked it back up again tracking calories and staying under my daily goal. I also love how simple it is to track macros. Overall, Iâ€™ve been wanting to lose weight for YEARS and stop gaining 10lbs/year on average and this is the FIRST tool Iâ€™ve found that has actually helped me make progress. Only negative I have is the meals on the different plans canâ€™t be changed so I canâ€™t really do them because Iâ€™m allergic to shellfish (I could probably just substitute though LOL)
response: Thanks a bunch for your feedback! Congratulations! :)

title: Very Good, But Could Be Better
body: Iâ€™ve been using this app for a few weeks now, and have to say, the features this app sets out to do, it does very well. The recipes are great, being able to track your meals/diet/and even overall health is very impressive. The only place I would suggest change is, like many have said, the notifications. Unlike most of the other â€œsuggestive criticisms,â€ though, my chief complaint/wish is that there are never any â€œnight shift modeâ€ capabilities in health tracking. Many of us in healthcare like me and hundreds of other careers have had to switch their lives nocturnal. 24-hour gyms and grocery stores have helped, but there is still so much room for improvement! If there were just a way to tell the apps to switch from breakfast/lunch/dinner at 8-ish, 12-ish, and 6-ish to those equivalents during the night! Or for activity and sleep to be better tracked at the opposite â€œnormalâ€ time! Granted this isnâ€™t something Lifesum offers at all, but this is such a missed opportunity from health apps!
response: Many thanks for your review and feedback on Lifesum! Our developers are collecting all feedback here https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd - we really appreciate all ideas and suggestions for improvement!

title: Needs improvement
body: I think overall itâ€™s a good app. I canâ€™t afford the premium features so I basically have to ignore the day ratings. You canâ€™t customize the macro goals unless you have premium and mine are different from the ones they set for me. The one thing that really irks me is their meal rating system. It doesnâ€™t teach indulgence in moderation, which I think is key to maintaining a healthy diet, and it doesnâ€™t make a whole lot of sense. If you eat one sweet thing it ruins your entire meal rating. For example: I had scrambled eggs and protein powder in coffee this morning â€” it gave both of those an excellent rating on their own, but didnâ€™t give the meal as a whole a good rating because I hadnâ€™t consumed enough calories. Then I had half a serving of honey vanilla Greek yogurt and it gave it a :| rating, which then ruined my whole meal rating. And you can get an explanation for why things are rated that way unless you pay for premium. I try to get good ratings all day so it really bugs me when I get a bad one. Iâ€™m starting to just not take them seriously.
response: Thank you for your review - we appreciate your feedback and it will be shared with the team in charge, for future reference. Good luck with reaching your goal!

title: Just What I Needed
body: Iâ€™ve been struggling to hold myself accountable when it comes to eating healthy and exercising ever since I gave birth to my daughter last summer, but this app makes it possible to keep track of my calories, fat, protein and sugar intake on any given day, and keep track of my workouts and it has made a difference! The first 10 days of using it, I mostly focused on eating healthy and staying under my daily intake. I lost two pounds and have since incorporated working out in the past week and have lost an additional 1.5 pounds plus 1.25â€ off of my waist. My pants are beginning to get a little looser and my face is noticeably thinner as well. Iâ€™ve been using this app since May 17th and I am happy with my progress so far. I gave the app four stars, however, because Iâ€™m paying $21 for three months but the add-ons donâ€™t seem worth the money. Iâ€™m grateful for them but they are things so could have figured out with a quick google search. There are also not a whole lot of vegetarian recipes and many of them are not the healthiest.
response: Thank you very much for your review and for sharing your thoughts on our app! We are happy to hear that Lifesum is helping you towards a healthier lifestyle! Can you please send us screenshots showing the recipes in question through contact@lifesum.com so we can take a look at what you consider to not be the healthiest option? Thank you very much in advance!

title: Review and Comparison
body: Iâ€™ve compared this to other top food logging and calorie counter apps over the last three weeks and believe this one to have the best interface and work best with my needs and goals. It works to keep me accountable and mindful of my choices without restricting anything. I like that it connects to my Apple devices and adjusts my available calories based on exercise (the more I exercise, the more I canâ€™t eat)! That feature has been very helpful. The scan tool works mostly well but there have been several items not yet in their database. There is an option to help grow that if you take the time to enter in all the nutritional info on a package. The most difficult thing with this (and all the food logging apps) is entering in homemade food, e.g. the chicken noodle soup I made last Sunday... other than that, I give it 5 stars and will continue to use it. Itâ€™s  already had an impact on my lifestyle (and Iâ€™ve lost several pounds)!
response: We love to hear about your success with Lifesum! Keep it up!

title: Interface Design and Glitches Hamper Experience
body: I love this app and itâ€™s helped me get into the habit of tracking my meals, but every once in a while a poor design choice or glitch really hampers the experience.
response: Thank you so much for taking the time to leave your review and feedback, we much appreciate it and sent it through to the teams in charge for their knowledge.

title: Totally Inaccurate
body: Lifesum is beautiful and fun. But none of that matters because all the entries are inaccurate or straight up wrong. If Iâ€™m going to have the ease of using a barcode, why do I have to put in more work? If you want to be able to accurately measure and count calories, you should use grams. When I use grams on anything, the measurements are totally inaccurate. Theyâ€™ll make something that should be 200 calories look like 12,000 calories. Or something that should be 600 calories will come out to 3 calories, all because of inaccurate measurements on this app. Even the â€œverifiedâ€ entries are wrong. Sometimes Iâ€™ll Enter a meal and the calories wonâ€™t show up until I fully close the app and reopen. Today I tried to search for an item from McDonaldâ€™s, and all the entries were the meal without the biscuit. And even those entries didnâ€™t match! Iâ€™ve tried to continue to use the app because I was conned in to paying for a full year. (NOTE: when it says $3/month itâ€™s actually going to charge you for a whole year at one time.) Not worth it. Iâ€™ll take my losses and use an app thatâ€™s accurate and that doesnâ€™t make me angry because everything is hard to track and everything is just plan WRONG.
response: Thank you for your feedback and sorry to hear that you are not satisfied with our app. The reason we show the monthly cost, is for our users to see the difference in price from subscribing yearly and monthly. A monthly subscription is also available. We show you the total price before you pay. We are sorry if this wasn't clear enough. Our food database is partly user-created and that results in some items having inaccurate nutritional values. We recommend that you either select items verified by us or, for items that you cannot find in our database, create custom items under Favorites.

title: Beautifully Designed But Needs More
body: Iâ€™ve search the App Store for so many calorie counting and exercise tracking apps and Lifesum has made the biggest impact for me. The app design is visually appealing and really fun to use, which is important because calorie counting is not fun. This app makes it easy to ensure that you are meeting your goals.

title: Fix your app!
body: I love this app. However, I am not sure what is going on with it right now. The calories & names are all messed up & itâ€™s very discouraging to see that a cup of Oat blenders w/ Honey cereal are supposedly â€˜956 caloriesâ€™, and that a Danamal is 10+ calories than it actually is. I shouldnâ€™t have to find the exact calorie amount by doing math. The entire point of your app is as an easy way to track your diet, weight, progress, etc. Whatâ€™s the point if you canâ€™t even properly add up the total calorie intake??

title: Itâ€™s a good app, but thereâ€™s issues.
body: I really do like this app. Its colorful, positive, and helpful in tracking calories. However, if there is one thing that really ruins my experience, itâ€™s that you cannot view the nutritional values. It is illegal for packaging companies to withhold nutritional facts, and chain restaurants have to offer nutritional values for their food as well in order to â€œhelp Americans be healthyâ€. So why is an app, specifically designed for dieting withholding that information unless you pay for it? I think this is actually quite unjust. Yes, they do display protein, carbs, and fat, however the rest is blocked. The second problem with this app is that there is limited choices for entries. What I mean, is that if you try to log an exercise, there are many that are not included so you must guess on the amount of calories you burned. Additionally, many of the food values and/or portions are incorrect, and many foods are still not on there.
response: Our product team is collecting all user suggestions directly here: http://lifesum.uservoice.com/forums/274566-feedback-ideas/filters/top

title: Fantastic
body: This might be the first time Iâ€™ve ever written an app review but this app is amazing. As long as youâ€™re diligent with inputting the food you eat, it keeps track of everything for you. Calories, protein, carbs, fat, etc. It tailors all of it to the specific diet you choose and how much weight (if any) you want to lose, based on your height, weight, and timeframe. Beyond that, it gives you recipes, weekly ratings (in premium version, but the free version is well worth the download too) on how balanced and healthy your diet is, what you can improve on, and even gives you additional trackers for the areas youâ€™re working on. You get fun smiley faces to denote how healthy your food choices are. All in a wonderfully designed and eye pleasing package. They even include stickers too! Iâ€™ve already lost weight and feel better and I can sleep better at night being more aware of exactly what Iâ€™m eating. Canâ€™t recommend this app enough. Itâ€™s changing my life!

title: Great App, Could use some added features

I feel like thereâ€™s not a lot of customization there and the list of workouts to choose from is very odd. I also feel like theres some issues with entering food, I canâ€™t always find what Iâ€™m looking for and very often the things I eat donâ€™t have ratings. Iâ€™m vegetarian and sometimes I feel that this app doesnâ€™t understand that someone who is a vegetarian or vegan needs different things or nutrients than someone who eats meat. I also feel like the grading/motivation part of this app could use help. As someone who has struggled with eating disorders, the grading can make me feel bad about my eating choices. Other than those things, I think this app is probably the best among its competitors and it actually gives me insight on the food Iâ€™m putting into my body. Itâ€™s also very visually appealing and organized.

I love the barcode feature because I can keep track, step by step when Iâ€™m making my own meals. However, when Iâ€™m eating out, I would like the app to be ready to know and look up what Iâ€™m eating. It just makes it a little easier for the user to get an exact match to food while eating out. The other thing is workouts and calories burned. I wish the app would let you track workout videos and burned calories through trackers rather then estimating. It would be a really cool idea to insert a direct link to the video you did, so you can keep track of your fav workouts and closely monitor your progress with said workouts all in one app. Correct me if Iâ€™m wrong in thinking this way. Other than those issues I mentioned, itâ€™s a pretty cool simple, app to get dieting on track!!

I think that notifications such as reminders to drink more water would be way more beneficial, as I (and I know many others) always forget to drink enough. Also reminders to track food if youâ€™ve forgotten to that day would be great. Besides this issue I really do love this app. Iâ€™ve noticed these reviews get replied to quite often which I really appreciate, so Iâ€™m hoping this one will get a reply as well!

title: It needs some work
body: I am 14 and Iâ€™m overweight and trying to lose fat and gain muscle, so I tried this. For most parts of this app, I like it. I chose the high protein plan as it gives me energy to workout and keeps me full longer, but it wants me to eat 32g of protein a meal and 97g of protein for a snack. I couldnâ€™t handle it, eating that much protein made me feel awful and super full. I couldnâ€™t even finish my protein shake, which is very uncommon for me. And a lot of the foods I eat arenâ€™t recognized on the food searcher. I also wish I could do the thing with the meals but on the exercise option, like â€œwhat you did yesterdayâ€ instead of having to re-enter my exercise everyday. Overall I would recommend this to people who want to know more about healthy eating, but there are definitely some kinks that could be worked out.

title: It Works!!!
body: Before using LifeSum, I felt incredibly unhealthy, bloated, and tired all of the time. I was 5â€™6â€ and 125 pounds, which is considered to be â€œnormalâ€, but I noticed that my weight was only increasing and I started to gain a lot of weight in many areas of my body. I started using this app a month ago and I weighed myself this morning at 114 pounds. Turns out, the culprit for me gaining weight and feeling so terrible all of the time was my diet! Things I thought were healthy before were actually very unhealthy. LifeSum has shown me what is healthy and what is not, and it has also prevented me from overeating - something that I did all of the time. Thank you so much LifeSum! I feel much more energetic and more in shape after using this app. I now have a flat stomach and no double chin, so this app is a true miracle. Iâ€™m not even on the premium plan, so you can still lose weight without it! I highly recommend it!

title: Very Inaccurate

Even though I scanned the exact items I was using to try to make it more accurate, it was saying my bread had half the protein and double the calories is really has, then for my plant milk says it has 27 grams of protein instead of 10? Very confusing and completely wrong. It also gave a better rating to my vegan Caesar dressing than HALF of a small avocado and celery.. Also I put that my food preference was vegan and every single meal suggestion it gave me wasnâ€™t even vegetarian, they were all meat? Itâ€™s also inaccurate for the amount of protein you need, it shows that Iâ€™m low in protein because it says I need just under 100 grams a day which is literally double what I need for my weight? title: Useless unless you pay
body: Iâ€™ll be honest. The original reason I downloaded this app what is to integrate it with the Walgreens app in order to earn bonus points at that store. Once I open the app, I found it useless. I took all kinds of quizzes which were to determine my eating habits and to suggest diets. I canâ€™t imagine why eating vegetables watch a week or fruits just three times a week would indicate a balanced diet. Then it offered to give me suggestions. After every quiz, in order to get the answers or suggestions or meal plans or diet suggestions I was directed to sign up to get the paid version. This app is a complete rip off. I donâ€™t have to take the time to go onto my phone just to keep track of how many glasses of water I drink! I have chronic kidney disease and was looking for a few other suggestions. Since I have to pay for everything here, Iâ€™ll stick to the FREE Davita app. Itâ€™s easy to set your calorie goals (along with protein and other nutritional content). You donâ€™t have to have CKD to use Davita, either. Their food database is enormous. Lifesum (free) is useless in conjunction with the Walgreens app.

title: Beautiful design but everything costs money
body: Iâ€™ve been looking for a tracker to replace MyFitnessPal because Iâ€™m just over that app. I thought Lifesum would be the replacement but itâ€™s not. title: Pretty but not all powerful
body: I am trying the paid version of this app to help me complete my 3 week Keto diet. It has some great Keto recipes and gave me planned meals complete with a grocery list for the whole 3 weeks. I really like the look of this app, especially over MFP. However, I find myself unable to do all of the functions that I could in the former. Mostly, editing or even deleting a custom recipe/meal-- I can only add them not get rid of them. Most importantly however, there's issues transferring a tracked meal the app suggests from my paid meal plan into my food diary. The servings get all messed up and the nutritional information gets significantly reduced. This makes me go back and delete/"untrack" the meal and input it manually, which defeats the point of the feature. I really want to like this app but unfortunately I will not continue using it after my paid trial ends. Hopefully it can be updated in the future.

title: Really enjoying this app!

With other apps and services  I always felt there was an underlying judgement on how or what I ate, and the colors, icons etc. Implied negativity if I did something â€œwrong.â€

title: More than I hoped for!
body: Taking the time to explore a little I have found the free version of this app to be amazing!
response: Hi! We're happy to hear that you like our application! If you'd like a taste of what Lifesum Premium has to offer, feel free to reach out to contact@lifesum.com for a trial week.

title: Why canâ€™t you delete meals or food?
body: The premise of this app is great and when it starts listening to Apple health to factor in your exercises it really sets itself apart. Our issue appears to be more of a bug than a missing feature: you canâ€™t delete any meal once you add it. We are in a Keto focus and we cook all our meals from recipes we create (we have a personal menu). When we create a meal with all of the ingredients it exists in the â€œMealsâ€ section as a choice we have from now on to enter into our diary any given day we may have chosen to eat that meal. But there are meals we made years ago when we tried this app once and didnâ€™t know much about nutrition. And we canâ€™t delete them. A meal just consisting of black beans is in there forever cluttering the list and it canâ€™t be deleted. The same problem occurs in anything added in the food category. It makes daily use of this app cumbersome and overtime it will become so crowded that it will be unusable
response: Thank you for reaching out and leaving your feedback! In order to edit/delete food, meals, recipes created in Favourites please go to:

title: Beautiful UI but not remotely functional
body: Giving two stars for the UI. Very visually appealing. But not functional. Lots of basic issues that constrain functionality. 1) you must log water by 8.45 ounces and canâ€™t change that. 2) if you choose one of their diets, you canâ€™t edit the calories. I was on the 5:2 diet and it had me eating 1600 calories on non-fasting days. Iâ€™m doing 1400 calories, but thereâ€™s no way for me to change that. And none of their plans allow for different calorie goals for different days. 3) app crashes a couple times a day and I have to log out and log back in. 4) the food insights are very limited. They tell me my nutrients are imbalanced if my meal is a couple grams over/under with one macro. 5) most scanned foods come out with incorrect information. 6) canâ€™t move foods from meal to meal or day to day. 7) doesnâ€™t show you the foods you eat regularly, have scanned recently, or generally prefer over others. Even more issues, but this review is getting to long. Back to My Fitness Pal.
response: We are very sorry to hear that Lifesum was disappointing to you and we thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We have forwarded your review to our product team for future reference.

title: Love the app, but the bugs ruin it!
body: I really love the concept and aesthetics of this app- enough that I switched from MyFitnessPal as a long-time user. Problem is, more than half the time I go to search a food to add it to my meal or create a recipe, the search turns up blank. Thereâ€™s no error message, just no results. And Iâ€™m usually searching simple things like â€œAppleâ€ or â€œalmond milk.â€
response: Thank you for using Lifesum and our apologies for the error you're encountering! Can you please send us more details and some screenshots at contact@lifesum.com so we can look into it?

title: Great app with some annoying glitches.
body: I love this app. It is very easy to use and track with for my strict keto diet. My main issue is with adding foods for the next day. I often meal prep and input my food the day before so I can plan for the day ahead at work. However, many times I think I am putting in the food for the next day but the app adds the food to the current day instead. It happens over and over again and it takes me twice as long as it should to meal prep. I really hope this can be fixed or an option is added which allows you to change the day and/or meal on the food itself (the weight watchers app allows this).
response: We apologize for the issue you are experiencing. Please feel free and contact us with details, step description and screenshots at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Please also include phone model, OS and Lifesum version.Thank you!

title: Great but missing a few things
body: I do really like the app all together. Easy to use, great esthetic, good options for recipes. I will say though Iâ€™m a little surprised there is no paleo option and it feels super focused on Keto. Iâ€™m paleo based, so while I wanted to try out the plan choices, I just stuck with the classic because they arenâ€™t close enough. With options in recipes too, if they could add in an avoiding soy section, Iâ€™m sure a good portion of their users would appreciate it. I also wish I could customize the water tracker since I drink two 40 oz hydroflasks of water a day and it doesnâ€™t really let me accurately track that. And also the macro counter would let me input my macro goal since it was over 100% according to the app.. Iâ€™m in a bulking stage, so it was a little frustrating having to adjust it just to track in the app. Overall though I still like it better than MFP.
response: Thanks for the feedback! Please feel free to leave suggestions for improvement on our UserVoice: https://lifesum.uservoice.com

title: Itâ€™s okay
body: In terms of user friendly interface, itâ€™s perfect. Itâ€™s very appealing and simple to use and i love the personalized diet plans which are the only positives it has over the other app I am comparing it to. In terms of everything else, I truly prefer MyFitnessPal. I hate the fact you canâ€™t multi add foods when adding your meals for the day. The most irritating thing about this app is the lack of consistency/accuracy when tracking foods. It seems like most of the foods in this app arenâ€™t verified and are completely based off of users creations. MyFitnessPal adds a healthy mix of both verified foods and user added meals. For example, I had Chipotle for dinner and I wish I could be able to choose ingredients with verified nutritional facts from the restaurant. Also, itâ€™s unhealthy and irritating to be told to update your weight every single day. I did pay for the premium plan and so when that is over Iâ€™m heading back over to a MyFitnessPal.
response: Thank you for rating our app and sorry to hear that you are not satisfied! We have forwarded your feedback to the team.

title: Best nutrition app out there!
body: I can definitely say this is the best nutrition/logging app I have ever had. For a number of months I was in a bad relationship with foodâ€”I was a binger and a restricter. This app helped me overcome this so quickly. What's different about this app from others is that looks much more in-depth than most free nutrition apps. I recommend the subscription for the whole experience, but even without it, it's very helpful. I am now numerous weeks clean from binging because this app gives many more notes. It informs you for approximately how many calories you should be eating per meal, the balance of macros, and the nutrition/rating of food. It even gives you a complete rating for your meals and day! I've tried MyFitnessPal, but it never really gave as much info as this app. It really is a helpful app, and I completely recommend it!

title: Less data but more useful than other apps
body: Iâ€™ve tried all the big names in calorie tracking but this is the only app that actually encourages a healthy relationship with food, in my experience. With LifeSum, you get high-level overviews of what youâ€™re eating along with easy, actionable ways to improve your diet. By contrast, with MFP and Cronometer, I would often get so caught up in the minute details that I wouldnâ€™t know what to change in my diet. LifeSum strikes a much better balance of giving the details most people need without overwhelming you with data. I highly recommend LifeSum if youâ€™re someone who gets obsessive when using other apps because Iâ€™ve found it to be much gentler on my mental health (although please talk to a doctor if you have a history of disordered eating because any kind of calorie counting can be touchy)

title: Learning how to use this is key!
body: At first I gave this app a bad review because I honestly wasnâ€™t informed about how to use it. I was having difficulty adding my own items and macro information and I thought you couldnâ€™t. After getting some help, this app is seriously the best! All you have to do is scan a barcode and bam, all the info is in there and you can easily track what youâ€™re eating and your macros. Itâ€™s also extremely easy to add your own items if they arenâ€™t in the system, or if itâ€™s a home cooked meal you made. I highly recommend this app! Iâ€™m trying to lose weight in the new year, and this has really opened my eyes to how much fat and sugar and crap I was eating that I thought was healthy. This easily allows me to immediately see and track the nutritional value of what Iâ€™m putting into my body. I love it!
response: Amazing! Thank you Tina, that is music to our ears! Glad to hear you got the help you needed and that you find it helpful!

title: Good App, Could Use Some Improvements
body: I personally enjoy using this app, however I wish that it were able to compete with other food tracking apps a little better.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: pretty app, because database is inaccurate, macros calculated wrong :(
body: I have been using this app for two months. I really enjoy the looks of it, how fast it feels to log food and create meals. I have been eating keto, so I need my carbs to be low. You have the option of tracking net carbs, but sadly the data is not being processed correctly. For example any keto eater knows an avocado has a low amount of net carbs. about 4 per avocado. this app logs it as 17. it does not minus the fiber despite me confirming that I am tracking NET carbs. :/ so I cannot track my food. chia seeds it says a huge number of carbs. it does not minus the fiber. so basically if you need to know your true macros then this database is not so good. I redownloaded carb manager app today and wow the avocado has less than 4 grams net carbs. now I know I can eat it and not worry. and chia seeds is accurate on that app (carb manager app) too so I recommend switching to a better app and for the makers of this one to fix the data so it is not only an app with good looks. thank you.
response: We are sorry to hear this! Can you please send us more details and some screenshots showing the problem at contact@lifesum.com so we can have the team in charge look into it? Thanks in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: So many bugs, double or triple counts activity
body: I loved this app when I started using it, but the bugs with syncing exercise calories from the health app and Apple Watch make tracking a pain. For one run it shows three activities, so that a run that might have burned 300 calories shows as 900+ calories in the app. I used to be able to delete the duplicate entries, but they took away that option in one of the last couple â€œupgradesâ€. Now if I try to delete it just takes me into the exercise screen.
response: We deeply apologize for the issue you are experiencing. Please contact us with details, step description and screenshots at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Please also include phone model, OS and Lifesum version. Thank you!

title: I really get the value from Lifesum
body: When I'm good about tracking my food I get a lot of value from Lifesum. I miss when each meal had a letter grade instead of just a smiley face, it helped me understand my choices better.
response: Thank you very much for your review and for sharing your request with us! Our developers are collecting all feedback here http://bit.ly/2v7FxBv - we really appreciate all ideas and suggestions for improvement. Thanks in advance and good luck with your goal! :)

title: Very good app. Easier to navigate than Myfitness pal
body: App has a great look to it with fluid changing colors and cartoonish characters and animated vegetables. Itâ€™s very motivational and clicking on the water icons to report your hydration instantly gives a feeling of satisfaction. You can take pics of food to help you figure out calorie content. My only complaint is that the search feature is very lacking. It can be difficult to find what you are in the apps recorded selection of food. This makes the barcode feature important but so many things have not been scanned by other users that you often have to stop and take time to fill out the information for a â€œnewâ€ item of food yourself. This issue will go away when more people start using the app however. I found this app when apple recommended it on its health app.
response: Thanks for your review! Yes, due to our food database being partly user-created, some items may have inaccurate nutritional values. We recommend that you either select items verified by us or, for items that you cannot find in our database, create custom items under Favorites. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp. Good luck with your goal!

title: Would like to see Paleo option
body: I like the app the interface is clean and premium is cheap with the deals which I like. Seems like they bulked up their database so far everything that Iâ€™ve eaten has popped up which is also a plus for me. I appreciate the tips and weekly summaries, they are surprisingly helpful and and help keep you focused if you are determined.
response: Thanks for the feedback! Please feel free to leave suggestions for improvement on our UserVoice: https://lifesum.uservoice.com

title: Great App for Tracking Eating Habits
body: This is a great app for keeping track of your eating habits. Iâ€™m using it to evaluate what food I intake, the nutritional content of those foods, and how I can eventually make better choices. HOWEVER, if you are expecting to use Appleâ€™s Health app to sync data from Lifesum (which the app claims to do), then skip it. While Lifesum does record and sync data to Health, its consistency is not reliable at all. Data may sync to the Health app for a couple of days, but for some reason, it will skip other days entirely. But more annoyingly, on days that it decide to sync data, it will sometime not sync every category which you have selected (i.e. water intake, sodium, sugar, etc.). Additionally, the app will sometimes glitch and erase data which you have recorded INSIDE of the app itself. Itâ€™s unfortunate because I really enjoy this app and it has contributed greatly to changing some bad aspects of my eating habits. Hopefully these issues are addressed because the app is worth it.
response: Thank you very much for your review! We are awfully sorry for the inconvenience!

title: Just minor inconveniences.
body: I used this app the last time I lost a bunch of weight and it really helped, life stuff happened and I ended up gaining most of it back so I'm on the journey again and decided to purchase the premium version of the app. It's very detailed and beautiful, but there are things that drive me nuts, like seriously tracking water is a pain, I have a 24oz bottle I keep at my desk, but I can't customize my bottle size properly to track this, I find myself downloading a different app to track water. Also, the whole â€taking a picture of your foodâ€ thing is so pointless it never works and I have to change its predictions anyways. Instead, can I just take a picture of the recipe I used then enter in how many servings it makes and state how much I ate, viola! I have been so frustrated with that. I will change my rating later because I really do enjoy the app it just isn't quite perfect yet. Thanks for reading.
response: We deeply apologise for the issue! The team has already found the reason for the problem and is working on a fix for it. A new version with the solution will be published as soon as possible!

title: Seems latest update has screwed things up
body: I havnt had issues with this app like this before and I've use this off and on for years. The data is now all messed up. First i noticed that the calories per meal didn't equal the number of calories left for the day... then one day i opened the app and all my data was just gone. It didn't remember my goals, it was giving me ads to purchase premium even though it says in the settings its still registering me as a premium member... it wont grab the data for my weight properly from the health app... and right now, i open the app, haven't used it all day no data at all in it and its saying i can only eat 6 more calories today.......??? The whole thing is just all screwy. Im just going to do a reset of my data on the account and see if that helps me until they fix the issue but... yeah, this bug is making this app completely useless to me right now.
response: Thank you very much for contacting us!

title: BUY PREMIUM! -Broke College Kid
body: I had this app for months before I caved and bought the premium version. The free version is nice for basic food tracking purposes, but if you are really looking for an easy way to learn more about your health GET THE PREMIUM VERSION! This is coming from someone who has tried numerous diets and researched healthy eating immensely for over a year. This has made it so much easier to eat balanced meals. I start off with what I know I want to eat and it will tell me if I need to add more fat or protein and whatâ€™s good and bad about the food. Iâ€™ve been using the premium version for 3 days and have already learned so much! The life scores are very motivating. I see myself sticking with this for a while. It DID take me a while to figure out the layout of the app. But give it time, you wonâ€™t regret it!
response: Thank you so very much for your positive feedback! We are very happy to read that you are satisfied!

title: Works well enough
body: This is great for tracking calories and planning out meals in advance. As long as you have a good scale and measuring cups youâ€™ll be able to get a pretty accurate calorie count. I tend to ignore the food ratings it gives me, Iâ€™ve made veggie stir frys and things that I know are healthy but it will give me a poor rating because there isnâ€™t enough calories or protein or whatever. Thatâ€™s fine, I donâ€™t rely on those. My only major issue is that it doesnâ€™t show calories burned while sleeping, sitting, etc from my Fitbit in the calories burned section, it adds them to â€œcalories leftâ€ so I have to switch between apps to figure out my caloric deficit. Also, I canâ€™t manually add workouts to increase my life score because it will add calories that I didnâ€™t actually burn, so I guess I have to ignore the life score as well. Not really sure why I bought the premium.

title: Frustrated
body: I really need help in general which is impossible to ask questions is there an email I can have to avoid all this??? I need to delete a â€œbody measurementâ€ and I canâ€™t. Itâ€™s asking what units so I put the units because it was already in inches and there was no input for my number. So now my units are numbers. Says my hips are 37 37. Secondarily I canâ€™t add the photo to my snack I just made a meal, after I just took the photo, I wouldnâ€™t have thought to take it twice in a row/ there are a lot of things about this I might need to press for a refund for like ..... what meal plan? There are recipes to chose from ? So I'm confused thatâ€™s not a meal plan lol am I not understanding or is there a setting to put on. It keeps asking me the quiz like no I chose already I want it all laid out for me. Might as well use my fitness pal it is much more user friendly these apps are annoying as is. I really want to continue to use this app though because I already invested the past two hours into it.
response: Hi there, thank you for reaching out to us! Please email us with your details at contact@lifesum.com and we will assist you! Thank you!

title: Almost perfect, BUT...
body: I love this app. Like, seriously am in love with this app and have recommended it to multiple people at this point! However, I wish it were possible to customize the plans a tiny bit further by being able to select how many meals or snacks I have in a day (having the choice to modify plans to have 3-5 smaller meals and/or snacks in a day would be amazing). One of my prescriptions is an appetite suppressant, so I sometimes find it really difficult to feel comfortable and not too full after eating a meal, unless I take about an hour to eat it (which is something I simply donâ€™t have time for). I also wish that plans could automatically adjust macro counts if I have a super-high protein/lower fat or carb meal in the day. But, I have to say, this app makes it SO easy to know whatâ€™s good and whatâ€™s not-so-good for me and why, and I love it nonetheless.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback and your review! We will make sure that it reaches the responsible teams.

title: Pretty good
body: Iâ€™ve been using the app for a week on the strict keto diet.
response: The verified foods are from several food databases: the USDA, food items from Livsmedelsverket in Sweden, from the UK Food Standards Agency and the BLS from Germany.

title: SUPER Helpful!
body: I had been trying for an entire YEAR to lose the (I call it) â€œHappyâ€ weight from my marriage. I found this app & started tracking my meals & I noticed that I was getting better about not impulsively eating because I was a little hungry. Iâ€™ve also gotten better about making sure I drink enough water with the help from Lifesum!
response: Thanks for the positive feedback! We are very happy to read that.

title: Misleading Free Info! Iâ€™m angry!
body: I donâ€™t like giving my permission for Facebook or signing up with my email without knowing what an app offers for Free. I thought I would be able to at least see recipes. And, oh, yes, you can see recipes - the title, nutrition, calories- a teaser!! You canâ€™t actually see the ingredients or instructions without a Premium membership!!!! In fact, you canâ€™t do anything, but manually add items, without an annoying pop up demanding a membership! What a waste of my time. Now I have to go find out how to delete permissions in Facebook. If you want money, then TELL ME that the free version is useless. I could have found many other apps or ways to manually add tracking data. I am not a serial 1 Star review.  Iâ€™m more of a serial 5 Star reviewer, but Iâ€™m sick of apps acting like there is a free version that offers whatâ€™s in the advertisement (and Premium stands for extra, valuable services.) The Premium in this app means you canâ€™t do any of the advertised services without paying! Thatâ€™s not what Premium means.
response: Thanks for rating our app. Our free version provides all tools for basic tracking and helps you reach your goal successfully and upgrading to Premium is not necessary for many users. We do appreciate your feedback!

title: Life Changing
body: I usually donâ€™t write reviews, but this is literally the best app Iâ€™ve ever bought. Iâ€™m 14 and I want to lose 15 lbs in a healthy way. It gave me a 15 week period and I thought â€œokay thatâ€™s reasonableâ€, but then I started using it and itâ€™s motivated me so much Iâ€™ve lost 6.2 lbs, itâ€™s been 2 weeks. I honestly wouldnâ€™t be nearly as motivated to use it if it wasnâ€™t such an enjoyable of an experience. The design is flawless and the little icons are adorable. I love using the barcode scanner, then I donâ€™t have to figure out if I actually ate what I logged. The life rating is really motivational, and ever since I had a day tracker for fruit and a weekly tracker for seafood, Iâ€™ve been eating lots more of those.
response: We are very happy to hear that Lifesum has contributed to your healthier lifestyle and we thank you very much for your awesome review and feedback! Good luck with reaching your goal :-)

title: Guiding me down the path to success
body: So, I am an overweight looser with dreams of getting back into shape so I can join the military and get my dream career. I searched all over for apps that would give me lots of customization and data related to my weight loss and this has been the best one so far.
response: Thank you very much for your rating and for your feedback! We wish you all the best with reaching your goal!

title: MyFitnessPal is easier and more accurate
