body: (Iâ€™m using the premium version) While I love Lifesum because of the coaching and keeping macro and micronutrients monitored, the actual food logging needs a LOT of work. Unlike MyFitnessPal, which is the easiest food logging Iâ€™ve ever done, Lifesum is not only difficult in finding the food youâ€™re trying to log (they donâ€™t have the database that MFP has), but the serving sizes and entering the amount youâ€™re eating is more often in grams instead of cups or the MUCH easier options on MyFitnessPal. A lot of the nutrition information is also wrong, meaning that I have toggle with the â€œamountâ€ of food that I ate in order to get the calorie count correct. I also donâ€™t love the often negative feedback that pops up if you occasionally eat something thatâ€™s non-nutritious. Because of this, Iâ€™ll likely be canceling my subscription at the end of the 3 months and looking back at MyFitnessPal.
response: Our product team is collecting all user suggestions directly here: http://lifesum.uservoice.com/forums/274566-feedback-ideas/filters/top

title: Almost perfect!
body: I was looking for an app to focus more on healthy food choices than calorie counting and yes, something prettier than MFP. I found it! I LOVE the water and veggies and fruit trackers. The only tweaks I'd make:
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! That is highly appreciated!

title: Wrong Nutritional Info for SCANNED Items
body: My food was cold and I had to reheat by the time I worked out all the problems with this app. I got this yesterday. Got suckered into the 3 month subscription by all of these false reviews (or perhaps completely clueless people). It allows you to scan items and just move along to add them to your food tracking. However serving sizes are wrong, calories wrong, sugars, proteins, fatsâ€”everything. Itâ€™s different things for different items but when you look it over there is always something that is off. You literally need to sit there and go through every item even serving size, if it is tsp or tbsp to make sure the scanned item is right. I Deleted the app. Iâ€™ll be asking for my money back but this trash app and itâ€™s lazy developers will probably tell me I canâ€™t..just like they canâ€™t get the correct nutritional info off a label. These apps are total gimmicks. My back up plan after â€œbeing hadâ€ is salad and running aroundâ€”could have spent the subscription on vegetables.
response: Thank you for review and sorry to hear that you had a bad experience with our app! Feel free to contact us through contact@lifesum.com if you need assistance with your subscription.

title: great concept with some key problems
body: I would love this app and service if it were to fix a few important issues. Its integration with other apps like mySugar is a great idea, but itâ€™s limited in some ways. 1) The inability to make necessary adjustments to information such as meal time. This is an unnecessary constraint on a paid app. I use lifesum to track and plan my meals along with my insulin intake, and this restriction on specifying meal times makes much of my data charts worthless. 2) When exporting the carb counts to other apps, it automatically excludes carbs that it has not verified, even if I have entered the numbers myself. There should at least be the option to include all data. 3) The app is often buggy. It crashes upon opening, and food input sometimes simply doesnâ€™t work. Clicking to add an item results in a blank field that then disappears. A paid app should not have these problems.
response: We apologize for the issue you are experiencing. Please contact us with details, step description and screenshots at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Please also include phone model, OS and Lifesum version. Thank you!

title: Almost there
body: For this type of app, itâ€™s so important to have a beautiful, delightful, fun to use interface. This appâ€™s definitely got that. Youâ€™ll be looking forward to using it every morning, noon, and night. Iâ€™m starting keto and the recipes have been so helpful for me as a beginner to know what to eat.
response: We deeply apologize for the issue you are experiencing. Please contact us with details, step description and screenshots directly through the app under Settings/Support > click on the contact option in one of the FAQ articles -  so we can start investigating your issue. Thank you!

title: Food choices have wrong numbers
body: EDIT: the company reached out and showed me where I could change numbers that were put in by other people. They said I need to let them know about mistakes if the problem is on their side. Iâ€™ve learned how to put in my own recipes so this helps tremendously. Iâ€™m keeping this app as itâ€™s been a better help to me than any of the others Iâ€™ve used.
response: The verified foods are from several food databases: the USDA, food items from Livsmedelsverket in Sweden, from the UK Food Standards Agency and the BLS from Germany.

title: Big fan! But can always improve :)
body: I love this app! It makes starting a Keto diet super easy. It scans barcodes so well, has so many foods in its database. I love that you can adjust the measurements of foods, ie grams ounces tbsp etc, so you can track accurately.
response: It is possible to edit and delete any item you have created in Favorites. If that is not possible, please contact us with more details directly at contact@lifesum.com

title: Best thing that happened to me
body: I was pretty overweight when I downloaded this app. I decided to use it and stick with it. I paid for the 1year subscription and stuck with it. I tracked most of the days, forgot to track a few. I lost 64 pounds in a little over a year. The best part about this app is it teaches you so much about nutrition. Enough that now I donâ€™t even have to track my calories because I can maintain my weight with my own judgement. I still use it though because I have a few more pounds to lose and then I will see how it does with gaining muscle mass. I just love the interface and the ratings as smiley faces, it makes it simple to use. I just want to say thank you to the app developers because of you all my life is tremendously better.
response: We are extremely happy to hear that our app has contributed to your healthier lifestyle and we thank you very much for your 5 star review!

title: Nice, but a bit biased.
body: Iâ€™ve been eating healthy and tracking my health for a long time, so I know when something is a little spotty. This app is great for tracking and recommending certain things for my goal weight. However, when I first logged my morning fatty coffee as my breakfast, it gave me the â€œokayâ€ symbol. I donâ€™t pay for premium, but it seems to me that the picture of the fruit and bread are recommended as a â€œhappy faceâ€. As someone who is going to school for nutrition and has a few friends and family who have tested all sorts of things; with different weights, metabolisms, and health, we all can agree that carbs and even protein are not good for us in the least by not raising our insulin too much. Iâ€™m not keto, but I have everything in moderation. So I think that this should be updated or have more research put into it other than what the government or food industry thinks or portrays as â€œhealthyâ€.
response: Many thanks for your review! Food rating depends on many factors. Please, find out more here https://bit.ly/2iVK9WL. Feel free to send us more details at contact@lifesum.com in case you have further questions.

title: Too many issues - Customer Support severely lacking
body: Switching AppleIDs as part of a phone upgrade caused issues with the app. The watch app doesnâ€™t work smoothly and doesnâ€™t update always. Contacted support for each of these with a wait time of over a WEEK for initial response each, and the responses werenâ€™t helpful. The food database is lacking (still new I guess compared to my fitness) - A lot of the items are way off on accurate nutrition, and it allows you to flag them - had to flag a lot. The barcode scan works pretty well. The app does look and feel nice. But it doesnâ€™t come close to Fitness Pal food database and functionality and lack of issues... canceled subscription for this and renewed my fitness pal membership - works flawlessly now. I honestly would have stuck with it had customer support not been so horrible. But I would rather trash 11 months of a subscription than to continue with Lifesum (so I did).
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: The app is great but it needs some work
body: Iâ€™m on the keto burn plan and i like the app a lot, but there are some points that needs to be fixed. First, the recommended daily meal plan in the keto burn have more carbs and or protein or calories than i need, so if i go with the recommended meals i would be exceeding my limits of carbs or protein, the recipes are great i like them but they donâ€™t suit my plan. I mean i can choose only one and plan the rest of the meals of the day myself. Second, sometimes when i log food it counts more carbs/protein/calories then i have to close the app and open it again or delete the food and re-log it again. And the numbers keep changing inaccurately sometimes. Third, i canâ€™t decide the amount of water in my glass or bottle my self because the bottles we have in my country are either 330ml or 600ml. Other than that the app is really nice and i hope you work more on it.
response: Thank you for your feedback, it is really appreciated! Our developers are collecting all feedback here https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd - we really appreciate all ideas and suggestions for improvement! Regarding the second issue, can you please send us more details and some screenshots showing the problem at contact@lifesum.com so we can have the team in charge look into it? Thanks in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Has the potential to be a really good diet app
body: This app looks nice and is generally easy to use but thereâ€™s a few things that get me frustrated while using it. Iâ€™ve only been using it for 9 days and I paid extra for premium.
response: Our product team is collecting all user suggestions directly here: http://lifesum.uservoice.com/forums/274566-feedback-ideas/filters/top

title: Almost perfect!
body: I recently got an Apple Watch and wanted an app where I could track calories and macros. UX/UI is a big deal to me, and this app is one of the best looking calorie trackers out there! (It seriously blows the socks off Myfitnesspal.)

title: Love the app overall
body: This app is great for tracking my food and learning how to build healthier habits! It functions well and it makes things really simple to use. One thing I would love to see if more integration with recipe apps. Eating healthily includes a lot of cooking at home for me and being newer to living on my own, Iâ€™m following lots of new recipes and sometimes itâ€™s hard to find something similar to track and logging individual ingredients or recipes can be very time consuming. One great app Iâ€™ve found for healthy recipes is Mealime. Definitely recommend integration because they list full detailed nutritional facts and tons of healthy and easy recipes. Even a simple way to allow Apple health to write food entry data combined with in app tracking because most recipe apps will allow you to track to Apple health.
response: Thank you so much for your feedback! Great to hear that you are enjoying the app.

title: Keeps getting worse!
body: Iâ€™ve had this app for about 3yrs or so now. Iâ€™ve had the free version and the year subscription. At first it was great but over the last couple years instead of improving itâ€™s gotten worse. The app deleted all my previous data so I couldnâ€™t see what I added a month ago, you use to be able to go back a year and see all data. It has reset my updated weight over and over again making it impossible to keep track. The app deletes food youâ€™ve already logged for the day so that you have to keep adding it. You try to scroll down past lunch area and it gets stuck to where you canâ€™t see dinner or snacks.  Now today I tried to log my breakfast and lunch and the app wonâ€™t even respond. You go in to add the food and click ok and it doesnâ€™t register at all. The app even deleted half of yesterdayâ€™s meals. Iâ€™ve loved this app and it helped me lose over a hundred pounds but sadly now Iâ€™ve deleted it because it doesnâ€™t work anymore! Iâ€™m truly disappointed!!
response: We deeply apologize for the recent issue.

title: Nutritional information absolutely wrong.
body: Though this App is beautiful and it syncs to all your tracking devices AND itâ€™s easy to use, do not be fooled. This App has a vast log of
response: Thank you for your feedback!

title: Customer service Vs bugs
body: My issue with this application is that my goal was constantly getting reset from losing weight to gaining weight. My weight would constantly be reset to zero, and my meals would just delete by themselves. I reached out to customer service but they were no help. Finally I decided to delete the application and reinstall it onto my phone only to find out that I could not restore my previous purchase of premium. After several emails to customer service I still have not received a refund. Itâ€™s fine, I donâ€™t need the money back, but in my opinion customer service is lacking. The application is great I loved how it graded food so I knew which foods are good and which foods were bad but the bugs cause me to cancel my premium membership. This is just my experience Iâ€™m sure others have had positive experiences, mine has just been quite buggy and annoying with customer service.
response: We are very sorry to hear that you feel that way. Please contact us at contact@lifesum.com with more details about your experience so we can understand better what you do not like about the app.

title: Best honest app!!!
body: I found this app having a great ux design and a beautiful graphic design. One of my fav apps. What I love the most is that the free version is as good and efficient and resourceful as the premium . I absolutely recommend the free version at the beginning, you will fall in love with the app and its features so much that you will need to buy the premium that itâ€™s just like having a personal coach 24/7. In the past I had very bad experience with another app that took my money and never heard back from them. Even if I ask for rectification. Lifesum is an honest app they donâ€™t take your money for nothing. You pay when you want and they give you the best they can offer that is top. I keep using this app since 2015 it just keeps improving.
response: Thank you so much for sharing your positive feedback, we really appreciate it! We are delighted to hear that you are satisfied with your Lifesum experience! Many thanks!

title: Great but missing one thing...
body: So far using this app has been really intuitive and fun! Itâ€™s so easy to track your meals and water, I really appreciate the wide range of excellent recipes and that you can add the ingredients to a shopping list. The only thing I wish that this app had was a feature where you could make your own recipes. I do a lot of cooking and have used calorie counting apps before that let you add all of the ingredients to a custom dish or recipe along with how many serving that you prepared and calculates the calories that you consumed per serving. I havenâ€™t seen this feature on this app so I just enter the calories per serving as a custom item but it doesnâ€™t include any of the nutritional information. I really appreciate that the keeps track of and sets goals for your nutrition but I feel like when I prepare my own recipes I miss out on that feature.
response: Many thanks for your review and positive feedback! You can create your own recipes - as well as meals, food items and exercises - under Me > Favorites. You can find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp. All the best with reaching your goal!

title: Without Premium, thereâ€™s no point.
body: I initially downloaded this app because I wanted to lose a bit of weight and monitor my calorie and water intake, but after having this app for a few weeks, it has no purpose. The app gave me a suggestion of approximately 1700 calories per day and 8 glasses of water. On most days, I like almost all of what I eat-with the exception of foods that arenâ€™t listed-and at times I find myself going over the calorie limit, or not drinking enough, or getting a less than satisfactory rating on some of my meals, and what Iâ€™ve noticed is that the app recognizes this, but does nothing to help me do better. Even a more in depth analysis of what you ate that day is restricted unless you have premium. Over the past couple of weeks Iâ€™ve formed some unhealthy habits that the app recognizes, but does nothing to help me break the habits, or give me tips to eat healthier.
response: Thank you very much for your review - your feedback is very appreciated! Can you please reach out to us through contact@lifesum.com with your personal details and the goal you have set so we can look into this for you and further assist you? Thank you in advance!

title: Great app with a few personal drawbacks
body: Iâ€™ve used this app for a little while now and Iâ€™m really enjoying it! The layout is nice, the style is sleek, and itâ€™s helping me track everything!
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! Can you please send some screenshots showing the issue you're referring to with the Daily Progress feature so we can take a look? You can contact us through contact@lifesum.com. Thanks in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Good but needs work
body: I really love this app and I love how easy it is to keep track of macros. However, keeping track of some foods is really difficult because the serving sizes just donâ€™t make sense on the app so Iâ€™m stuck either weighing everything I eat or doing complicate conversions. My fitness pal is much easier to use because there are many different serving size options. My main point is that when I scan some barcodes, none of the serving sizes come up that are on the packaging. When scanning a barcode it should come up with the same serving size that is on the packaging. Itâ€™s hard to choose which app to use because Iâ€™m trying to gain muscle mass and both apps arenâ€™t really amazing at it. Please fix the serving size issue. I donâ€™t want to have to do a bunch of math every time I eat.
response: Thank you very much for reaching out and leaving your feedback.

title: More features
body: I normally do not write reviews, but I figured I would add some commentary/suggestions and also what I have found that I do like at this point. The app is pretty easy to use, has a decently large database of foods you can search/scan and can be motivating. However, I would LOVE if there was a breastfeeding/pregnancy feature. Pregnant people are meant to GAIN weight and apps like this definitely donâ€™t encourage that, even if itâ€™s necessary for a developing fetus. While breastfeeding, you also canâ€™t lose weight too quickly or else you risk completely tanking your milk supply. Iâ€™ve tried to use the suggested amount of calories but every time I do that, I notice the amount of milk I produce plummets quite quickly.
response: Many thanks for your rating and feedback! Please, check out this article https://bit.ly/34rLwhV on how to use our app while pregnant or breastfeeding! Also, our developers are collecting all feedback here https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd - we really appreciate all ideas and suggestions for improvement!

title: So close to perfect
body: This is a really fantastic and easy to use app for anyone whoâ€™s seriously committed to their diet. I recently started a strict keto diet and this has been invaluable for helping me keep very close track of exactly what Iâ€™m consuming. Thereâ€™s even a feature that can tell you what percentage of your daily intake has been composed of protein, carbs, and fat! The only way this app falls a little short is it sometimes just doesnâ€™t work. Often times Iâ€™ll log a food in, and then it simply does not calculate into the log, as if I didnâ€™t just go in and take that action. It gets a little annoying since itâ€™s pretty common and the whole point of this app is to successfully log my food. But with all the other benefits this has to offer and the attractive design, Iâ€™m so grateful for lifesum!

title: Too Much Tied Into Premium
body: I was looking for an app to replace MyFitnessPal, which is a good app but boring and outdated. This looked like a winner at first, it has a great layout and design. But there are features that require membership when they should be basic. The two biggies are 1. No daily nutritional information (I have potassium issues and I need to see that info) and 2. You canâ€™t modify your daily intake (macros) based on your needs/desire without paying for Premium. For instance, it locks you into a â€œClassic Planâ€ that has macros and a calorie count that doesnâ€™t fit with my current lifestyle and I canâ€™t adjust them because itâ€™s locked into a membership. With most other apps, including MyFitnessPal, these options are both included for free and pretty basic features. This app is basically a pretty calorie tracker without Membership. I guess if you want your meal plan and dietary needs dictated to you then this app is for you.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback, this is very appreciated! We will inform responsible team regarding your feedback.

title: Love it, but one small bug
body: I've been using Lifesum for about 10 days now, and I really enjoy using it. It's simple, and easy to use. My goal with Lifesum is to help me eat more, since I under eat a lot. While my under eating problems have been getting better since using Lifesum, there is one bug that kinda annoys me. Whenever I log a meal, it says that it is a few calories under, which is a really helpful aspect of this app. Sometimes, this feature bugs out, and gives the incorrect number of calories under. For example, if I log 200 calories of food, it will say that I am 200 calories under the minimum goal, which isn't true. Hopefully this bug will be fixed soon, because it's really driving me crazy.
response: Es tut uns leid zu hÃ¶ren, dass Du dieses Problem hast!

title: Sadly, requires reading glasses
body: I want this app! But Iâ€™m not willing to carry reading glasses. This style of typography is OK for print publications, because you get in the habit of putting reading glasses on the coffee table. But, with an app you use for a few seconds, multiple times per day, reading glasses arenâ€™t an option. Sure, I could use Appleâ€™s accessibility zoom, but again, with something you need to see, multiple times per day, itâ€™s not a viable option. Just design it to be legible out of the box. I have to believe that even your younger customers will appreciate better legibility. Trust me, it can be done tastefully.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We are glad to hear that you are interested in our app, and we will have that in mind to our next update. Thanks again.

title: Doesnâ€™t save any details entered
body: Update: There has been an update to the app. It is working better now but still wonâ€™t stay connected to the Apple Health App. Every morning I must go into the settings and resync it to the health app to count my steps. Other this issue I really the free version of the app. When you sync it the your Apple Health app it will bring across all the food nutrients you consume. I will wait till this is fixed to determine if I will pay for the extras.
response: We apologize for the issue you are experiencing. Please contact us with details, step description and screenshots at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Please also include phone model, OS and Lifesum version. Thank you!

title: Limited choice
body: I have premium membership and I been using this around week.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! That is appreciated.

title: Great, but canâ€™t adjust your individual calories if 5:2 diet
body: I really enjoy using this app and even got the year long subscription. It allows me to find new recipes and try new diets to see what works for me. Also really love syncing it with my health app to show how many calories Iâ€™ve burned with walking. Two complaints though if you choose the 5:2 diet, it will only show you low calorie recipes for those 500 calorie days. However, I want healthy recipe ideas for every other day too. In addition, youâ€™re not allowed to adjust the calories you need in this diet. It wants me to do 1550 calories 5 days out of the week to â€œget a better day ratingâ€ but that would be overeating for a person my size! Hopefully you can fix because I love trying the regular recipes as well as the 5:2 recipes.
response: Hi there, thank you so much for your review! We are happy to read you enjoy our app! Regarding changing you calorie goal you can adjust it by going to Me>Settings (top left corner) After that tap on Personal Details under Settings. To change your calories per day goal, tap on Calories / day and overwrite the given value. Save the new number by tapping on 'Save'. Please consider that we calculate the energy (kcal) recommendation though the Harrys Benedict equation. This is a validated formula that gives a BMR value (basic metabolic rate). Depending on what activity level and goal the user then chose, we get the total energy recommendation. If you need further assistance please contact us at contact@lifesum.com. Thank you!

title: Too much premium
body: I love this app because it is so easy and that it helps in a lot of ways but the reason why I donâ€™t like it is because that there isnâ€™t much for a person who doesnâ€™t want to pay for premium to do. Say for the recipes all of them are for the premium members. I am a person who likes to try things but I didnâ€™t want to spend my money on this because I know Iâ€™m not getting much from it. So I would just like there to be more things for people who arenâ€™t going to pay for the premium member ship. I know the whole point in having a member ship is for a person to purchase it and have everything but I just feel like you should give a bit more things for people who donâ€™t pay because almost everywhere I like it pops out with paying for the premium.
response: We are charging for some of our features in order to cover our running expenses, which include a team of designers, developers and nutritionist and a total of over 75 employees. Thanks for your understanding! Feel free to send us your registered email through contact@lifesum.com for a free trial!

title: Solid app; rough around edges
body: I went from LoseIt to MFP to Lifesum.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We will inform the responsible team regarding your feedback.

title: Whoâ€™s reviewing this food?
body: Giving this 3 stars because I got a free trial of Premium and it was much better. Then when the trial ran out all it did was count up calories and basic nutrients like sodium and sugar.
response: Hi there, thank you for your feedback!

title: Regret I paid for premium
body: I really want to like this app because it is very attractive, unlike MFP.  However, it needs a lot of work, especially the recipe function.  First, I found a lot of mistakes in the database, too few/many calories etc, and no way to report errors, unlike MFP.   Next, the recipe function keeps making the app crash and when I finally get a recipe entered, there is no way to edit it later.  For instance, you use a different brand a cheese the next time you make it, you canâ€™t correct the calories/nutrition. Next, there is no website availability so you have to enter recipes in the app and personally, I can type much faster in a keyboard than a mobile device.  Last, but not least, there is no recipe import function so you do HAVE to enter each ingredient and instructions by hand, unlike MFP.  So while MFP may not have the glitzy, cutesy presentation, it is HANDS DOWN a much more functional app even without paying for their premium membership.
response: Hi there, we are sorry to hear that you feel this way but thank you for your feedback! Regarding the database and reporting errors there is a function for that; When you're in detailed view of a food item, please scroll down to the bottom of the page until you see the Report button. Tap on it and choose one of the five options available and click on Next to come to the next page where you can enter details. Then send the error report by clicking on Submit.

title: Premium = fraud
body: Invested in premium thinking it was the way to go per the way itâ€™s sold, 1: being after the purchase was made I was charged the full amount, yet when the subscriptions are displayed it makes it seem like youâ€™re paying a small amount for the months you choose. Not the full price!
response: Thank you for your feedback and sorry to hear that Lifesum didn't meet your expectations. The reason we show the monthly cost, is for our users to see the difference in price from subscribing yearly and monthly. A monthly subscription is also available. We show you the total price before you pay. We are sorry if this wasn't clear enough. Please, make sure to send us your registered email address through contact@lifesum.com so we can help you with a refund - thanks!

title: Useless compared to my fitness pal
body: I started using this app because I thought the interface was more aesthetically pleasing than my fitness pal. I was so excited that I even bought the yearly subscription. After a day I regretted it. The food database is incomplete and not accurate. For example I was tracking for a few days and was wondering why it said my fats were so high...it said a serving of grilled chicken breast had 20 grams of fat.....the scanner doesnâ€™t work either so youâ€™re out of luck if you canâ€™t find. The â€œratingâ€ gets irritating as well. If youâ€™re trying to center your carbs around when you workout itâ€™ll constantly tell you that youâ€™re off track because your macro distribution. Would also like to see an app that has the option of Meal 1, Meal 2, Meal 3, Meal 4, Meal 5 etc. rather than breakfast lunch dinner snack. Will be going back to my fitness pal. I just wish I hadnâ€™t spent 50 dollars on a year subscription (which adds near no value to the app)
response: We are very sorry that you feel that way! If you prefer a refund, please contact us directly. We would also appreciate if you could send us some details abut the barcode scanner issue so we can start investigate. Thank you very much!

title: You canâ€™t do anything with the free version
body: I couldnâ€™t even adjust my own macros without upgrading to premium. Thatâ€™s the most basic functionality I need out of a fitness app. I canâ€™t properly keep track of what Iâ€™m eating with a quick look at the app when the preset daily requirements are so far off.
response: Please feel free to contact us directly at contact@lifesum.com about a trial and we will see what we can do for you.

title: Great but could be better
body: Update: Net carb tracking has been added and that is awesome- thank you. My only complaint left is that there are still only a few diets to choose from. Please add more, particularly intermittent fasting. ðŸ™‚
response: Thank you very much for your updated review! Our product team is collecting all user suggestions directly here: https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd - thanks in advance and good luck with your goal!

title: Needs Better/Verified Calorie Database
body: I liked the interface, color scheme, basic layout. There seemed to be an overly heavy emphasis on fad diets, but give the people what they want, right?
response: The verified foods are from several food databases: the USDA, food items from Livsmedelsverket in Sweden, from the UK Food Standards Agency and the BLS from Germany.

title: Unreliable Diet Information & Poor Functionally
body: The app itself has a very nice layout. However the functionality seems to be very wonky. For example, one day it says my calorie intake should be1650, the next day it say it should be 500. Not sure what to make of this. Based off two other apps Iâ€™ve tried, my goal intake is around 1250 calories. The other thing I noticed was for the â€œeasyâ€ Keto Diet, it was showing 80% carbs, 5% fat and 15% protein. Anyone familiar with the Keto Diet knows this is incorrect. Finally, one feature I liked was the 3 week weight loss plan that would show menus for the week. The day after I paid for the premium version, this feature was no where to be found. So far I have found this app to be very confusing and not at all accurate with the information it is supposed to track which is diet. Carb Manager is great for those focused on the Keto Diet and MyFitnessPal for all other diets.
response: Thank you for rating our app and for your feedback. We are sorry to hear that you find our app confusing! The  3 week weight loss plan requires specific settings in order to be available to you https://bit.ly/2A5T6Co. Also, your calorie allowance depends on many factors so, please feel free to send us more details at contact@lifesum.com for further assistance!

title: IF not accounted for
body: I recently started keto up again and have decided to add some intermittent fasting, meaning Iâ€™m skipping breakfast. This app doesnâ€™t have a way to acknowledge this and therefore their â€œtipsâ€ about nutrient recommendations are off, since theyâ€™re counting on me eating three meals a day and not just two. I wish this was an option.
response: Thank you very much for your valuable feedback, we really appreciate it and will make sure to send it through to the team in charge! Thank you!

title: Love, but
body: Wow, what an easy app to use. I do have the paid version. This is one of many tracking apps Iâ€™ve used before, but this is the first I loved so much that I paid for the premium version. I love the idea of the plans, BUT, I so, so wish I could swap out a single ingredient in each recipe. I follow a vegan diet, but the plan offered for vegans is very limited. Instead, I like to follow other plans, but swap out proteins or cheeses for vegan options. I would LOVE to see an option where I can go into each recipe and swap these out rather than having to fill in the whole recipe myself just because of one substitution. This would also help when making sure Iâ€™m getting as much protein/calories as the meat option would have. Please add this feature; it would help the app become more vegan-friendly!

title: Overall Such a Great App!
body: I really enjoy this app! I initially downloaded it to help count macros because I am vegetarian and sometimes struggle to ensure I get enough protein every day. This app helps keep my protein intake (and fat and carbs) top of mind. One thing I wish I saw more was I take of other key nutrients - like fruits and veggies, which currently are just counted for carb intake. Since all carbs arenâ€™t created equal, it would be helpful if carbs such as breads and pasta were differentiated from sweet potatoes and greens, for instance. But, a great thing it does do is account for added and naturally occurring sugars, so that helps a bit with fruit sugar vs pasta, packaged goods, etc. I also love the barcode scan function. All in all, I plan to use this app for a long time. Good work!
response: Thank you so very much for your positive feedback! We are very happy to read that you are satisfied! We will forward it to the responsible team for their knowledge.

title: Very disappointed
body: I am so beyond sick of fighting with this app. If you care anything about tracking your macros correctly- go with myfitnesspal. Iâ€™m frustrated that I upgraded to premium only to hate this app so much, I dread using it. Everything I scan- has the wrong info and often times the barcode is associated with the wrong food item. So I edit each time, carefully putting in the exact info off the food packaging, only to have it tell me calories etc are wrong and not allow me to save it! Why bother?  I also hate that it wonâ€™t allow me to track other things, like vitamin content- except for potassium. Also a joke that it wonâ€™t allow you to remove food items you create, or most of all, edit them. Which is exactly why you see so many duplicate items created by ppl on here. I know I sometimes change my recipes up, so why not allow me to change it on here?  This app has been around too long to be this dysfunctional.
response: We are very sorry to hear that you have had a bad experience with our app and we appreciate your feedback. It is absolutely possible to edit and remove your created items - you can do this by entering the item through Favorites, not your Diary. Also, as we are constantly working on improving our database, I have forwarded your feedback to the team responsible and you are also very welcome to contact directly through https://lifesum.com/deep/settings?page=support if you would like further assistance.

title: Beautiful app but for targeted users only
body: Hello, I have been a premium (paying) user of this app, but I had to cancel my membership. Itâ€™s a  beautiful user interface, which was the initial appeal for me as a user. However, without the ability to access simple data from my food intake, this app is not as useful as I would hope for it to be when tracking more than just macros. Calcium, magnesium, and so many other minerals that should be easily imported on the developer side (I am familiar with development), but somehow, even with a user forum requesting such simple tracking, and for years now, this data is not available to users. The alternative for tracking not just macros but the various minerals we need to survive and thrive is My Fitness Pal, which is free, for my purposes at least. I will happily return as a user when these simple yet essential pieces of data are shared and easily accessible as well.
response: We are very sorry to hear that you feel that way! We will make sure your feedback reaches the responsible teams.

title: Love it- but a few places for improvement
body: The app is beautiful - which may be shallow but the design has certainly made me want to engage with the app far more than other food tracking apps Iâ€™ve used before. The reminders and prompts are helpful and motivating, and Lifesum offers a lot of easy-to-select plans (keto, 5:2) that I was interested in. Iâ€™ve paid for the 6 month subscription and am using the 5:2 plan. However, the food database to search from is far more spotty than Myfitnesspal and Iâ€™m putting most of my food in manually, and I am unable to move around my fast days throughout the week to account for my schedule, which causes some really discouraging feedback from the app when Iâ€™m either blowing my fast day calories or way under eating on a non-fast day.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Keeps me accountable
body: For the past week and a half of using this app, I have logged everything I eat from just a small snack to my meals.  Itâ€™s hard because I work overnights and I log my dinners as breakfast and so on but it does help me maintain accountability of my food.  I like being able to find the foods I eat from popular restaurants to foods I prepare at home.  My favorite part of the app is being able to scan the barcode of the food I prepare and input my portions.
response: Thanks you so much for your positive feedback! We are very happy to read that you are satisfied!

title: Overall amazing
body: Overall I think this app is amazing. I love the reminders and the weight tracker. I love the label scanning and entry capabilities. I love that you can track for different types of diets. Where I think this fell short is in the Keto diet tracking area. I track net carbs and yes it does track them to a certain degree. I occasionally buy low carb treats with three and under in the net carb department they are higher carbs but the majority of carbs are sugar alcohols which should be subtracted from the overall carbs just like fiber to get the net carb total. Like I said overall an amazing app just needs a little tweaking for net carbs to calculate correctly. I should add that I donâ€™t buy apps but I did purchased this for the three month timeframe to try it out and will definitely be purchasing for the next time frame!
response: Since we do not support sugar alcohol in our app our approach can differ a bit from other net carb calculators. There is no "true and only" way though.

title: Wish the food entries were more accurate
body: I like that this app allows me to make low carb/keto choices without judging me for consuming too much fat (*cough*MFP*cough*). I also like the premium feature of following a plan with recipes and guidance.  The app is beautiful in design. But I feel like if Iâ€™m going to pay for a food/diet journal app when there are sooo many free ones to pick from, the food entries need be accurate. I find myself fixing a lot of foods and barcodes in this database. And making a food a favorite should be right there on the nutrition facts breakdownâ€”itâ€™s not straightforward how to access recents or favorites. If I hadnâ€™t paid for a 3mo subscription, I probably would have returned to another app by now for the convenience of a user-verified and more accurate database. A little more tweaking on the UX and accuracy of this app and it will be the bomb.
response: Thank you for your review - we truly appreciate you sharing your thoughts on our app and we have forwarded your feedback to the team! If you are interested in a refund, feel free to send us a copy of your transaction receipt at contact@lifesum.com so we can help you out. Thanks!

title: Great, but could use some improvements
body: Lifesum is a gorgeously designed app, but prefer Yazioâ€™s Apple Watch complications.
response: Thank you for the feedback, we much appreciate it! Please feel free to leave suggestions for improvement on our UserVoice as well: https://lifesum.uservoice.com.

title: Aesthetics canâ€™t overcome customization problems
body: Iâ€™ll start by saying Iâ€™ve been using MyFitnessPal for 6 months. I wanted to try Lifesum because I was intrigued by its design and meal recommendations.
response: We regret you did not like the app, but thank you for your feedback and will make sure it reaches the teams in charge.

title: Overall Look & Test
body: I like this app, but the downside is it doesnâ€™t have all exercises their are so you can add to exercises on the list. This makes it difficult to track on dieting. Iâ€™ve had this app just 2-3 days of premium subscription and I feel itâ€™s just not for me. The app isnâ€™t really accurate on intake on calories. Iâ€™ve already paid for the subscription for a year, so itâ€™s a waste of my money now which I paid for a year. The amount of water someone should take is helpful. Also, for someone to be using this, you have to have a decent income to buy most of the healthy products suggested to stay on track of diet plans. For myself Iâ€™m a student, so this is kind of difficult since I donâ€™t make that much while going to school with a part time job. Overall, itâ€™s a good app for a little more experience users.
response: Hi there, Thanks for the feedback! We are sorry to hear you feel this way. Please feel free to leave suggestions for improvement on our UserVoice: https://lifesum.uservoice.com

title: Great app but needs improvement
body: I love the app, but there a few key features that could make it better.
response: Thank you very much for your detailed feedback! We will definitely working on more features and we have made sure your suggestions will reach the team.

title: So much potential yet lacking in support
body: This is a great app for someone who doesnâ€™t care about details.  The smilie faces and the progress bars make the app easy to read.
response: Thank you very much for your rating - your feedback is highly appreciated and directly forwarded to the responsible team. All the best with reaching your goal!

title: Great! But not the Best.
body: Iâ€™d love to love the app and currently have the premium version.
response: Thank you very much for taking the time to share your thoughts on our app - we truly appreciate it! We have forwarded your feedback regarding our database to the responsible team for future reference. Thanks again and all the best with reaching your goal!

title: Good, but has some issues
body: Iâ€™ve been using Lifesum for a few months. I switched from MyFitnessPal because the UI of that app was driving me nuts, and LifeSum presented a much more straightforward food tracker.
response: We deeply apologise for the Health issue! The team has already found the reason for the problem and is working on a fix for it. A new version with the solution will be published as soon as possible!

title: Iâ€™m confused
body: I got this app a couple months ago and than deleted because it was hard for me to track all of my food. Since it is the summer I decided that I might have more time to be able to track my food and activity. I re-downloaded Lifesum and after I signed in it brought me to a page that wanted me to confirm that I had read the he updated policies. The screen was buffering so I couldnâ€™t read it and it wouldnâ€™t even let me click ok to move on. Thus went on for a while so I deleted the app and re-down loaded the app. It still didnâ€™t work. This has been happening for a day now and I would really like to be able to use Lifesum. It may be an issue on my end but I am not sure. If I could get a response that would be much appreciated. Thanks.
response: We are sorry to hear this! Can you please send us more details and some screenshots showing the problem at contact@lifesum.com so we can have the team in charge look into it? Thanks in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Outstanding app but it just need a few tweets
body: I just wanted to start off by saying that this app is very convenient, easy to use and extremely helpful. It is by far my favorite calorie tracking app. I have one problem with the app and if you could fix it it would be great. Lifesum offers 4 places to submit meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner and snacks. There are only 3 main meals that should be of large portions and a really small snack. However, I eat more meals but in smaller portions and the way of submitting your food when you eat like me gets difficult. If you could maybe make the app more customizable regarding how many meals you eat it could be helpful. I have the premium version of Lifesum and I am really enjoying it!ðŸ˜I really hope you take into account my recommendation
response: Many thanks for your awesome feedback! Our developers are collecting all feedback here https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd - we really appreciate all ideas and suggestions for improvement! Good luck with reaching your goal!

title: Glitchy, doesnâ€™t sync
body: I paid for the premium version after being offered a promotional discount. If I were paying full price, Iâ€™d be very unhappy. While thereâ€™s a lot to like about Lifesum, the app has many flaws. Mine has not synced with Apple Health since mid-December, despite several reinstallations as instructed by customer support. It displays my calorie count as the next day, for some reason. And the food search needs work. Entering something as standardized as a Chipotle order involves searching through dozens of entries for the same ingredient, all with different calorie counts. Iâ€™ve tried editing foods to correct them, but that doesnâ€™t seem to work either. All in all, Lifesum is better than the My Fitness Pal app, but it needs work. If they canâ€™t resolve these issues when my subscription is up, I will not be renewing.
response: Thanks for your review and sorry to hear that you've encountered some issue with our app! Our food database is partly user-created and that results in some items having inaccurate nutritional values. We recommend that you either select items verified by us or, for items that you cannot find in our database, create custom items under Favorites. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp. Also, please feel free to send us more details regarding the issue with Health at contact@lifesum.com so we can report this to the team in charge.

title: Great UI but not intuitive
body: This application is beautiful, but from a functionality standpoint, beauty should never be placed over performance.
response: Our product team is collecting all user suggestions directly here: http://lifesum.uservoice.com/forums/274566-feedback-ideas/filters/top

title: I have a wonderful suggestion
body: First off, I would just like to say that this is an amazing app. It is beautifully designed and was made to be used with ease and I absolutely adore it and I adore everyone who has made this app possible. I just want to give my thanks. I have already lost 12 lbs.
response: Thank you very much for your rating and positive feedback - we are very happy to hear that you are satisfied! Please feel free to leave suggestions for improvement on UserVoice: https://lifesum.uservoice.com - out team is regularly browsing through the information there to make sure we are aware about the different requests.

title: Getting worse
body: Used to be pretty cool, but down the line Iâ€™ve realized 98% of the nutrition info is always incorrect, the â€œrecipesâ€ and â€œdietsâ€ offered in premium are so not worth it. I was excited for the vegetarian option but they donâ€™t do nearly anything for it. The picture taking ability is always faulty and is not worth the time. Ultimately the only cool thing about premium is measuring all of your nutritional intakeâ€”but like i said, unless you take the time ALWAYS to correct the info, itâ€™s incorrect.
response: We are sorry to hear that Lifesum didn't your expectations and we thank you for your feedback. It has been forwarded to the team for future reference. When you first subscribed to Premium, you were offered the introductory price but after the initial payment, the full price is applied.

title: They Hide Unsub process
body: I liked the app but dislike how sneaky they are with trying to cancel subscription. Scummy.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback.

title: Auto renewed for 2 years without notification
body: The app itself is good. But be aware that it will auto-renew yearly without sending a notification email. I used this app for about 6 months in 2019 and forgot to cancel the membership, apparently it has charged me the premium fee in 2020 and again recently. I have NEVER received any communication or notification about the auto-renewal in the past two years, and only found out itâ€™s still charging me bcz it showed up in my credit card statement. Be sure to cancel your membership when you stop using the app bcz you will forget about it and they wonâ€™t bother you notify you about the charges.
response: Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry to hear that you feel this way. When you purchase Premium it is communicated during the payment process that this is a subscription and that it will renew unless cancelled before the renewal date. A receipt is sent after every renewal and you then have 14 days to request a refund. Please feel free to contact us with your receipt at contact@lifesum.com and we will assist you further! Thank you!

title: Itâ€™s not working
body: Iâ€™ve used this app before & it worked really well. Recently I got it again and it worked for a week. Today I was inputting my breakfast, water, lunch etc. but it wouldnâ€™t work. I tried to add my cups of water, but nothing happened. My app ending up freezing & not working. I existed out & tried again, but the same thing kept happening. So I uninstalled the app, then reinstalled it and now it wonâ€™t let me log in. Itâ€™s saying my email is wrong, but itâ€™s not. My email works perfectly fine & I know this because I went in my emails to make sure my email is still working & I was getting a bunch of emails. The app keeps saying to recheck my information, but all of my information is right. I know this because I write down all of my usernames & passwords and I put exactly what I wrote down into the app and itâ€™s telling me itâ€™s wrong. I was doing so good with tracking my foods, my water & my exercise and now the app doesnâ€™t work.
response: e deeply apologize for the recent issue.

title: Used to be better
body: Iâ€™ve used lifesum for the past year and have mixed feelings on the changes. It used to be so much easier to check my progress. I also LOVED the mini milestones they offered of 3-5 pounds. I loved hitting those milestones and felt like a bigger deal to me than just hitting the next 5 or 10 pound mark on a scale. Also, at some point they lost my progress and said I had only lost 2 pounds, which was really disappointing to me. It was very helpful for me to look back on the chart going back many months to see the steady progress toward my goal. I decided not to pay for premium again this year and deleted the app. Developers, if you are out there, please bring back the little milestones for users again, and make sure their progress data doesnâ€™t get lost between updates.
response: Thanks for the feedback! Please feel free to leave your vote for Milestones on our UserVoice: https://lifesum.uservoice.com

title: Great start, needs work
body: I downloaded this app, after seeing a YouTuber use it. She said that you could use it to find recipes, even for people with dietary restrictions, which is right up my alley. As someone with IBS and allergies, I constantly need to be recording my food, and is also constantly looking for good healthy recipes around my restrictions, I though this could help me. After signing up and spending a little time on the app I realized that you needed to pay for premium to be able to use the recipes, which was an instant turn off, as that was the main reason I downloaded this app. I wish the recipes were free, because I would actually use this app, but Iâ€™m deleting it, as it is of no use for me anymore. I think that this could be a really great app if everything useful about it was for premium. I hope the makers of this app take this into consideration.
response: We are charging for some of our features in order to cover our running expenses, which include a team of designers, developers and nutritionist and a total of over 60 employees. Thanks for your understanding and, please, feel free to send us your registered email at contact@lifesum.com for a free Premium trial!!

title: Constantly unlinks from my watch and erases my data
body: I have been unable to keep my account set up correctly for more than a few hours at a time. I am logged in, linked my watch to import activity, set up my personal information etc. Everything looks great. Then, come lunch time, I go to add my food and suddenly the app has changed my fitness goal, is no longer importing my watch data and I have to go through the entire setup process Again. Fast forward to dinner, SAME THING.
response: Thank you very much for contacting us!

title: Back to having a lot of bugs
body: April 2019...This is probably my fourth revision of the review in almost a year. Bugs get resolved then come back.  Now I canâ€™t change the plan to gain weight and it is not adding my daily calories burned back to the diet though it is properly set up to do so.  Bugs seem to last a month or so before the resolve them; then they come back when they â€œfixâ€ something else.
response: We apologize for the issue you are experiencing. Please contact us with details, step description and screenshots at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Please also include phone model, OS and Lifesum version. Thank you!

title: Really great but would change a bit
body: So I love this app: big library of foods/barcodes in its library, great focus on macronutrients, the suggestions on how to increase my â€œlife scoreâ€ and I especially love the meal/food ranking smiley faces as motivation. But I would like to see a space where I can upload progress pictures along with my weight and the ability to turn off weight log reminders because Iâ€™m personally not big on tracking what the scale says or setting a â€œgoal weightâ€ when Iâ€™m just focusing on gaining muscle and eating healthier. I also prefer using my Fitbit to track exercise/other healthy habits so I wish they synced up on a bit more information than just a weak exercise total because itâ€™s annoying to enter my food/water twice.
response: Thank you so much for your positive feedback! We are very happy to read that you are satisfied!

title: Horrible Updates
body: I had previously LOVED this app. I bought the premium subscript, and I had absolutely no problems with syncing data from Apple health, Fitbit (my main step tracker since I donâ€™t carry my phone with me around at work), and lifesum. But this newest update is absolute garbage. I reached out to lifesum support and followed their recommendation to delete and reinstall the app. However, now the app is choosing to import my Fitbit data for random days! So now it looks like I have a ton of days where I ate hundreds of calories over my limit because it is missing my Fitbit data (I consistently reach 10k steps nearly every day). I have tried everything listed in the FAQ and nothing works. I feel as if I have lost all of the progress and work Iâ€™ve put into this app and my lifestyle for months now .... I am tempted to just delete this app and go back to myfitnesspal. Hopefully you guys in app development will figure this out soon!!!
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We deeply apologise for the recent partner issues! Please make sure to contact support again with this so they are able to update your case for the developers. Thank you very much!

title: Great App
body: Itâ€™s sleek, elegant, and relatively easy to use (compared to other food tracking apps Iâ€™ve tried). Thereâ€™s a bit of a learning curve, but spend 10 minutes just playing around with the app and you should get the gist of everything.
response: Hi there, thank you so much for leaving your feedback. We appreciate it and are very happy to hear that you like the app! In order for you to see the statistics please go to Profile > Statistics and you will find weekly, monthly, quarterly and all-time statistics there. Thank you!

title: Are you kidding???
body: Give us your personal information, then pick a plan. Donâ€™t worry, they donâ€™t show you anything really on the basic plan. Literally you can look at some meals, and you get a free workout and meal diary... that is it. If you go with the premium you get recipes and tons of other perks. The dilemma for myself and so many others is that I have such a restricted diet I donâ€™t know if your app allows all my preferences. I am not signing up for anything without knowing what EXACTLY I am getting in return. $30 to hope that you can provide the recipes I can actually eat??? Pass. This hopefully works for many who do not have serious restrictions but for those that do you are asking us to throw our money on a very unlikely bet.
response: Hi there, that you for your feedback. We are very sorry to hear that you feel this way.

title: Love most of it but can be glitchy
body: This app is so fun to use and I appreciate the food and macro recommendations so much. The database of foods is super helpful and makes it easier to use.
response: Thank you for your review and feedback, glad to hear that you like the app :)

title: Great idea but buggy. Not actively supported.
body: I used Lifesum to lose over 60lb a couple years ago and loved it. It synced my activity from my Apple Watch pretty well and the interface is so much cleaner than other free or paid options.
response: Hi there, thank you for your feedback. We are deeply sorry to hear that  you are experiencing these issues. We assure you that our support team (contact@lifesum.com) will get back to you as soon as possible. We have also forwarded your feedback to the teams in charge for their knowledge. Thank you.

title: Beautiful app, ratings make no sense
body: It's a beautiful app that I enjoy using every day. The benefits for paying $30+ a year arenâ€™t normally enough to make me go premium, but I would just to support the work of the team building lifesum. The ONLY thing keeping me from upgrading is the weird payment system. Itâ€™s monthly but managed by where you upgraded (iTunes or website) and the only way to cancel is to take it up with Apple, or whoever handles the payment. If canceling a subscription with lifesum directly, it looks like you email them and hope theyâ€™ll come through on manually cancelling. Itâ€™s just not worth the potential headache later. I would rather pay a one-time fee than deal with a weird, fragmented subscription model.
response: Thank you for your positive review! If you don't wish to subscribe through iTunes, you can also pay with credit card or through your Paypal account. With both these methods we can manually handle cancellation and refunds ourselves for our users.

title: Whoâ€™s the independent audience?
body: I think this app is for females. Itâ€™s difficult to determine because the app seems to have a delightful unisex interface. However articles and content posted by lifesum are geared towards females with almost all imagery being that of women and article titles like â€œEat Like A Goddessâ€. Great health isnâ€™t bias, but the sex of an individual will affect it. I assume this is why the customizable features within the app are available. That in conjunction with the unisex interface should be more of a reason to creat an app geared towards everyone to enjoy. If this is more about a marketing strategy Iâ€™d assume making that plain would be helpful to users.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We are very sorry if you fee that way as this is absolutely not intended. We will forward this to the responsible team so they will be aware. Thank you!

title: Great App!
body: Update: developer responded to my initial review and pointed out where the journal on the app was. I guess I havenâ€™t explored the app as throughly as I thought I had.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! You find the option to take notes under DETAILS in your Diary.

title: Needs Work
body: 1- when trying to meal plan for the next day, Iâ€™m adding things to the correct day (tomorrow), but will kick me off of the day Iâ€™m trying to add and add it to the current day, which messes everything up.
response: We are sorry to hear that you've encountered some issues with our app! Please, feel free to send us more details and some screenshots at contact@lifesum.com so we can investigate. Thanks in advance!

title: Okay..
body: I wanted to like this app so badly. Itâ€™s so beautiful and feels like a native Apple app with the seamlessness of it. However, the functionality is where I feel Lifesum falls short. I was a loyal MyFitnessPal user for years and I decided to try Lifesum Premium to see if I liked it. The small library of food items and the difficulty through which food is logged proved to be too cumbersome for something that I KNOW can be easy, as it is through MyFitnessPal. The â€œMeal Plansâ€ include eating 500 calories for 1 or 2 days a week... yikes. Every nutritionist will tell you that starving/fasting yourself is terrible for losing weight and your metabolism. The recipes are not worth premium, in my opinion. (Boiled eggs with mayonnaise as an exampleðŸ¤®) I tried Lifesum for about 2 weeks and I will sadly be going back to MyFitnessPal, even though I have 2 months left of Premium on this app.
response: Thanks for your feedback. We never recommend something that would not be health beneficiary, including the 5:2 diet that has 2 fasting days a week in the plan. Research has proved that a short fasting period has a positive impact to your health and that people who follow this lifestyle tend to lead longer lives. There are many other plans available to choose from if that is not your thing! Our food database is improving constantly. It is partly user-created and that results in some items having inaccurate nutritional values. We recommend that you either select items verified by us or, for items that you cannot find in our database, create custom items under Favorites. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp.

title: What can I do without premium?
body: I got this app and immediately recognized the organization which I love as well as the aesthetically pleasing theme. As I was playing around with it for the first time I noticed that many of the features were locked and I need to buy premium in order to use them. Every time I saw something that I wanted to know or a feature I wanted to use, it was locked. Then I realized that without premium there is little the app can do. I think it would be nice to have a month or few week long free trial to test out premium before committing to paying for it, or something like that. Or, the app can just unlock some of the great features that made me download the app in the first place. For example, the camera to take a picture of my meal would save so much time!
response: We are charging for some of our features in order to cover our running expenses, which include a team of designers, developers and nutritionist and a total of over 60 employees. Thanks for your understanding! Feel free to send us your registered email through contact@lifesum.com for a free trial! :)

title: Well Done Lifesum
body: Iâ€™m pretty picky about apps, but Iâ€™ve got to say, I really like this one! From the moment you start itâ€™s got funny and inviting animations, itâ€™s very organized and professional, and somehow they managed to pack so many different features in without it feeling cramped. Itâ€™s very intuitive.

title: I want to love it but itâ€™s just OK
body: Iâ€™ve been using this for several weeks now and I want to love it but there are several things that need improvement badly. It has potential to be great and I love that it syncs to my watch so I can track my exercise in the same app as my meals. Several things need improvement:
response: Thank you very much for taking the time to share your thoughts on our app - your review is very appreciated! We have forwarded your feedback to our product team and please, also make sure to send us more details and screenshots showing the issues you've been having to contact@lifesum.com so we can investigate. Thanks in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Visually appealing, but meal plans need some work
body: I think the app looks nice and works pretty well overall. But when you have a section dedicated to meal plans, I hope to be given a guided plan I can follow. Most of the â€œmeal plansâ€ on this app arenâ€™t actually meal plans, they just change recommended macros etc. With a separate tab full of recipes from that plan.
response: Thank you for the review and feedback! In the app there are meal plans and diet plans. The difference is that the diet plans does not support meal suggestions as the meal plans do. Please make sure that you are on a meal plan and not a diet plan, if you are and the issue remains - please reach out to us at contact@lifesum.com.

title: Need personal recipes
body: *updated from 4 to 5 stars* because the developer feedback was very helpful and resolved my issue!
response: We truly appreciate your update and we are very happy to hear that you are satisfied with our assistance and app! Many thanks for your feedback and all the best with reaching your goal!

title: LOST 50 LBS!!!
body: I never ever write reviews but this one felt like a must. After I read the reviews and contemplated paying for the $40 yearly subscription, I did. The app and platform itself is simple and aesthetically pleasing, therefore I felt this app would hold me accountable better than I could hold myself accountable. Although I didnâ€™t log food every day and only used a couple recipes, the â€œupdate your weightâ€ button kept me motivated to weigh myself everyday and think more consciously about my intake. I also enjoy that my watch activity connects to the platform, adjusting my goal caloric intake based on my plan. After 4 months I am down 50 pounds and Iâ€™m not done yet. Thanks Lifesum!
response: Thank you so very much for your review! This is what keeps us going! Congratulations!

title: Not worth the price
body: I would say this app has great potential, but it is still in its beginning phases for sure, and therefore shouldnâ€™t be charging $50 annually for the premium. Itâ€™s just not worth that. I like the look of it, itâ€™s not too difficult to navigate. But, every time I scan a food item, it is either not in the system and I have to add it, or the nutritional information or measurements are incorrect. (Sometimes the calories are correct but it says the standard serving is 1 cup instead of 1 tbsp, etc). I would say this is the case for 85% of foods that I add to my day and it gets so frustrating having to change everything. I wouldnâ€™t mind having to add a new food or correct something every once in awhile, but I feel like it happens literally every day.  Even items from big companies like Quaker are not in the system sometimes. Pretty disappointing considering how much I paid.
response: Thank you for your feedback. Itâ€™s a big challenge for us to allow people all across the world to track their everyday foods. Our users help by contributing missing foods to our database. Unfortunately, these contributions can have errors, as you discovered. We are constantly working to fix these errors, we hope youâ€™ll try us again in future.

title: Downfall in the Details
body: I got this app for the advertised meal plans however after paying (since there is NO way to review any recipes or plans before purchase) I was very disappointed. The recipes are VERY vague. Often with ingredients measured in â€œstandard servingâ€ or in grams. The ingredients lists are either odd or so short that I was constantly adding to the recipe to give it flavor. The instructions more or less just say â€œCook food and eat itâ€. Thereâ€™s no way to add a custom meal on the food tracker so tracking an actual meal you cooked is a huge pain. There are various diet plans to choose from but very little explanation on how to actually live within that plan. Also the meal plan itself is a pain to try and navigate in order to plan and meal prep. In short use this for a free tracker (it really is pretty) but donâ€™t waste your time on the premium meal plans.
response: Our product team is collecting all user suggestions directly here: http://lifesum.uservoice.com/forums/274566-feedback-ideas/filters/top

title: Easy to understand
body: I was never a count your calories guy, and I used to be able to eat anything I wanted and never gained weight. Now that I want to workout and get fit, I donâ€™t know what I should be eating and I donâ€™t even know what Iâ€™m eatings nutrition is. This app very simply tells you what youâ€™re eating and how much more or less you should be taking in. The only thing is you need to be diligent to put what youâ€™re eating in the app. If you can do that then youâ€™ll be shown how healthy the food youâ€™re taking in is, quite surprised how many items are in their data base. Every item Iâ€™ve eaten or made has been in their system and has a detailed nutrition chart for them
response: We are very happy to hear that you're enjoying our app! Thank you for your review and good luck with your goal!

title: Regret purchasing a subscription
body: I had to search the app to find the setting to change the percentage of carbs to protein to fat i should be eating. I accidentally closed the step counter on the home page that has the cool info about how many calories youâ€™ve burned in terms of food, & for the life of me I canâ€™t find the setting to get it back. I also discovered a bunch new settings in my search that I never knew I had. This app could be clearer, & the meal plan options are all the same & there are few options offered based on the questions you answer (like 3). Iâ€™ve yet to see this be updated or more plans/options be added. Some foods you can only measure by â€œserving sizeâ€ & they donâ€™t indicate how much a serving size is. The fruit & vegetable tracker donâ€™t work, it says iâ€™ve consumed none even though iâ€™ve logged fruit & veggies in meals.
response: Thank you for your review. You can reactivate the step counter under Plans > Enhanced Health. The fruit and vegetable trackers don't update automatically - you need to manually click on them to note the amount consumed. We are sorry to hear that you are not satisfied with our Meal Plans. We have forwarded your feedback to the team in charge. We are working constantly on improving our app and our product team is collecting all user suggestions directly here: https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd - thanks in advance!

title: Great, but missing a key feature!
body: Iâ€™ve been using this app for just over a week now and the user interface and visual appeal is outstanding!  To me, those are very important pieces to any app. How do you expect me to use it if itâ€™s not easily navigated and looks good!?  The only thing I wish they would add is a way to connect with friends. Unless Iâ€™m missing it, I donâ€™t see it. Otherwise this is a great calorie counter app! It connects with so many other apps to truly get a full scope of your health and eating habits. I havenâ€™t ran into a problem with the food database as of now either!  The only addition I would recommend to the food database is being able to create your own recipes. Keep the updates coming!!!
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Not all good
body: This app has a lot of bells and whistles, it looks great, but it comes with bugs that will make you want to forget using it. In fact I have, but I came back to see if any of the updates fixed them. Items in the food data base arenâ€™t always what shows up on food item labels. Itâ€™s not easy to add your own, but try and try again, youâ€™ll get it. And the recipes should let you see the nutritional value of each item, and maybe be able to delete items you arenâ€™t going to use, but then you would find some of the issues with improper nutritional reporting. Iâ€™m have labels that claim there are no carbs, but items in the app assign them carbs. WTH. Itâ€™s been frustratingly, enough to test your resolve. Probably faster and easier to use pen and paper.
response: Hi there, thank you for leaving your feedback. It is important to us. We are sorry to hear that you feel this way and for the issues you have been experiencing. Please feel free to send more details to our support team at contact@lifesum.com so that we can investigate further. Please also feel free to leave suggestions for improvement on our UserVoice: https://lifesum.uservoice.com. Thank you!

title: Not Enough Options
body: I saw an ad on pinterest when looking up keto diets and decided to give it a try with the discounted subscription. I was super excited about the variety of meal plans it promised, but was disappointed to find out that the options are limited. Iâ€™m a fairly picky eater so I assumed finding recipes I liked would be difficult, but there were a total of 3 things that I would eat and could easily get the ingredients for. Even when searching for a recipe I made, there was nothing that popped up besides the few options on the explore page. If I want to make anything other than the recipes on the app itself I have to manually enter every single ingredient. I had purchased the 6 month plan but deleted it after 2 hours due to the lack of options and the overall inconvenience. Would not recommend going that route because now I spend $30 on nothing.
response: Thank you for your feedback! We are very sorry to hear that you are not satisfied.

title: Liking the app
body: So Iâ€™m at week 3 of using the app. Itâ€™s honestly helped me learn much more about Macro Balance and I am a person that was like â€œhuh?â€ when it came to that. Once I input into the diary the app does the calculation but it would be more useful if it shows it in advance so I can immediately measure out my portions.  Also, the available Keto plans lock the carb count so I canâ€™t put in my individual carb grams and percentages.  Hopefully, the app team will address these two issues in the very near future.

title: Not what I Paid For

There are very limited food plans and not a lot of offered recipes. Also it is very difficult to receive a refund if you are unsatisfied. I tried to cancel about 10 min after i purchases after I realized it did not include what was promised, and was directed to Apple Support who will not refund (Lifesum hides behind the fact that they do not directly handle the payment platform). I have tried to use it anyways since Iâ€™m paying for 6 months (whether I like it or not) and now the app keeps crashing randomly when I try to view the plan section. Disappointing, not worth it for premium, might be useful if you stick to free but my fitness pal is just as good with a larger database.
response: We are awfully sorry for the inconvenience. Fact is that Apple does not give access to their payment data so any refund for any purchase can only be grated through Apple. You find more information here: https://lifesum.helpshift.com/a/lifesum---healthier-eating-better-living/?s=lifesum-premium&f=how-can-i-receive-a-refund&p=all
