title: Majorly contributed to my ed
body: *TW ED* I used this app throughout my ed and I can say that it made it 100 times worse. I just got out of a 3 month long stay in inpatient and residential ed treatment at 15 years old and am still in a partial hospitalization program. This app lets you set ridiculously low calorie limits and doesnâ€™t fight you on them with more than a notification that the goal is too low. In addition it sets your original goal at 1200 cal which isnâ€™t even enough to feed a person in a coma. We need at least 1400 per day to exist in a coma and at least 2000 per day to exist a normal life. It encourages people to eat way under the amount their body needs. If you want to lose weight please do NOT use this app. Restricting your calories will not work long term. Listen to your body. It knows what it needs. You donâ€™t want to end up where I and many others are.
response: We are very sorry to hear about your experience. Lifesum has been designed to help our users eat better. The app is using algorithms that are supposed to keep users from entering health goals that could harm them. If you feel that this is not true in your case, please make sure to contact support with details about your example at https://lifesum.com/deep/settings?page=support  so we can look into it. Thank you!

title: Frustrating
body: I like this app for so many things. Scanning in food. Tracking macros. But Iâ€™m pretty tired of my exercise not syncing from my Fitbit, or having exercise Iâ€™ve manually input just disappear. The app also changes my weight on its own accord. No, I did not lose weight or gain that weight....I clearly havenâ€™t entered the amount it decides for that day. Sometimes it just reverts back to my starting weight for no reason at all. If youâ€™re looking for an accurate graph for weight this is NOT the app you should be using. Iâ€™d be better off with a pen and paper. Iâ€™ve reported this issue many times, yet it still seems to be broken. Funny....my LoseIt app doesnâ€™t do this....and neither does my FitBit app. Itâ€™s frustrating keeping food tracking in one app and weight tracking by in another.
response: Thank you so much for your feedback, we understand how frustrating this must be. Please contact us with your details directly at contact@lifesum.com and we will look into the issue. We deeply apologise for this and once again thank you  for your feedback!

title: Used to be amazing, just keeps getting buggier

I love that it has multiple plans, all the tips analyzing how you might be feeling or how to adjust your food intake, the way you can Target your calories....They even finally added net carbs! Net carbs is the only feature improvement during this time I've actually used. Fitbit exercise syncing gets worse and worse. The food database has lots of mistakes that I have to account for when tracking calories. I don't need fancy recipes or a bunch of new plans... I just want the core features I use to work but it feels that's not what the developers want to focus on.

Iâ€™m just annoyed and done overall. Deleting this app today, unfortunately going to just lose all my past data and Iâ€™ll be trying out another app.

title: Good diet tracking app, but a lot is locked behind Premium
body: Overall, this is a nice diet tracking app. I enjoy that the free version is not riddled with ads. The interface is very clean and straight forward. Daily tracking info is clearly displayed.
response: Many thanks for your feedback! Thanks for your review! Our food database is partly user-created and that results in some items having inaccurate nutritional values. We recommend that you either select items verified by us or, for items that you cannot find in our database, create custom items under Favorites. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp. Good luck with your goal!

title: Great app
body: I like this app for tracking food and trying to eat a healthier menu. I like the elegance and easiness. The different ways it shows visuals to display info is very helpful in understanding how much ive consumed and have lost.

title: This app is good
body: I like using lifesum to track what I eat and Iâ€™ve been liking it a lot. I also like the idea of tracking calories and nutritional value in the foods I eat. I didnâ€™t give it a full star because I am a user who likes to cook and thereâ€™s no option to save my own recipes in the application to track macros. The recipes in the app is great donâ€™t get me wrong. Iâ€™m just saying the app would be better if users are able to save their own recipes with all the macros for their recipe and then add it to their daily meals. I think this would make it easier than having users reenter all the ingredients every time they want to track it. Overall a good application.
response: Thank you very much for your rating and positive feedback! It is possible to create your own food items, recipes, meals and exercises in your Favorites. You can find out more here: https://lifesum.helpshift.com/hc/en/3-lifesum/faq/497-favorites---what-is-it-and-how-does-it-work---ios/. All the best with reaching your goal!

title: Really good!
body: I got this app because I was feeling self conscious and I wanted to get skinnier. This app really helps! If you put in all the effort to track your meals you really become more aware of what your eating and how many calories it is. The reason I only put 4 stars is because they give you a lot of pop ups for their plans you pay for and I was really just looking for something free and easy to help me feel more self confident. This app is totally free unless you chose to pay for one of the special plans which I donâ€™t intend to do. I would say the free version is probably better then the paid plan. So I would definitely recommend using this app! Really helps.

title: Good start but information is a bit simplistic
body: This app seems like it would be a great way for those beginning on a health journey to start out. It offers three options (get healthy, lose weight, gain weight), which is a refreshing change from all the apps who think everyoneâ€™s priority is to shed pounds. Another positive: it tracks water intake!!
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Good idea, but didnâ€™t work for me.
body: I started using this app to get in shape prior to my college ROTC classes. I started in early June 2018, and my the end of the month, I had made no progress on the scale. I was always under my calorie limit, I ran 1.5 miles everyday and lifted weights, but I wasnâ€™t going anywhere. I had used MyFitnessPal before and had lost 15 pounds, but I wanted to try something new.
response: We are sorry to hear that Lifesum didn't fit your needs and we thank you for your review and feedback!

title: Great app.
body: Great app. Opportunities for improvement are the barcode scanner (it doesnâ€™t pick up bar codes as easily as it should) and the food database (not nearly as comprehensive as other apps).
response: Many thanks for your positive review and great feedback! Our food database is partly user-created and that results in some items having inaccurate nutritional values. We recommend that you either select items verified by us or, for items that you cannot find in our database, create custom items under Favorites. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp. Good luck with your goal!

title: Beautiful Design
body: I paid for the premium version and am happy with it. I love the design and functionality of the app - because itâ€™s lovely to use, I use it consistently and find myself drawn to it to update my food and exercise. I donâ€™t necessarily trust the macronutrients and calories that accompany a lot of their search results for the foods and drinks so I always double check those, but beyond that the app is great. Would love for them to audit their search results though to weed out the foods that are incorrect. As long as you are paying attention you can still track everything accurately, I just wish I didnâ€™t have to double check anything new I try to add.
response: Many thanks for your review! Due to our food database being partly user-sourced, the nutritional values may sometimes not be on point. We recommend that you either select items verified by us or, for items that you cannot find in our database, create custom items under Favorites. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp. Good luck with reaching your goal!

title: Almost perfect!
body: I love this app, it makes eating healthy SO much easier and itâ€™s super cheap to have a premium subscription (if you can afford $3 a month!), the only suggestion I have is that it would be super cool if during your evaluation you could add in certain things like â€œI need extra calciumâ€ or â€œIâ€™m allergic to nutsâ€ just simple stuff like that. Having foods tailored just a little more specifically to what the individual needs would make this app absolutely perfect in my opinion. Lots of the foods I choose to eat have higher sodium because I have a sodium deficiency and as silly as it is, it makes me sad when the food rating smiley face looks disappointed in me for eating high sodium lol.
response: Thank you very much for your positive review and your feedback! Our developers are collecting all feedback here https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd - we really appreciate all ideas and suggestions for improvement! Good luck with your goal! :)

title: Fantastic!
body: Iâ€™m on a muscle bulk diet after dropping weight. I have a general diet planned out, but also enjoy snacking. I use my planned diet as my template, but this app is fantastic in that I can always track and keep notes about what I eat throughout the day. It makes it to where I can just glance rather than question what Iâ€™ve eaten. Itâ€™s also nice because you can even make your own meals to use (I made a chipotle bowl on my cheat day). I compared nutrition next to the official Chipotle website and it was spot on! Using this with my Apple Watch in order to keep track of my net calories! So no more guilt or questioning. This is what Iâ€™ve needed!
response: We are truly happy to hear that you are satisfied with Lifesum - many thanks for sharing your positive feedback and good luck with your goal!

title: Great app!!
body: I really like this app. Iâ€™ve used a couple apps similar in the past, but this one is beautiful and Iâ€™m enjoying the premium features. The only things I am hoping are added are the ability to customize the water logging AND being able to log calories with the option to add the nutritional information. I eat a few meals that I have the nutritional information for, but I have to log the calories instead. I feel a feature like this would not only help with the meal rating, but also save users some time as their only other option is to manually log (and maybe even guess) every ingredient. Thanks for all the work!
response: Many thanks for rating us and for sharing your thoughts on our app! Our product team is collecting all user suggestions directly here: https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd

title: Pretty Good
body: I like this interface way better than MyFitnessPal and I like that you can see calories, macros, and water intake. I also love that each meal has suggested amount of calories and the smiley face rating system.
response: Hi there, thank you so much for leaving your feedback, we appreciate it!

title: Disappointed
body: I bought this app because it boasted about having over 200 recipes and its many diet choices. I got the 1 year subscription and hoped it would work for me. So far it hasnâ€™t. I am trying to go keto to lose some weight and I am also vegetarian (not vegan, so not that restrictive) and when I looked for recipes to fit the bill they only had maybe 10 available. Granted I can look up recipes but I was hoping for more ease with this app. They also donâ€™t have a plan ahead feature which means if I want to plan a meal in advance I have to go through and add it to my daily count and try to delete it after. I disappointed to say the least, never have I felt compelled to leave a review but this app is a waste of money. Do NOT buy the subscription, you wonâ€™t get a refund if you donâ€™t like the app and then youâ€™ll be out $40.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We are very sorry to read that you are not satisfied!

title: Inaccurate, and therefore useless
body: Thereâ€™s a lot that I like about this app, including the feel of the design and the aesthetics. Unfortunately, the calories gained/burned associated with different foods and activities are so wildly absurd that the app is unusable. No, I did not burn 1000 calories at my water aerobics class. If that were the case, all of the little old ladies there would be going into hypoglycemic shock. No, I did not burn 800 calories walking around the grocery store. No, I did not burn 160 calories from going on the elliptical for 10 minutes. The app also suffers from a mediocre and inaccurate food library, seemingly comprised mostly of user-inputted data. I wanted to like this app because itâ€™s prettier than some others that Iâ€™ve used in the past, but it just doesnâ€™t function.
response: Thank you for rating our app. We are very sorry to hear about your experience regarding your exercise calories - something is obviously not working there. Could you please send us some screenshots showing incorrect calculations at https://lifesum.com/deep/settings?page=support so we can investigate the problem? Thank you very much in advance and our apologies for the inconvenience!

title: really nice app
body: I love this app honestly, itâ€™s set up nice, I had my fitness pal before but ended up forgetting about it and never tracked my food or anything. Iâ€™ve had this app for about a month now and have kept up with my tracking the whole time! thereâ€™s only one thing keeping me from giving it 5 stars, more types of exercises need to be added. it has the basic kind but Iâ€™d like them to be more specific. but otherwise itâ€™s a really fun tracking app, Iâ€™ve lost 7 pounds in the month since Iâ€™ve had it, Iâ€™m sure it couldâ€™ve helped me lose more but Iâ€™m taking the whole healthy eating thing a little slow so I donâ€™t drive myself crazyðŸ˜„
response: Please check out this article that shows you how to add any missing exercise: https://lifesum.helpshift.com/a/lifesum---healthier-eating-better-living/?s=food-exercise-tracking&f=how-can-i-track-exercise---ios&l=en

title: Good but needs some work
body: Iâ€™ve been using this app for awhile now and itâ€™s got some really nice features! Beautiful layout and way of showing progress. However I do have a big problem with the â€œpremiumâ€ content that you have to pay for.  Without paying for the premium, this app is just meh. It seems like every time thereâ€™s something that could potentially further help you, you have to pay premium for it. You see that they offer specific diet plans and all this great stuff but thatâ€™s only if you pay premium for it. If you arenâ€™t willing to pay the price, then this app is basically just a calorie and exercise recorder. Thatâ€™s my one issue with this app. If more things were available to those not paying, then I wouldâ€™ve enjoyed this app more.
response: Thank you for your review! We are charging for some of our features in order to cover our running expenses, which include a team of designers, developers and nutritionist and a total of over 60 employees. Thanks for your understanding!

title: More plans
body: Very nice app, but Iâ€™d love to see more meal plans that are built for more variety of goals. For example, I have a metabolic rate thatâ€™s faster than normal and I struggle to keep weight. This means, when I go over the amount of calories, and the amount of carbs and fats, itâ€™s actually considered good rather than bad; (but going over the amount of protein remains not recommended) It would be nice to see a plan that would have these things in mind. Another feature that would be nice to see in the future is nutritional values like vitamins and such that you can keep track of from the foods you eat.
response: Many thanks for your 5 star review - we truly appreciate your feedback! Our developers are collecting all feedback here https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd - we really appreciate all ideas and suggestions for improvement!

title: Incredibly easy and effective
body: Iâ€™m a 29 year old female. I started logging with Lifesum on January 8. Itâ€™s February 20, just less than two months later, and this morning marked the 19th pound Iâ€™ve lost. Seriously - JUST LOGGING. I scheduled my ideal weight (140) and put my current (169) and set it to classic dieting which sounds limiting but is just being aware of your calories. When I reach the calories for the meal, I stop. Itâ€™s almost over-simple. I canâ€™t believe Iâ€™m losing weight like this, and I havenâ€™t worked out even once so imagine what would happen if I did. Lifesum is my favorite tool for counting calories and weight loss!
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We are glad to hear that you like our app.

title: I love it! except for ...
body: I wish they had more options for meal plans with allergies. if they did iâ€™d give 5 stars. they do have a recipe section and you can look for nut free things, but I wish theyâ€™d update it so that if you have soy allergies and choose vegan for a week, it can help you around that. Or people on keto who are vegetarian, etc. Other than that this app is INCREDIBLE! the accuracy is great unlike some other apps iâ€™ve used in the past. So much so I bought the premium version. Helps me track my water intake, my carb intake, all my food, my exercise and the meal plans (if you donâ€™t need really special diets) are great! Itâ€™s definitely worth the money to upgrade to premium.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Currently broken
body: As others have mentioned, used to be probably the easiest and most pleasing nutrition tracker to use. However a couple of critical bugs have plagued it for a couple of weeks now... I work in dev and I understand that critical bugs especially can take time, however there seems to be some radio silence on the newer, more serious bug introduced by last weekend's patch (which was itself supposed to fix a critical bug).
response: We have just launched a new version in the App Store that should fix your issue.

title: Love it!
body: I love using this app to help me track macros. I really like that you can pick between certain â€œdietsâ€ and it adjusts your daily needs accordingly! It has a water tracker too for those trying to stay more hydrated! There are 2 things I wish they included:
response: Many thanks for rating our app! Our developers are collecting all feedback here https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd - we really appreciate all ideas and suggestions for improvement!

title: Great app unlike its kind
body: I have only been using this app for about a week, but I donâ€™t imagine anything changing. I paid for the 3 months premium subscription and got a discount for signing up for my first time. Iâ€™ve been having A difficult time enjoying certain meals on keto, and this app is perfect at telling me what I need to eat and giving me plans and being able to track them for a day. I would highly recommend this, even if itâ€™s just for a few short months to get you on track for the day that you want. Iâ€™m hoping to lose more weight with this in the upcoming weeks
response: We are very happy to hear that Lifesum is helping you achieve your goal and many thanks for your super nice review!

title: Good, but canâ€™t add own recipes
body: This is geared toward packaged products and restaurants. If youâ€™re geared toward that, this app seems fine. Yet if you cook, thereâ€™s no means (certainly not an intuitive one) for putting your own recipes into the app. So if you make, for example, egg roll bowls (essentially the innards of an egg roll, but as a stir fry/salad without the shell), you have no practical means of just entering â€œ4 oz golf egg roll bowlâ€ based on a pre-entered recipe with its nutritional info. That makes the product useless as a food diary unless you totally rely on the lazy forms of food a good diet plan should encourage you to avoid. Disappointing. Will reconsider if you can explain (and make way more visible) a way for entering your own recipes. And if thatâ€™s a premium feature, itâ€™s not obvious...it just says access to more of yours.
response: Thank you for  your feedback, we are sorry to hear that you feel this way. It is possible to create your own recipes with ingredients etc under Favourites.

title: Terrible app
body: This app is so frustrating to even try to use. I canâ€™t believe I purchased the premium version based on other reviews, only to find out that it is so bad. The premium version has very limited functionality, and trying to enter real food is a battle that just isnâ€™t worth fighting. It seems to think that all food comes from restaurants instead of my own kitchen. Too bad if you didnâ€™t have a side of potatoes with that omelette. The app just decided that you did and youâ€™re stuck with a food journal that isnâ€™t representative of the actual food that you actually ate. And just try adjusting your macros to something you would want to track. The app pigeon holes you into one of a few predetermined meal plans and expects you to stick to that.  I am deleting the app even though I paid $30 for it.
response: We are sorry to hear that you are not satisfied with our app and we thank you for your feedback. Besides being able to find single items (not paired restaurant-style) in our database, you also have the possibility to create your own items/recipes/meals through Me > Favorites and track EXACTLY what you are consuming. You also do not have to follow a meal plan or be stuck with the macros/calorie allowance the app has defined for you; you can instead choose the Classic plan and customise both macros and daily calorie goal. If you need assistance with finding these settings or with applying for a refund, please contact us through contact@lifesum.com and we will get back to you as soon as possible!

title: I've loved everything about this app so far, EXCEPT...
body: I've been using this app for several weeks now and I love it. I use the barcode scanner to enter in tons of foods and I've also linked my Fitbit to keep track of my exercise. The only thing I can't STAND about this app is that there is no setting for net carbs on the meal/eating plans. On a low carb/keto diet, fiber is subtracted from total carbs to give you an idea of the number of grams of carbohydrate that are actually impacting your blood glucose levels (net carbs). Without net carbs, it shows that my daily carb intake is WAY over what it should be when almost half of that is fiber. Please fix this and the app will be perfect!!
response: Thanks for your review and feedback! Please, feel free to up-vote this suggestion http://bit.ly/2wa6u4u in our Uservoice page. Thanks in advance!

title: Disappointing and Subpar
body: I really wanted to like this app and even got a trial of the paid version. I liked the idea of the recipes and health scale. Quite frankly, itâ€™s underwhelming and seems like it wants to be more like MyFitnessPal or Fitbit. However, its scanning function hardly works, and a lot of the information it does have is wrong or incomplete. It also does not track vitamins and minerals, which are really important, especially if youâ€™re dieting. You also have limited control over what information you can input for a meal or recipe. I will say that I like the faces next to individual food items, but again, this is only effective if the information attached to the food item is correct. This app has a long way to go before it can be real competition for some of the other diet and nutrition apps out there.
response: Thank you very much fro your detailed feedback!

title: Crashes constantly
body: I decided to try Lifesum after several fitness vloggers did sponsored videos about the app. The only draw of it over my fitness pal is the aesthetics. I used it daily for months and it drove me insane that it constantly crashed. I should mention that I currently have an iPhone 8 so itâ€™s not an issue with an old phone. I donâ€™t mean once and then it would work if you opened it again. There are just periods where it doesnâ€™t work at all and you can open it 20 ones in a row and it will just continue to instantly close. It is insanely frustrating. Once youâ€™ve got some of your favorite foods in the history, itâ€™s annoying to switch to another app. So my advice is not to invest in it at all. Go with my fitness pal. Lifesum is cute but gimmicky.
response: We apologise for the issue you are experiencing.

title: Prettiest Calorie Tracker But Limited
body: This is by far the best looking calorie tracker I have used on iOS, but also one of the most limited.  It has the most limited food library of the calorie counters I have used.  But where it really falls down is in its customization.  It doesnâ€™t allow for custom snacks or meal types only 4 meals and doesnâ€™t allow input of time for meals.  Doesnâ€™t allow input of supplements.  Doesnâ€™t allow custom food entries.  It should also be noted there arenâ€™t complications for all Apple Watch faces, if you have a favorite face make sure there is a complication for it.  In short this is an app for someone looking for the most basic of calorie trackers in a pretty package, but if you are serious about tracking anything more then your macros look else where.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! That is highly appreciated.

title: Subscription /premium
body: I would love to have this be my primary app for food logging, because itâ€™s very friendly and adorable. However, it seems I need to pay for a subscription to do absolutely anything.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Almost Perfect!
body: Lifesum is so easy to use and helps me feel so much control over my health! I love not only being able to track but getting insight into what I could improve about each choice. The ONLY thing I would change is that there needs to be a desktop experience to allow users to more easily enter recipes and meals... this can be so tedious on a phone screen. If not a desktop functionality, the app should at least be able to flip to landscape orientation that way iPad users could use a keyboard for the same purpose! So MyFitnessPal wins in that category. But overall, itâ€™s the best nutrition tracking app Iâ€™ve used!
response: Thanks for the feedback! Please feel free to leave suggestions for improvement on our UserVoice: https://lifesum.uservoice.com

title: Sublime
body: So helpful, so easy.  But, the weight check in.
response: Hi there, thank you for your feedback. If you wish to change your goal, please go to settings > personal details > change goal = here you can change to either Maintain Weight or Gain Weight, whatever suits your goal better. If you need any further assistance please let us know at contact@lifesum.com. Thank you!

title: Not bad
body: Iâ€™m new to Lifesum and just getting acquainted. Generally pretty easy on the eyes and tracking food/water/etc is pretty intuitive. Login with Apple gets a big thumbs up from me. Not sure about the canned eating plans - Iâ€™m not into â€˜dietsâ€™, just want to track overall calories, maybe macro and fat/carb/protein balance so I started the â€˜classicâ€™ plan. At the end of the day the app yells at me for not eating enough, even though my body says Iâ€™ve had enough. Thought the vegetable tracker would understand that a salad counts as a vegetable and clock it accordingly - guess not. Must be a manual thing. I probably just need to use it for a while longer to get comfortable.
response: Thank you for choosing Lifesum and for rating us! Yes, the habit trackers are for manual use :) When you are following the Classic plan, you have the ability to customise your calorie allowance and macros to match your own needs. All the best with reaching your goal!

title: Exactly what I needed
body: This app is fantastic! I use it all the time and I have no complaints. I have only ever used the free version and it works wonderfully. I used this app and set my goal and, after a few short months and regular exercise, I lost twenty-three pounds. The only problem is that once I got the update, couldn't open the app. Still can't, actually. Other than that, the app is beautiful and very well programmed. I still can't believe how well it worked. I feel great and energized, and I really appreciate clean, healthy food. get the app, you will not regret it by a long shot!
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We are glad to read that you like our app.

title: Works Well But Very Basic Unless You Pay
body: I like the way the app works, and it syncs very well with Apple Watch and Apple Health. Itâ€™s very visually appealing and fairly easy to use. BUT it can be annoying to track your food by hand since you can only use the camera feature if you pay Premium, and you canâ€™t switch plans unless you pay for Premium. Not that I want everything for free, but as an app that is advertised as free, you are VERY limited on what you can actually get for free. Not being able to change plans really bothers me, because as everyone knows, every individual is different and has different nutritional needs, which LifeSum will only support if you pay for it.

title: Love it!!
body: I donâ€™t normally write reviews but I thought this app deserved one! Iâ€™ve been trying calorie counting/fitness apps for years and Lifesum does a fantastic job and I can safely say I wonâ€™t be trying another app soon. Itâ€™s appealing to the eyes, helpful for macro counting and offers meal plans that look and taste delish! I recently just noticed that it rates the food you log and tells you which ones are good for you and which ones are bad. This app has made me enjoy tracking my food, exercise, weight, and water intake. I highly recommend this app!! Canâ€™t wait to try the pro version soon!
response: Thanks a lot for your positive feedback! We have forwarded this to the whole team so they can start their day with this motivating feedback! :)

title: Five stars well deserved.
body: I have nothing but good thing to say. I didnâ€™t have a lot of weight to lose so this app helped me get back to my goal weight pretty quickly. I was so happy with it, I purchased the full version. I now use the 5:2 plan to maintain.
response: Thanks you so much for your positive feedback! We are very happy to read that you are satisfied!

title: Wanted to love it
body: Love the UI, color scheme, and intiuitivity of the app but there just isn't a big food library available yet and I often find the nutritional information to be very inacurrate so it's back to basic my fitness pal for this girl.
response: "Our product team is collecting all user suggestions directly here: http://lifesum.uservoice.com/forums/274566-feedback-ideas/filters/top

title: I was expecting more
body: When I downloaded the app, I immediately took the quiz on what diet to follow. After completing this quiz was directed to subscribe, which I did. I thought for what I paid I was getting a meal plan to follow, but instead got recipes that I have to search for and try and figure out my meal plan. And if I find recipes, I donâ€™t have an option to create a shopping list, which would make this even more convenient. Considering one of the questions in the quiz asked why I donâ€™t eat better, with an answer of because of time, this app doesnâ€™t help with that.  It takes me more time to plan everything out and make a shopping list. Waste of money. I wish I had put it elsewhere on an app that actually did what it says it will do.
response: HI there, thank you for your feedback, we are sorry to hear you feel this way. Please feel free to contact us at contact@lifesum.com and we can assist you further in finding a plan more suitable for you, or if there is anything else you wish assistance with! Thank you!

title: Good Diary but....
body: Iâ€™ve been using it for a couple days and it seems to have a great food diary and is very user friendly but I canâ€™t seem to get my Apple Watch to get to log my water like the devs say is possible. I tried swiping up on the middle screen to log it and couldnâ€™t. So then I tried to use Siri to do it ant it said to check in the app. I made sure to have everything on and correct but it didnâ€™t work. I would like to be able to easily just log my food and water from the watch, it would help out so much seeing as Iâ€™m not supposed to have my phone out at work and thatâ€™s the main time Iâ€™m drinking my water.
response: Thank you so much for your feedback!

title: Love the interface but would love more customization
body: I bought the premium version of this app because I thought it was so cute and I really wanted something that could show my macros at a glance both in grams and percentage of my daily calorie intake. However itâ€™s really annoying that you cannot set your calorie intake yourself AND if you exercise it increases your calorie limit for the day. Iâ€™d like to see functionality where I could set my daily calories, and macros, perhaps with a slider and have more control over this than the presets provided by the different â€œplansâ€ on the app.
response: Many thanks for your rating and feedback! You can customise your macros and calorie intake under Settings > Personal Details if you choose to follow the Classic plan. You can also change the setting for excluding your burned calories from your total calorie allowance under Settings > Diary Settings > Exclude Calories. If you activate the function, your burned calories will not be added to your total. We hope this helps and we wish you the best with reaching your goal!

title: Easy to use but poor weight tracker
body: The database for food is extensive and the option to scan bar codes is really convenient but it doesnâ€™t work all of the time. Logging food is extremely easy.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback and we are very sorry to hear about this issue! Can you please send us some more details through contact@lifesum.com so we can look into this for you? Thank you in advance and our apologies for this inconvenience!

title: Great app and has helped so much but..
body: Iâ€™ve been using this app for 2 months so far and have already lost 15 pounds. It has become part of my lifestyle. The only thing that I wish would be improved would be for there to be more exercises for me to look up and log. I have been adding the approximate amount of calories burned for each exercise that I do, but it would help a lot if more exercises were added to the database. A thing that I find odd is that things like â€œcleaning the houseâ€ and â€œplaying drumsâ€ are exercises in the database while things like battle rope and vertical pull-ups arenâ€™t. Love the app but this is my only advice.
response: Many thanks for your review and awesome job with your weight loss! We are super happy to hear that Lifesum has contributed to your success! Please, check this article https://bit.ly/2kTbrOz on how to correctly track your exercise. All the best with your continuation!

title: Easy and Fun!!!
body: Iâ€™ve had SEVERAL â€œweight lossâ€ apps and this one so far is my favoriteâ€” mainly because the free options are better than most and i donâ€™t feel much pressure to download and pay $25 for the premium version. It gives me the option to log my water which is great because I really try to drink a gallon of water per day so itâ€™s easy to log. The meal logging options are easy and he little apple animations are super cute! I gave it 5 stars because you can use almost every feature for free which is not the case for most apps like this. Highly recommend!
response: Hello Jen! Thanks a lot for leaving your feedback! We are glad to read that you are satisfied with your Lifesum experience and that you are using a lot of our features!

title: Great tracker, ok plans
body: The meal tracker features are really sharp and the amount of food in their database is really top notch. Itâ€™s not hard at all to find the food youâ€™re looking for. Although some entries are not correct itâ€™s pretty easy to recognize that someone had made a mistake creating that food item, and you could usually go find another one easily.
response: Many thanks for your rating and feedback! You can customise your calorie and macros allowance under Settings > Personal Details if you choose to follow the Classic diet plan. Good luck with reaching your goal!

title: Not the best option
body: Switched to Lifesum from MyFitnessPal just to try something different. Aesthetics is pretty much all this app has going for it. The emojis that judge your meal choices are cool, but when the food info isnâ€™t correct, theyâ€™re not much help. The search database is completely off calorie-wise and most things are misspelled (even cell phones have spell check now..), so if you donâ€™t have a barcode on what youâ€™re eating, youâ€™re screwed. I found myself Googling how many calories were actually in foods - most of the time, MyFitnessPal was the first search result - and adding it manually. When you add manually, you can only input calories, no other nutrition info. Also, with MyFitnessPal, you get recipes/articles without upgrading to premium.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! That is highly appreciated and will be forwarded to the responsible team.

title: Love this APP Lifesum
body: This is by far the best tracking system Iâ€™ve found to help support weight loss or to just track food.  I personally use for weight loss.  Love how I can upload pictures of the food I eat per meal.  Love the smile icon/emojis!  Great recipes!  Love the charting information too!
response: Currently you are able to leave notes under "Details" in your Diary.

title: Absolutely Amazing
body: This is the first time I have EVER written a review on an app, but I just couldnâ€™t help myself this app is amazing! The design is beautiful and itâ€™s so simple and easy to use. Wow that sounded like something a robot would say but for real, itâ€™s so fun and I actually really like tracking my food intake and exercise thanks to this app. I donâ€™t even know how there is a free version because there are so many things on this app! It even has a barcode scanner! Overall I definitely recommend downloading this app whether you trying to lose weight, gain weight, or just be healthier!
response: We are very happy to hear that Lifesum has contributed to your healthier lifestyle and we thank you very much for your awesome review!

title: Great App With Caveats
body: The app is beautiful and great, but the meal planning and the recipes are very limited. Thereâ€™s a huge library of recipes, but they all show as â€œ4 Servingsâ€ with no way to change it. The meal plans donâ€™t last more than 3 weeks, which definitely isnâ€™t enough time to meet most peopleâ€™s weight loss goals. The water tracker doesnâ€™t let you customize the size of a bottle or glass, and the notifications donâ€™t work at all (they're enabled in the app settings and the iOS settings). It would be great to pick recipes from the app and turn them into a shopping list, or even the ability to import recipes from the web (via the share buttons in browsers), and have the ingredients auto-import into a meal plan with a shopping list.
response: Thank you for your feedback!

title: Nice layout, solid data presentation but buggy
body: I like Lifesum because it is a fresh look on nutritional data that makes it easier to manage how much I eat for each meal. The meal plans are thought and valuable. The photo the food works surprisingly well too. However the app is buggy, crashes a good portion of my uses and sometimes the data gets munged but quickly fixed with a restart of the app. It probably deserves 2 stars, but I am hopeful the quality will improve, features will be added and the food database is cleaned up. Iâ€™m not sure I would spend the 40-50$/annual subscription. The $20 I spent on the â€œpleas come backâ€ offer was a fair price for quality right now.
response: Thank you for your review and sorry to hear that you're encountering some issues with our app! Feel free to send us more details through contact@lifesum.com so we can further investigate. Thanks in advance and apologies for the trouble!

title: It's a great idea, but...
body: It's a great idea for an app, but it needs to function better.
response: Hi there, thank you for sharing your feedback! You should be able to change your start weight, please find the information on how to do that here: https://lifesum.helpshift.com/hc/en/3-lifesum/faq/244-how-can-i-change-my-start-weight---ios/?s=plans-nutrition&f=vegan-for-a-week&l=en

title: Really poor experience adding nutritional info
body: Great UI, lots of very helpful features but users are limited by the extent of Lifesumâ€™s database and the companyâ€™s ability to update it. If users canâ€™t use the barcode scanner, they can only enter calories without macros. It defeats the purpose of having any plan that tracks those, and makes the premium account kind of useless UNLESS youâ€™re eating foods that are already in the database. Combing through customer discussion boards, this has been a requested feature since 2016. Clearly this customer concern hasnâ€™t risen to the degree of import necessary to compel a design or architectural change at Lifesum in four years. Something is rotten in the state of Denmark, and Iâ€™m not staying to find out what. Keep my money, Iâ€™m out.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Annoying and limiting
body: Is there not a way to add your own food? If Iâ€™ve purchased something made by a keto bakery and have the macros, why canâ€™t I add this food? The only self add I see is the simple calorie add. I was forced to purchase the app in order to use the keto strict plan, and now itâ€™s limiting me in how I can use it. Also, i donâ€™t always have a barcode for my food. Some eggs are naked in a bowl and have no carbs. But when I take a photo, they show up as .9 carbs. This is a big deal when you can only have 20 carbs a day. Another annoying thing: I donâ€™t have time to enter an entire recipe for food or meal and allow the app to determine the macros. I have a good idea based on what I can read for myself. Why canâ€™t I just input it myself when need be? Itâ€™s very limiting and frustrating to be this expensive.
response: Thank you for your feedback. For items that you cannot find in our database, you can create custom ones under Favorites. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp. For questions on specific items, feel free to send us more details through contact@lifesum.com for further assistance.

title: Love, but keeps crashing
body: I am really loving this app because it provides great information on what Iâ€™m eating beyond calories. Iâ€™ve been struggling with losing my last 10 lbs and although I eat healthy this app makes me pay more attention to the full picture tracking calories, fat, carbs & protein (plus some) for a more balanced meal/day. The only issue Iâ€™m having is that it crashes at least 5 times a day. I have also noticed that it takes a bit for my iPad to catch up with what I log on my phone - but that is minor compared to the crashing. Hope this is fixed soon & Iâ€™ll come back with 5 stars!
response: Thank you very much for contacting us.

title: Renewed subscription but didn't receive premium features
body: I did enjoy using this app when I started out eating healthier, I even bought premium a few months ago. My subscription ended and I didn't feel the need to buy it again but as soon as I linked my card to my Apple ID in order to renew my Apple Music, the Lifesum app decided to renew my subscription & charge me for 3 months of premium as well. I didn't ask for this subscription but when I realized the payment was made and went to check on the app none of the premium features were there and the app was still insisting that I buy it. So essentially I was unintentionally paying for an app that wasn't even offering me the perks. Pretty annoyed and won't be using it anymore.
response: We deeply apologise for this! Please contact support directly at contact@lifesum.com and they will help you sort this out quickly. Thank you!

title: Befriend your hunger?! Absolutely not.
body: Took the test to see which meal plan I should follow and my â€œnutritional advisorâ€, Lykke, told me â€œWhen you befriend your hunger, you can lose weight without actually changing your lifestyleâ€. My recommended meal plan was to eat what I want 5 days a week, and fast 2 days a week. Are you KIDDING ME?!?!? Please someone else agree with me that this is unhealthy both physically and mentally. I mean really??? A NUTRITIONAL ADVISOR is helping me meal plan by telling me NOT TO EAT FOR TWO DAYS. Outrageous. This type of â€œmeal planâ€ is what encourages eating disorders. I pray this portion of the app can be removed in order to spare others from the damage it may potentially cause. I understand in limited circumstances the reason for a fast, but encouraging ongoing multi-day fasts is damaging in more ways than one. Thanks, but I will never â€œbefriend my hungerâ€.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We are very sorry that you se the 5:2 option that way. We are only offering plans in our app that do not endager your health so we can assure you that also this plan is not encouraging any eating disorders if you follow the plan recommendations given in the app. You are eating a low calorie goal on the fasting days and a higher one on the other days.

title: Getting further and further from useful
body: Iâ€™ve had this app for a long long time now, I use it from time to time to re-evaluate where Iâ€™m at with how I currently eat. Itâ€™s nice to look at and functional, however with each update more and more functions disappear and can only be used if you â€œgo premium,â€ the latest being adjusting macronutrients. I have recommended this app to so many people but Iâ€™ll have to stop if you canâ€™t even adjust your macros to your lifestyle. Looks like theyâ€™re getting rid of workout tracking too which is sad. Please bring those 2 things back to all users. Iâ€™m not going to commit to a â€œdietâ€ and track everything I eat for months, let alone a full year which is the cheapest per month.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Super simple and intuitive
body: This is a super simple and intuitive app, and with really nice design. Has a modern user interface. Tried my fitness pal but found this much more  pleasant to use. One advantage of my fitness pal is that they have more products added by other users. Fx here in Iceland I was able to find allot of local food brands. One drawback with that though is that the nutritional information might not be as accurate. It really came as a surprise to me how easy it is now to track your calorie Ã­ take using apps like these. Highly recommend this app!
response: We are very happy to hear that you are satisfied! Thank you for your review and good luck with your goal!

title: Calories complete off
body: I do love the design of the app and all of the behavioral nudges that it provides. However, it is useless to me if it cannot get my calories right. It gets the workout calories right but the step calories are completely off - first of all, they double count between steps and workouts (when I go for a run, the app adds calories for the workout and then for all of the steps); second, the amount of calories per step is huuuuge. When I compare the active calories with active calories within Apple Health, the Lifesum ones are much higher, despite Lifesum loading the info from Apple Health. I so want to use the app but if this does not get fixed, there is no way I will keep paying for premium subscription.
response: We deeply apologise for this! Please contact support directly at contact@lifesum.com and they will help you sort his out quickly. Thank you!

title: Love!
body: Still love this app but I do wish one thing. I wish there was a place to save your own recipes and be able to add them to your food journal that day. Example, I make my own Peanut butter and oatmeal balls. I know the cals and everything to these but I canâ€™t find a pb ball thatâ€™s close to it when I look it up so I would have to type in ever ingredient separately in my journal. If there was place to do that then save that as a recipe that could then be chosen as a meal, would be amazing. Other than this itâ€™s a great app. And even if you donâ€™t pay the free portion is extremely useful.
response: Thanks for the feedback! Please feel free to leave suggestions for improvement on our UserVoice: https://lifesum.uservoice.com

title: Weight loss
body: My husband and I decided to focus on health and lose some weight as well. We started with your app the end of Nov. using the 5:2 plan. We knew we didnâ€™t want a diet or eating plan we wouldnâ€™t stick with. So we picked 5:2 for itâ€™s flexibility.
response: We are super excited to hear that Lifesum has helped you improve your lifestyle! Thank you for sharing your positive thoughts on our app! Our product team is collecting all user suggestions directly here: https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd :)

title: Feature recommendation for Recipes
body: Love this app so much! Itâ€™s helped me so much on my weight loss journey. One feature I wish the app could include is the ability to customize recipes. Sometimes I donâ€™t have all the ingredients for a recipe, or maybe I would rather not eat a certain ingredient like bacon, I would still want to be able to track the accurate food items Iâ€™ve eaten in my meal. There should be an option to check off optional ingredients and calculate the updated calories and nutrient intake. I think that would make life so much easier on the app!!
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We really appreciate it and will make sure that it reaches the responsible teams. Many thanks!

title: No freshman 15!
body: Seriously, get this app. I would pay premium if I wasn't a college student (and I don't pay premium for anything!).
response: We are happy to hear that Lifesum motivates you towards a healthier lifestyle and many thanks for your great review! :-)

title: Important functionality, but marred with bugs
body: I generally like Lifesum. The aesthetic is nice, thereâ€™s a lot of food in the database, and most importantly it adds back calories to your day from the Apple Health app into your calorie total.
response: Thank you so much for leaving your review, we much appreciate it! We are very sorry to hear that you feel that way, and will make sure your feedback reaches the responsible teams. Thank you!

title: Last update made it horrible
body: I will give 4 stars, because so far I havent had any problem. BUT the last update is horrid. The search mechanism is busted. You removed the brand name from the search which is pretty important. When someone tries to search something there is no longer the tab â€œrecentâ€ and â€œfavoritesâ€. I lost 2 days from my diary, I have to scroll past all my favorite items to get to my meals. Really I dont know who thought that would be good, but UX is falling behind. It literally adds tons of unnecessary steps to reach the same goal as before. I would call it downgrade and not an upgrade.
response: Hi there, thank you very much for reaching out! Your feedback is important to us.

title: Needs improvement
body: Love the app, but itâ€™s glitchy, sometimes runs a day behind somedays itâ€™s on schedule.  Shopping list gets a little screwy and will add items not even on your list, units of measure on the list takes a little getting used too but well worth it.   Would love to see the ability of generating the list for two instead of an individual.  Also am I doing something wrong?? Doing the 3 week meal plan and when I check off the food itâ€™s not adding it to my calorie counter.  Premium membership worth it, meals and quick and easy... I love this app so far minus the glitches I seem to be having
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! Please be so kind and contact us with more details (phone, OS version installed, email) about the glitch you are describing at contact@lifesum.com

title: Not sure what I paid for
body: Upgraded to premium with the promise of meal planning and specialized diets. What the cost actually unlocked was a few specialized diets that largely were all comprised of the exact same meals. In addition the meal planning feature had a small handful of meals available with no real flexibility. For example - you canâ€™t even block a day out. I downloaded today with the intention of shopping and starting at the end of the work week and yet I was required to have a meal selected and added to the shopping list for days I didnâ€™t need. I also couldnâ€™t rotate in other meal options - even ones found within the app.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback. We are sorry to read that you are not satisfied with the Premium package.

title: WONT LET YOU UNSUBSCRIBE
body: WHAT A NIGHTMARE!!!! I didnâ€™t mean to sign up for a year. And when I followed the appâ€™s link to unsubscribe, the developer only gives you the options to renew various packages. No way to unsubscribe or cancel!!! They also automatically auto renew at the end of user package you subscribe. So if you sign up for a month or a year, at the end of that period you will be automatically renewed and charged again. I tried to cancel through Apple but as this is a 3rd party developer, Apple doesnâ€™t have the ability to do anything. And when I went to the Lifesum website and emailed customer support, I received an automated email about 3 days later informing me to follow the unsubscribe link through the app!!!! So basically the developer has locked you into a subscription with no way of canceling.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Perfect
body: I love this app. I have lost 25# following the 5:2 plan. Itâ€™s easy to make recipes follow a plan and track my macros I love that it links with apple health and my work app. Itâ€™s perfect there hasnâ€™t been anything Iâ€™ve wanted to do that I canâ€™t with this app. I also tell everyone I know about it only thing I hate is I can not change the calories in my meal plan so I just have to remember to subtract like a 100 calories a day. I just wish that feature actually worked. Itâ€™s there but when I change it it just changes right back. Other than that perfect
response: Thank you for your rating and feedback! Also, what an awesome job you did - we are super happy to hear about your success! The only diet plan you can customise regarding calorie goal and macros is the Classic plan. Our product team is collecting all user suggestions directly here: https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd :)

title: Amazing app!
body: I'm impressed! This app is so good! I started taking care of my nutrition a couple years ago, and this app that I found a month ago has been a really helpful tool when tracking my meals and calories. I strongly recommend it! Reason I give it 4 stars is that it doesn't have monthly plans. I know many apps manage yearly subscriptions but that's something I don't like. I prefer to pay a month and if I like it I keep it. This one has a 3-month but the price ends up being too high and close to a yearly payment. It's good even for its free features, but if it had a month by month I would pay for it.

title: Great, but difficult to figure out
body: I have honestly have never had this much issue figuring out an app before. The premise is great, the calorie counter/home page is super useful, but I cannot for the life of me figure out how to use the plans and the calorie count at the same time. Maybe Iâ€™m just missing a major step, but tracking food from the plan doesnâ€™t automatically add it to the calorie counter so Iâ€™m spending way too much time importing nutritional info-which is exactly why I paid for the premium, thinking I could just use their meal plans.... no such luck. If I knew I was going to have to do this much research into how to use it, I never would have paid for it.
response: Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry to hear that you find our app unclear! When following a Meal Plan, you do not need to calorie count/track anything other than the recipes in the actual plan. You can find out more about our Meal Plans here: https://bit.ly/2TpIRTM

title: Change the way you charge people!!
body: I enjoyed this app for years. Itâ€™s easy to use and personalize. I like it a lot more then fitness pal. However!, I used to be able to use so many of the features. Now if you even want to set your own Macros its premium. If you still want to make money, charge for the app and make the subscription only for the plans. That way if someone isnâ€™t interested in the plans they still pay and if someone is they pay a subscription. This has been frustrating me so much because I donâ€™t want to pay monthly for the regular tracking options. I canâ€™t even change my macros for god sake. You may as well get My Fitness Pro at this point, a lot of the things locked here are free there.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback - we will make sure your point will reach the responsible team.

title: Indispensableâ€¦ If you're serious
body: Incredible application! This app has become an indispensable part of my daily life. Once I decide to get serious about my health, Fitness and eating habits, I started looking for hey simple to use comprehensive means of tracking and I found it in Lifesum. With little effort, The application provides detailed information, feedback, Coaching, Insights into daily eating habits. Oh hell, it provides everything important to nutrition to help anybody achieve their nutrition and health goals. I would highly recommend this app to anyone serious or just curious about what they eat
response: Thank you for your review! We are happy to read that you like Lifesum!

title: Needs better nutritional data
body: Iâ€™ve been using this app for about 2 months now and have a couple issues.
response: Thank you for your review and sorry to hear that you are not satisfied. We truly appreciate your feedback and we have forwarded it to the team. Please, feel free to send us more details regarding your first issue through contact@lifesum.com so we can look into it. Thanks in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Nutrition settings lacking
body: I really enjoy the layout and concept of this app and subscribed for a premium membership, but I realized too late that the nutrition settings are lacking.
response: Thank you very much for reaching out to us.

title: So Engaging and Easy to Use
body: This app is nicely made. Iâ€™ve used many nutrition tracking apps, and this one is most engaging by far. Thereâ€™s great little touches like the grocery store beep when you scan an item, cute icons and characters. I love that it syncs with my health data to auto update my calorie allowance after exercise. I do wish there was more flexibility in setting days for 5:2 diets, since schedules can change from week to week. It would also be helpful to have an easy recipe builder for counting calories in home meals. But overall, Iâ€™m very happy with it!
response: Thank you very much for your great feedback - we are very happy to hear that you are satisfied! Our developers are collecting all feedback here http://bit.ly/2v7FxBv - we really appreciate all ideas and suggestions for improvement. Good luck with reaching your goal! :)

title: SO DISAPPOINTED!
body: I paid premium for 1 year and regret it. So much of the information is inaccurate. The measurement and the nutritional data IS NOT ACCURATE. Even using the barcode scanner provides incorrect information. Very frustrating. I end up calculating everything myself and then trying to find a correct entry that is close which is a waste of time. Because of these issues I stopped using the app for the last few months and decided to try again, hoping it might have been corrected and updated. But it has not been fixed. I really do not understand how this app has high ratings. If you check the accuracy of the information you will see how â€œoffâ€ it is. Very Disappointed. Do not waste your money on this app. Verify for yourself using the free version. ðŸ™
response: Thank you very much for your review!

title: If only it linked to my Apple Watch
body: I love this app and the customer service team is great. The ONLY two downsides are that it doesnâ€™t really sync to my Apple Watch and it clears the search after you add an item to your diary. On my watch it doesnâ€™t show the correct macro breakdowns for the plan Iâ€™ve chosen, adds in exercise calories even though they are not added in my diary, and the complication doesnâ€™t update on my watch face. When I search for a restaurant and want to select multiple items I canâ€™t and have to search after each selection. Kinda time consuming and frustrating.
response: Thank you for your review and sorry to hear that! Can you please send us more details and some screenshots showing the problem at contact@lifesum.com so we can have the team in charge look into it? Thanks in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Poor Customer Service
body: I had bought the premium of this app (was not offered a trial) so I could track my specific macros, given to me by a nutritionist. Once purchased, the app was nothing like I expected (I could not input my macros as they are over the â€œ100%â€ limit) - therefore I wanted to cancel. I have tried multiple times to reach customer service to see if they could help me in anyway, and I have yet to hear back.
response: Thank you for your feedback. 100% of macronutrients corresponds to your entire daily need of calories the application has calculated for you depending on what goal you have.

title: Good app but some bugs
body: Iâ€™ve been using this app for about 2 weeks. I really like how everything on the app is set up, and Iâ€™ve been able to keep myself in check more than I would have if I were tracking my calories, water intake, and exercise on my own. However, today Iâ€™ve been trying to input my lunch and it is not registering no matter what I do. I closed the app, restarted my phone, and tried inputting only my calories and not by food type, and still it simply will not allow me to put in my calories. I like this app but if I canâ€™t continue to put in my data, whatâ€™s the point?

title: Bad Meal plans
body: So first off, I love the recipes-they are delicious! And most of them are super easy. The app itself has been a little frustrating to figure out. I donâ€™t think you can create your own recipes. Iâ€™m doing the keto burn plan and likes the idea of not having to think about the food or plan it out. However, Iâ€™m only allowed 20 carbs a day and I just ate the breakfast on the plan without looking at the nutritional info, and it was 16.5 carbs. Looking at the rest of the day, my carbs are WAY over the limit, which will put me out of ketosis. So Iâ€™m either going to have to go hungry or get knocked out. The whole point of paying for this was so I didnâ€™t have to figure out my amounts. I ASSUMED that the recipes they used would be within my range.
response: Thank you for your feedback and sorry to hear about the issue with tracking meals from our Meal Plan. We kindly ask that you send us more details and some screenshots showing this issue through contact@lifesum.com so we can have the team in charge investigate - thank you and apologies for the inconvenience! Also, you can create your own recipes under Me > Favorites. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp and all the best with reaching your goal!

title: Great Minus The Glitches
body: Overall, this app is great. I enjoy the interface & recipe suggestions. However, there are a few glitches Iâ€™ve experienced. Sometimes the app will close when Iâ€™m trying to open it. Another glitch is when the food Iâ€™ve tracked disappears but then it comes back after a while. My last complaint is that Iâ€™m very underweight, so underweight that the app wonâ€™t let me enter my weight. It keeps saying â€œAre you sure thatâ€™s what you meant? Try a different number.â€ This was discouraging to me as I am trying to gain weight and this makes me feel more upset about my current weight.
response: We deeply apologise for the issue you are experiencing. Please either leave your contact details so we can reach out or contact us with details, step description and screenshots directly through https://lifesum.com/deep/settings?page=support - so we can start investigating your issue. Thank you!

title: Good but it could be better.
body: Overall I like the app, very easy to navigate and get used to it. It has a variety of colors that makes it very attractive for the user and a large selection of products. It's an eye attractive and user-friendly app.
response: Thank you so much for your feedback, we appreciate it and will make sure it reaches the responsible team. Please also feel free to leave suggestions on improvement on our UserVoice: https://lifesum.uservoice.com. Thank you!

title: Recipes should be modifiable
body: I am enjoying this app and the meal plans, but the recipes and meal plans could be way better. I am currently doing the keto plan and a lot of the meals have salmon, or random ingredients like halloumi or bresaola. I tried to find those last two in multiple grocery stores, but havenâ€™t been able to. These ingredients and some others are also too expensive to eat very often. Iâ€™d prefer if I could easily swap the ingredients (like there were substitutes I could edit the recipes with rather than having to enter an entire meal into the tracker just because I changed one ingredient), or the recipes used more accessible and affordable ingredients.
response: Thank you so much for your valuable feedback, we will forward it to the team in charge!

title: Visual beautiful, but bad choice in recipes
body: I was excited about ease of use. Once I was using it I found the following issues:
response: Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry to hear that you are not satisfied with our app! Our food database is partly user-created and that results in some items having inaccurate nutritional values. We recommend that you either select items verified by us or, for items that you cannot find in our database, create custom items under Favorites. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp. Regarding your comments on recipes, I have forwarded all feedback to the responsible team for future reference.

title: Love it!
body: I love the smiley face or frown face icon beside each food item I scan in, and the one beside my meal overall...it helps me to know which food items to choose again and which ones to avoid in the future. Plus, the app creates a graph of my weight gain or loss to show me visually how much progress I've made over time. Love that! Helped me get past a plateau. I've never bothered to rate an app before, but I love this one enough to actually take the time to share my opinion... five stars... totally recommend! I hope you get it and use it, because it works!
response: Thank you for your review! We are happy to read that you like Lifesum!

title: Has Potential (Free Version is Very Limited)
body: Clean look, fairly intuitive to use. Unpaid option, however, is pretty limited. I like the thought of having recipes tailed to my diet but this is a paid feature, as is connecting your other fitness apps, like Fitbit, and personalized recommendations. So the free version is basically a food/calorie tracker.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! That is highly appreciated!

title: Too many synch issues
body: I really really want to like this app. I love the interface, how it gives the different diet plan options and breaks it down in an easy way to show if you are following ( the smiley faces really have made it simple!) What I donâ€™t like is that every few days the app does not read my activity from my watch or lately load the information into my Health app. Iâ€™ve had to uninstall and reinstall the app to have it function every couple of days. For something that I am paying a $35 subscription for, the support team has yet to rectify these issues. It really devalues an app the has the potential to really make weight loss easy.
response: Thank you for your review! We are sorry to hear about this issue. Can you please send us more details and some screenshots showing the problem at contact@lifesum.com so we can have the team in charge look into it? Thanks in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: If you canâ€™t upgrade...
body: I like tracking with this app better than fitness pal but I may have to switch back because I cannot customize my plan to fit me. I have goal macros but unless you pay to upgrade you can not set the number of calories you eat or your macros. I understand that the app needs to make money to improve but the ability to customize a plan for individual needs should not be something that doesnâ€™t come standard. Also, I love that you can enter in a recipe and save it for the future but lately that feature has not been working properly.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We apologize for the issue you are experiencing with recipes. Please feel free and contact us with details, step description and screenshots at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Please also include phone model, OS and Lifesum version. Thank you!

title: Keeps crashing when accessing plans
body: I just started using the app and purchased the premium version, I was able to open â€œplansâ€ and picked my plan, the app suddenly crashed and it keeps crashing since every time I click on â€œplansâ€, I tried restarting my phone and reinstalling the app but it still crashes. I am able to track food but noticed that some of the caloric data is drastically inaccurate.
response: We deeply apologise for this! Please contact support directly at contact@lifesum.com and they will help you sort this out quickly. Thank you!

title: Fitness minded
body: I do not purchase apps often but during my fitness goals I hit a plateau, so I found this app and decided to give it a try. This is one of the best applications I have ever used! The cost is very affordable, the app is very well designed and easy to use as well. Iâ€™d like to be able to create recipes and divide it into food portions plus save them like â€œRecipeIQ â€œ but for the most part I love the app, thatâ€™s a suggestion not complaint. I love the fact I can choose what type of diet I want to be on,  Intermittent fasting is what works for me. (5:2) how about you?
response: We are happy to hear that you are enjoying our app and many thanks for your 5 star rating! :) You can create recipes and meals under Me > Favorites. Please, find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp. Good luck with reaching your goal!

title: Impossible to unsubscribe
body: Lifesum is a great app for meal prep. The user interface is aesthetically pleasing, and easy to use.....
response: Hi there, thank you for your feedback! Please email us at contact@lifesum.com with a copy of your receipt and we will assist you! Thank you!

title: Helpful but recipes not always â€œdiet approvedâ€
body: I do like this app and find it helpful when following a specific diet plan. However Iâ€™ve noticed that a lot of the recipes you can look through outside of the ones designated for your plan donâ€™t actually follow the plan you chose. For example, the keto plan. It suggests you stay under 20 net carbs per day, which is fine! But then you go look at the â€œketo recipesâ€ and they have recipes that are 15 net carbs in one serving alone. It would also be helpful if you had a basic recipe nutrition calculator to put in your own recipes to make sure you stay on track. Otherwise an intuitive and easily used app
response: Thank you for your review! Can you please send your details and issues directly at contact@lifesum.com so our support can help you further? Thank you very much in advance!

title: Lacks functionality if not choosing a plan
body: This is a pretty app, I give you that. I think if they added more features it would be great. But, for instance, even after purchasing Premium, I would not be able to plan my meals or use the shopping list premium unless I chose a Plan. Furthermore, you cannot copy or edit items you create. Those two things were very frustrating and I thought there were not going to be a problem. If you are looking to follow a plan or just track your food, it is a very good app. But if you want more functionality, specially when not following a Plan, do browse for other options.
response: Thank you very much for sharing your thoughts on our app! The shopping list feature appeared in the app as part of the Meal Plans and that is why it is currently not possible to use in any other way. Also, while not possible to copy an item you created in Favorites, you can edit the items. Please, find out more hear https://bit.ly/2X4FZxo. Our developers are collecting all feedback here https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd - we really appreciate all ideas and suggestions for improvement!

title: Not as streamlined as it could
body: This app fails to eliminate redundant taps on the main path to calorie tracking.
response: Thank you very much for taking the time to share your feedback, we will make sure it reaches the responsible team!

title: Great for those who love a clean, simple interface
body: While not as robust as apps like Lose It and MyFitnessPal, Lifesum offers a different experience. Theyâ€™ve done a great job with simplifying the process of tracking your meals and workouts. The general workflow is quick, easy, and the emojis featured with each meal keep me engaged in providing updates and improving my overall health. When I eat well, I get a super smiley emoji to reflect that, and the positive reinforcement keeps me motivated. Contrarily, when I donâ€™t eat well, a sad or angry-faced emoji appears, prompting me to do better.
response: Thank you very much for your positive review! We are very happy that you are satisfied with Lifesum and we wish you the best of luck with reaching your goal! :D

title: It definitely helps
body: Itâ€™s just a new simple and effective tool for weight loss or maintenance. The app is easy to use and it encourages you to stay within your calorie limit and gives a good breakdown of the nutritional value of the foods youâ€™re eating. I also like the ability to enter almost any exercise youâ€™re doing and have those calories added to your daily allowance. The water reminders are also a definite aid for me. Iâ€™m never drinking as much as I should. I still donâ€™t- but I donâ€™t go a day anymore without several glasses of water.
response: You got this! Thanks for your great review and good luck with reaching your goal!

title: Meal Plans are a Bust
body: I subscribed to Premium to access the meal plans. Iâ€™m on day 3 and am very frustrated with the recipes...the Carrot Soup with Garlic Creme Fraiche omits most of the instructions and I had to search through the Recipes tab to find something similar (but not exact). The measurements are in an odd combination of deciliter, cups, grams, and the occasional teaspoon or tablespoon, all in one recipe. The Turkey Spinach Omelette and Quinoa with Eggplant and Spinach are terrible recipes...they do not include anything in the way of spice or flavoring and are inedible as-is. Tracking plan meals is buggy - sometimes they do not show up in your calorie count and sometimes they do. The recipe for the Crispbread with Apple, Cream Cheese, and Walnuts tracks as 2298 calories and there is no way to fix the calorie count. Iâ€™m extremely disappointed...I do NOT recommend this app.
response: We are very sorry to hear that you feel that way! We will make sure your feedback reaches the responsible teams.

title: Not really useful?
body: The app is really good to keep you on track for the day. Without premium you can get an accurate measure of how many calories you should be eating and how many you do eat. It also keeps track of the amount of water you drink. The problem is if you can afford premium the app really doesn't do much for you. You cant get help with dieting, personalized insights, recipes, or any suggestions on what you should be eating. Without premium the most you get is a smiley or sad face that shows that you didnâ€™t eat enough calories. I feel the free option should include mote features rather that almost being a journal of food.
response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts on our app! We are charging for some of our features in order to cover our running expenses, which include a team of designers, developers and nutritionist and a total of over 60 employees. Thanks for your understanding! Feel free to send us your registered email through contact@lifesum.com for a free trial! :)

title: Recommendation
body: Really enjoying the app, has really helped making sure I stay consistent with my calories and helped make me realize when Iâ€™m falling off.
response: Hi! We're glad you're enjoying the app! Thank you for your feedback regarding the tracker, we'll make sure it gets to the appropriate team.

title: Beautiful interface, but lacking features
body: I love the interface and was excited to have a new tool that would track a keto diet for me. However, it doesn't track properly due to not counting sugar alcohols. Also, I'm unable to import recipes or create my own recipes. Therefore, I have to guess how much of which ingredient I'm having in each serving. I also wish there was a desktop version as well for when I'm at work.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Mostly love it, but a few little things
body: I love what the app looks like!! Itâ€™s for a great design that makes me want to track my calories. And I like that it recommends how many calories I consume per meal.
response: Thank you very much for your review, we are glad you like the app and appreciate the feedback. We will make sure to forward it to the team in charge!

title: Disappointed in the meal planning features
body: I purchased the premium version of this app for the weekly meal planning feature / grocery list. You donâ€™t have the ability to 1. Create your own recipes 2. Create a grocery list. With this app you HAVE to pick from a very limited number of diets in order for it to generate a meal plan (I only had the option of 2 diets) and you canâ€™t add anything in addition to what the app gives you. It seems kind of like a waste unless you only want to eat exactly what it gives you in there. The only thing I will say is that the layout / look of the app is nice & great if you want to track daily ingredients that you eat, but any features beyond that are lacking.
response: We regret that you did not like the app, but thank you very much for your feedback.

title: Not for me!
body: This is not a bad review but just my opinion. Like everyone who downloads the app (or any app) - you are asked to pay more to see more. I thought it was worth it and it was 15$. Instantly regretting my decision, I asked for a refund and was denied. The thing is I already paid for it and I tried using the special features but thereâ€™s nothing there thatâ€™s really accessible! All of the recipes call for expensive and unattainable (only available at whole foods) ingredients. I didnâ€™t think it was helpful in suggesting where I needed to go and what I needed to do.
