The only reason I havenâ€™t deleted this app is because I paid 15$ for it but I seriously never ever use it. Not for me but hope it works out for you!
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We are very sorry to hear that you were not satisfied with the app's features.

title: Will not use
body: I purchased a 6 month membership to use the plans and was charged for the 6 months and when I went to start a plan they asked me to pay all over again. I contacted customer service and they told me the error was on my end and I hadnâ€™t purchased a membership. I have a receipt from apple showing I paid and they still wouldnâ€™t do anything I needed to purchase another membership. I told them I reached out to apple for a refund and they said they hoped apple would resolve the problem and that was it. Horrible customer service, wouldnâ€™t admit there was a problem with the app and offered no guidance to resolve the problem but to spend more money without receiving the product. Hope they improve the app and their customer service.
response: Hi, thank you for your feedback and sorry to hear that you've had a bad experience with our app! Can you please send us the issue again through contact@lifesum.com so we can see what went wrong with the app and the communication with customer support? Thank you in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Best food tracking app out there ðŸ‘ŒðŸ¼
body: Iâ€™ve tested so many different ways to track my macros and nothing could make it as easy as this app. Lifesum checked off everything on the list. Recipe ideas, beautiful and seamless UX, great customer service when I emailed them to resolve an inquiry regarding activity tracking, and whatâ€™s best is that itâ€™s lightweight and FUN. I even subscribed to premium because I loved the added functionality and insights but found that itâ€™s super useful even before upgrading to premium. Would certainly recommend giving it a go!
response: Thank you very much for your wonderful review and positive feedback! We are super happy to hear that you are satisfied with Lifesum and we wish you all the best with reaching your goal! :D

title: Good but needs fixing
body: I really love the app and would give it five stars if creating your own recipe wasnâ€™t so uncomfortable to find, and forget about editing the recipe once itâ€™s in you canâ€™t fix it or change it- at least I canâ€™t, I go in and change what I did differently on a particular day and when I hit done it doesnâ€™t go through and neither does the X so I have to close and relaunch the app. Also i wish the app gave me the flexibility of viewing my own recipes and foods without having to set it up like Iâ€™m about to add a meal.
response: Thank you for your review! You can view your own recipes and other created items just by going to Me and then tapping into Favorites. We are sorry to hear that your settings aren't saved when you try to edit your items! Can you send us more details and some screenshots showing this issue at contact@lifesum.com so we can have the team in charge look into it? Thanks in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Used to be better
body: I used to love love love Lifesum, until I had I update the app today. UI changes make it less easy to get at a glance info as Iâ€™m adding meals (huge wasted space when scrolling, where the calories available, burned and eaten used to show up at).
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Great app, but...
body: The calories, carbs, protein, and fat shared to the Apple Health app are rarely correct, In 2019 this is a basic and fundamental feature that should function correctly and be put front and center over pushing users to subscribe to their premium plan. Paying for an app thatâ€™s missing this basic functionality is criminal (hyperbolic I know). Iâ€™ve been using Lifesum for ages and this issue has been present from day one after Apple released the health app.
response: We are sorry to hear this! Can you please send us more details and some screenshots showing the problem at contact@lifesum.com so we can have the team in charge look into it? Thanks in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Read through nutritional stuff you scan in!
body: So far I like this app. Lost some weight with the keto light diet and have been drinking three liters of water religiously! My only complaint is tracking food items!
response: Thanks for your review! Our food database is partly user-created and that results in some items having inaccurate nutritional values. We recommend that you either select items verified by us or, for items that you cannot find in our database, create custom items under Favorites. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp. Good luck with your goal!

title: (Updated) Binary gender choice with no opt-out
body: (Updated under the line)
response: Thank you for your review! Biological gender does not play a special role in caloric intake, but it does in calorie expenditure â€” how much you burn each day. This means we need someoneâ€™s biological gender to give them nutritional advice, or at least they must choose a gender model they believe is most physically similar to them.

title: Amazing
body: Totally worth every penny. Iâ€™m so happy I got Lifesum itâ€™s amazing, it just makes eating healthy so much easier. I donâ€™t have to guess or count calories or look at fat blah blah blah. I just punch it in and it lets me know whatâ€™s up. There are multiple plans(classic diet, Keto, vegan for a week) it has recipes and workouts... and my hands down favorite WATER TRACKER!! I can easily keep track of all the water Iâ€™m drinking and I love it!
response: We are super excited to hear that Lifesum has helped you improve your lifestyle! Thank you for sharing your positive thoughts on our app and best of luck on reaching your goal!

title: Best App out therr
body: I have fallen in love with Lifesum - I chose the keto strict plan - have been using this app for almost 2 months, I did purchase the upgrade & it is worth the extra bit of $$ ! The scan feature is so helpful - most restaurants come up - and I live & die by the daily ratings! The days I do super good with my macros are the days I have my losses, if I have a rough day (which thats ok!), I know to prepare for a stall or minor gain, but always get back on & keep following the plan! The app is also extremely user friendly - which is a huge bonus!
response: We are super excited to hear that Lifesum has helped you improve your lifestyle! Thank you for sharing your positive thoughts on our app and all the best with reaching your goal - you got this!

title: wonâ€™t give me my money back
body: I really liked this app. Very nice and organized, but when you go to pick a plan I selected the $30 for the year. A couple hours after I purchased, I decided to cancel for my own reasons. I requested for a refund after cancelling my subscription and it told me flat out I couldnâ€™t get a refund. I could understand if I used it for a month or weeks why I canâ€™t have a refund but not a couple hours after I purchase the plan. Ridiculous!
response: Thank you for your review and sorry to hear that Apple has refused to refund you. Please, send us your registered email and a copy of your transaction receipt through contact@lifesum.com so we can assist you with a refund. Thanks in advance!

title: Too Glitchy
body: I love the look of this app and prefer it over MFP in a lot of ways, but at the end of the day it is just too glitchy to continue using. Food will randomly show up on a different day that i didnâ€™t log it on, a dayâ€™s data will be missing from the daily progress section, and just yesterday all of my step counts for the week disappeared messing up my calorie intake. I also believe it is a bit generous with how many calories my steps are burning. MFP says 70 while Lifesum says 400 â€” something must be off. I also wish there was some way to set a calorie goal without selecting a meal plan.
response: We apologize for the issue you are experiencing. Please contact us with details, step description and screenshots at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Please also include phone model, OS and Lifesum version. Thank you!

title: Almost perfect
body: I really love this app. Maybe more that Fitness pal bc it lets me take a test where I can pinpoint what diet would be better for me. I am on the Keto strict diet and from the research and endless videos Iâ€™ve seen I should be counting net carbs not total carbs. Unfortunately this app counts total carb and not net carbs so that really limits me on my eating. I would love it if it keep track of my net carbs instead of total. Since that is what we should be counting when on Keto diet. Also there are a lot of recipes not found when I search and it would be nice to be able to add a recipe if i have all nutritional information.
response: Currently we unfortunately do not separate net and total carbs. That can, of course, still change in the future.

title: Helps a LOT
body: Iâ€™ve been using Lifesum for 3 days and have really enjoyed it so far. I like being able to scan and track my meals, track my water intake, get inspired for my own recipes using theirs and track my weight loss. Iâ€™m down 1.3 lbs in 3 days and I attribute that to keeping a closer eye on my portions and macros using this app. The only things I donâ€™t like about this app are my inability to create and save my recipes, as well as, the somewhat inaccurate count of my macros. Otherwise, Iâ€™ll keep using it because Iâ€™m seeing results already!
response: Hi! Thank you for your review! We're happy to hear about your success with Lifesum so far! We will forward your feedback regarding the recipes to the appropriate team.

title: Failure without support
body: I eat healthy foods and my weight is healthy and stable after two kids. I eat almost all whole foods but have been cutting down on carbs to improve. I bought the premium membership to learn about macros. Almost every meal I log is classified as imbalanced including my breakfast today of kale, avocado, tomatoes, and eggs with coffee/table cream and coconut sugar. All meals are shown as too high in something but there is no way to click in and see where you went â€œwrongâ€ so there is no learning. The algorithms seem overly restrictive and are not designed to educate. The added sugar algorithm also does not show you where the too much sugar is coming into your diet.
response: We are sorry to hear that you feel this way but thank you very much for your valuable feedback, and we will make sure that it reaches the responsible teams.

title: Fitness tracker is so much better
body: Iâ€™m so sad that I used 20$ on this app... the fitness pal tracker is so much. Iâ€™m a college student and I was really excited to get my calories checked and check my macros but this app is so inaccurate and does even put down the foods serving size or calories.... also the calories restrictions are so limited and donâ€™t really cater to your weight and how fast you want to lose weight when you are doing the specific meal plans such as the weight loss, keto or Mediterranean. Itâ€™s only been 2 days using this app and I really want my 20$ back..... I was really looking for more. I hope I can contact this team and get my mom back bc I will not be using this for 1 week let alone 3 months
response: We are very sorry to hear that Lifesum didn't meet your needs and that you encountered some issues! Please, reach out to us at contact@lifesum.com for direct assistance with your questions or with helping you with your subscription. Thank you in advance.

title: Love it! Would like to see 2 improvements
body: I am greatly enjoying the app. Itâ€™s functional, intuitive, and the design is beautiful. I wish there was a way to see your own added recipes and recipes native to the app in separate sections and not all together under â€œfavorites/recipes.â€ Moreover, itâ€™d be great if the app could incorporate intermittent fasting on a daily level as well as weekly (i.e. not only selecting days in a week when youâ€™ll eat fewer calories, as presently, but also which hours in a day you are eating every day). Thank you!
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We will inform the responsible team regarding your feedback.

title: Really great app, but...
body: I thought I was going to be able to put in my own macro percentages/grams. But since youâ€™re kind of forced to pick a diet it does the calculations for what the app thinks they should be, except I have a nutritionist and he wants me at different percentages/grams. I can not for the life of my figure out how to do this, so as of now Iâ€™m thinking that it is not a feature. Itâ€™s pretty disappointing, I really need to be able to customize my macros to what I want them to be at. I guess Iâ€™m gonna have to keep looking at apps, itâ€™s a real

title: Great layout, some glitches
body: I love the aesthetics of this app and the number of recipes and diet plans available. Iâ€™ve noticed some annoying glitches with the tracking though. For instance, it seems to switch back and forth between adding back exercise calories and not. This isnâ€™t a huge deal but itâ€™s pretty annoying when you are 400 calories under your limit then suddenly 50 over without having eaten anything new. Ideally there would be an easy way to switch this on and off as a user. For the free version at least there isnâ€™t.
response: We deeply apologize for the issue you are experiencing. Please contact us with details, step description and screenshots directly through the app under Settings/Support > click on the contact option in one of the FAQ articles -  so we can start investigating your issue. Thank you!

title: Could be a 5
body: Moved to iwatch from Fitbit and needed a food tracking solution.  Iâ€™ve been using Lifesum for 90 days now and have 1 major complaint that keeps my rating a 3 vs 5.  Lifesum allows you to save food â€˜favoritesâ€™ like Fitbit, BUT Lifesum does allow you to sort you favorites, and in fact the order in which they are listed when you access them seems different every time.  To Developers:  Please fix this to add sort option, or at least have favorites display alphabetically every time you access them.  Itâ€™s very annoying to have to search through random ordered favorites every time with the current app.
response: Thank you very much for your valuable feedback! We will make sure that it reaches the responsible teams. Please also feel free to leave suggestions for improvement on our UserVoice: https://lifesum.uservoice.com. Thank you!

title: Loosing weight
body: Like anything in life (and Lifesum) one gets out what ones willing to put in.  Itâ€™s not easy to keep ones self accountable by ones self. Discussing weight and guilty pleasure foods can be hard to do - shame ridden with face to face admissions about weight, blowing the diet, photos, measurements....Iâ€™m cringing; most of us just lie to avoid of that shame.  When I keep myself accountable of Lifesum, I can record the truth, things Iâ€™d rather not share, and feel ok with my choices without stigma and opinions.
response: Thank you so much for sharing your review, we are so happy to hear you like the app and find it helpful! If you ever need anything please do not hesitate to contact us at contact@lifesum.com and we will assist you! Have a wonderful day!

title: No major progress in years
body: - we need more flexible meals. You canâ€™t have a program for gaining if you force people to account for all of their meals in 4 slots a day. This structure prohibits success when you have to compound all your food into not enough slots. (This has been one of the most requested features for YEARS - check the forums)
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Great features and easy to use
body: My daughter uses this app and loves it so I thought Id see what all the fuss was about. Ive been using this for 2 weeks and I am really impressed. My fav part is scanning bar codes and having the info instantly pop up. Saves me time and hassle.  You can adjust everything, whether you want it to track 3 or 4 veggies or fruits; it is all adjustable. You can even set how many calories you need to eat. It is so versatile!  I have had so much fun with this. Ive lost 10 lbs (some water weight) so far.  Thanks!
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! That is highly appreciated!

title: Changing macro levels is premium now
body: Today I deleted lifesum and downloaded my fitness pal. I didn't want to. I like lifesum much more as it has a nicer user interface and minimal clutter. It is pleasing to the organized eye. The reason is when I went to start food tracking again, I wasn't able to change my macro percentages unless I switched to premium. I used to be able to change this no problem with the free one, and was so shocked I decided to switch immediately. Changing macro levels should be no different than changing your calories. Fix it lifesum! I would much rather use your app, but I will not be paying for it.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Very helpful
body: I use the free version and itâ€™s very helpful at keeping me on track for calories, exercise, and water. I LOVE the barcode scan to make tracking food way faster. The carb/protein/fat tracker is also a nice bonus. My only complaint is that it seems to be operating for someone who has a traditional 9-5 life. So when I get up at 10:30 AM itâ€™s telling me that itâ€™s almost time for lunch, it gives me a bad score when I havenâ€™t eaten enough by 7, and stops notifying me and updating by like 9 PM. Rather annoying for a night owl like me, but itâ€™s an easy thing to ignore. Overall Iâ€™m very pleased!
response: Many thanks for your positive review! We understand that this can be an issue for our users that have different everyday routines and we recommend that you submit your request in our Uservoice page https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd - we would very much like to see your feedback there!

title: I love it!
body: I love this app and all of its features, I use the free version and still feel like itâ€™s helpful! The only thing I wish was different would be the ability to enter foods specifically to what you ate, (i.e. I made a breakfast sandwich this morning that was a plain bagel, provolone, chicken and egg, but they didnâ€™t have anything similar to choose from for my breakfast so I had to choose a chick-fil-a sandwich instead) rather than making you choose from pre-made selections, it would allow your calorie intake to be more accurate and help with your program (whichever you choose to do).
response: Thank you for your feedback!

title: I gave it a shot
body: I really wanted to love this app.  I was excited for a replacement of MyFitnessPal and with all the positive reviews, I jumped in with a subscription.  However the app is glitchy and some of the functionality really annoying.  This morning I logged my breakfast with a picture.  It only correctly identified the red pepper (it was eggs with veggies, banana, peanut butter and English muffin).  So after adding the rest, it didnâ€™t actually save the picture.  I originally was excited thinking you could take a photo, log the details later, but that doesnâ€™t work.  <<highly recommend you add this for people who canâ€™t log at meal time.  I am going to move on and hope to give this app a shot another day.
response: We are sorry to hear this! Can you please send us more details and some screenshots showing the problem at contact@lifesum.com so we can have the team in charge look into it? Thanks in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Great app when it works
body: I was loving this app, great way to keep track of everything and it would work with my Apple Watch and transfer all the info I needed it too. Lately itâ€™s not keeping my profile info and I have to constantly update it on a daily basis which makes this is a pain to have to go thru. Can you fix it please. Iâ€™ve never paid for an app and this is the first and I was living it till the last week or so having this issue makes me not want to renew... fix it and Iâ€™ll bump it up a star, but if the problem persists Iâ€™ll have to take away stars
response: Thank you very much for contacting us!

title: Iâ€™m happy
body: Even though there is some premium thing, doesnâ€™t mean you have to pay. Thereâ€™s already a lot of things that it has for you that is free! Iâ€™m very happy with this app because it helps me control my weight. For your meals and snacks you can type in what you had and it will tell you about that food! I also really like that test you can take to tell you if youâ€™re healthy or not. If you arenâ€™t as healthy, it will help you! I suggest getting this app because of how helpful it is. Iâ€™m definitely happy.
response: Many thanks for your positive review - we truly appreciate your feedback and we are very happy to hear that you're satisfied!

title: User friendly except...
body: Iâ€™ve only used this app for a couple days so far and I like it a lot. I only wish the shopping list was a little more user friendly. Iâ€™d prefer that when you add items to the list it doesnâ€™t organize them in any way. It would save time in the grocery store.
response: Thank you for your rating and feedback! Feel free to send us some examples on the items/recipes you find inconvenient through contact@lifesum.com so the team in charge can take a look. Thank you in advance!

title: Gorgeous interface, helpful features, amazing customer support
body: This app is wonderful! And VEGAN FRIENDLY!
response: We are very happy to hear that you're enjoying our app! Thank you for your review and good luck with your goal!

title: Very unhealthy
body: For someone who suffers with an ED this app has not helped. I have gained the weight back and tried using this app to maintain my weight. Normally females should have around 1,600-2,000 calories. The app was recommending for me to have only 457 calories a day! And as I continue using the app it recommends I only eat 328 calories!!! Calories are energy and thatâ€™s what your body needs. To eat less than 1,000 a day is not healthy. For the app to even recommend that is not ok. While it is good to eat healthy like fruits and vegetables, carbs and protein should be included. The app recommended me to only eat 41 grams of carbs a day. The app is promoting orthorexia and should be reevaluated.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback.

title: Great app with too few food options
body: I love the look and feel of the app. I love that it integrates the best with my Apple Watch of all the similar apps out there like MyFitnessPal. I want to switch over from MyFitnessPal to Lifesum, I really do! But MyFitnessPals ability to scan bar codes to input food, to manually put in the calories and nutritional information of a food and to save my own collections of meals is really whatâ€™s keeping me from using Lifesum. Also the database of food, restaurant menus on MyFitnessPal is way WAY bigger, accurate and better than Lifesum. And MyFitnessPal provides all these better things for free no less!
response: Lifesum is offering all these functions as well:

title: Like it but it would be better if it had more plans available
body: I was using this app to track my macronutrients while I was on the keto diet, but now I switched out to paleo. I really love the details it shows you from what you eat, my only issue with this is that I wish there was a paleo plan but I can also see a difficulty in that existing since paleo doesnâ€™t track calories nor does paleo track macros. I guess it would just be an open nutrition count. It would be cool if they added some hints or guiding info on how to work on the paleo diet for others to follow as beginners.
response: Thank you for your review! Our developers are collecting all feedback here https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd - we really appreciate all ideas and suggestions for improvement!

title: Easy, informative
body: Iâ€™m usually not good at maintaining any diary, but Lifesum makes it easy.  I havenâ€™t used the camera successfully yet, but I have found comparable foods in the app.  I like that the app incorporates information from my Apple Watch; less info for me to enter.  Having actual metrics available at any time is enlightening.  Itâ€™s easy to think Iâ€™m doing well with my diet, but Lifesum provides me with real data.  It also gives little tidbits and supportive comments throughout the day for encouragement and education.  Glad I got it.
response: Thanks a lot for your rating and feedback!

title: Some issues
body: I got the app on recommendation of the google health app. I was looking for something that would sink easily with the data from the health app. I got the app and it showed I needed to go premium to be able to see everything. No problem, just a few bucks a month. Issue is now that Iâ€™ve paid for the premium membership the app keeps telling me I need to upgrade, but when I go to upgrade it tells me I already have. I have tried signing out and signing back in and even deleting the app and then re downloading. Neither of these seemed to help. I have also reached out to the developer and not received any response. Seems like it would be a nice one stop app to monitor calorie intake and physical activity, if it would just work.
response: We apologize for the issue you are experiencing. Please contact us with details, step description and screenshots at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Please also include phone model, OS and Lifesum version. Thank you!

title: Inaccurate Food Data
body: I was not a big fan of this app due to the lack of accuracy of Lifesum certified foods in calories, macros, and/or serving size. About half of the foods I looked for in the first two days were not accurate in serving size or calorie amount. I quit after that because thatâ€™s the one thing that a calorie tracker needs to be - accurate; otherwise, whatâ€™s the point?
response: Hi there, thank you very much for your feedback. We are sorry to hear you did not like the app. As stated in our terms we offer refund within 14 days of purchase, so please contact us at contact@lifesum.com with a valid receipt and we will assist you!

title: Inaccurate nutrition facts
body: Even when you scan the barcode the nutritional information does not match, making it cumbersome to accurately track your macros. Pay close attention... you scan a package of sliced pepperoni (for example) the package gives the nutritional facts, per serving. A serving of pepperoni in this instance is 4 slices. The application however extrapolates that that is the nutritional information per slice. It has done this with every single thing I have scanned. The data is the same for what is already cached in the application. Which is why I have been scanning my food, because itâ€™s wrong. The application itself looks great. Developers just to step it up a bit on the accuracy.
response: Thank you for review and sorry to hear that! Can you send us more details and screenshots showing examples of other items you've had this issue with so we can further investigate? Thanks and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Makes being healthy a habit
body: I love this food tracker! Unlike other trackers it wants you to create healthy habits that will last long after youâ€™ve lost or gained the weight you want. Other food tracking apps are ugly and too complicated while Lifesum is a gorgeous app that simplifies healthy eating. The only thing I donâ€™t like about the app is the frowny faces it gives when you eat â€œbadâ€ foods. The app should promote balance in healthy eating and not make users feel guilty for enjoying a square of chocolate when they want to.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback, this is very appreciated! We will inform responsible team regarding your feedback.

title: Not worth premium
body: I bought the premium version and itâ€™s not worth it. Iâ€™ll log an exercise and itâ€™ll be gone the next time I go in. Iâ€™ll log my weight and then itâ€™ll be different next time. This happens on all sorts of areas, even my birthdate has changed on me, and I continually need to check back on things and correct. And itâ€™s a little weird. It measures water intake by 8.45 ounces, and itâ€™s hard to enter the exact the nutrition facts, like itâ€™ll recalculate my calories to be 59 rather than 60. Also, I canâ€™t set my own nutrition goals or macros, I have to use one of their five preset plans. Itâ€™s just odd. Also, huge annoyance is that it doesnâ€™t sync steps with Fitbit, only workouts! So I have to manually enter steps into Apple health. Just so frustrating.
response: Thank you so much for sharing your feedback, we are very sorry to hear that you are experiencing these issues. If you wish to share more details regarding the issues please feel free to send an email to contact@lifesum.com so that we can investigate the matter further. Thank you!

title: Nice app but needs some improvements.
body: I have an iPhone 12 Pro Max and parts of the UI are getting cut off in the corners. Also, the keyboard gets in the way when trying to enter a value for potassium in a custom food. I would also like to be able to edit the name of scanned foods because the names are either incorrect or excessively long; e.g., scanned name: â€œBreakfast nutriflakes cereal 40% bran flakesâ€, actual/shorter name: â€œNutriFlakes Cerealâ€. Being able to edit the brand would also be nice, just in case. Another feature I would like are more micronutrients to track, not just potassium.
response: Thank you for your review! Could you please either leave your contact details so we can reach out or send more details directly to contact@lifesum.com so our support can help you further? Thank you very much in advance! We apologise for the inconvenience.

title: Needs Notes!
body: This is a great app thatâ€™s super easy to use and I definitely be down to pay for premium but itâ€™s missing a basic notes section that I can just put in thoughts about how I feel and other notes about my health. When it comes to tracking, data is super important and being able to add as much as possible is very helpful. When you go to the doctors and they ask you to track your food intake they almost always tell you to just write down the stream of consciousness rather than just static calories and stuff.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Food database is way off
body: I was just kinda sick of the MyFitnessPal UI so I decided to try out Lifesum for calorie counting. I thought there would be more plans with the paid version, but turns out there are maybe 10 tops and I wouldnâ€™t call them â€œplansâ€ per se, more like â€œgeneral themes without much personalizationâ€.  I like the Lifesum UI but when Iâ€™m without a barcode and have to use the search bar to enter food, I end up with lots of odd, misspelled options with ENTIRELY different calorie counts!  One of the first options that came up for olive oil said there were 58 calories in a TB, roughly half the actual amount.  Despite prepaying for 6 months I think I might have to go back to MyFitnessPal just for reliability.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We are very sorry to hear that you feel that way and will forward your feedback to the responsible team.

title: Great but Missing Some Features
body: Overall, the food tracking and recipe portion of this app are pretty good. I wish I could get more specific about the types of meal plan Iâ€™m following or want to follow. But mostly I wish it would also allow tracking of physical and mental wellness as well. Like itâ€™s great to be able to track on a given day that my mood and/or energy felt high, and also I did or didnâ€™t have a stomach ache. All of these things are so important when looking at trends and big picture for our health & wellness. Iâ€™ll keep looking for an app that can incorporate this as well, and hopefully one day Lifesum will be that app.
response: Thanks for the feedback! That would definitely be a great improvement.

title: Clean Eating could use improvement
body: I got this application as a vegan/plant based eater. The clean eating intrigued me, but Iâ€™m disappointed to find there is no meal plan for it, just recipes. I also find it disappointing that recipes are usually imbalanced or off track, even though they are suggested from the app. Iâ€™d like to see balanced, on track recipes, so that I can have an idea of how to eat better.
response: Thank you for your feedback! Can you please send us some examples of the recipes in question at contact@lifesum.com so we can look into this? Thank you and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Donâ€™t buy the premium subscription
body: I used the free version and finally decided to upgrade to premium. They make you pay for the whole subscription (in my case I did one year) up front. This wouldnâ€™t be a problem except my account STILL doesnâ€™t show that I have the premium subscription even though I paid for it. Itâ€™s been three days and Iâ€™ve sent emails and followed instructions from their â€œcustomer serviceâ€ page. Also the premium Lifesum subscription isnâ€™t eligible for a refund from the App Store. Donâ€™t buy premium unless you feel like throwing $40 away without receiving what you paid for or hearing back from the company support. Very disappointing because I was so excited to unlock all the extra features.
response: Thank you for contacting us! We deeply apologise for the long response time at the moment.

title: What I have been looking for
body: This app is awesome! I wanted something similar to the Fitbit app not that I have an Apple Watch and my steps and workouts dont transfer correctly. Tried a few apps out and this one takes the cake. Even better than the Fitbit app and less expensive. This app collects steps and workouts from apple watch without issues and what i really like is how it breaks down the different nutrients you are or not eating. It has been really helping me change bad habits I didnâ€™t know I had.
response: Thank you for your review, we're very glad that we have been able to help!

title: Everything I ever wanted
body: This app is the best tracker in all things health I have ever used. And Iâ€™ve used a lot. I wonâ€™t say all of them but .... Iâ€™ve used a lot of apps and tracking systems since I started being cognizant in 2008. It makes me want to be better with my diet and exercise and explains exactly what is going on with my health and fitness in terms I can understand. It has SO many options for diets and explains the benefits of each and why each macro breakdown is suggested. Canâ€™t recommend it enough. Iâ€™m obsessed!!!
response: We are very happy to hear this! Thank you so much for leaving your feedback! :)

title: Amazing helper!
body: Iâ€™ve been running semi-competitively for years now, and this app helps me keep up with my nutrition! Iâ€™m constantly trying to find ways to eat as healthy as possible and it gives so many reminders and options for recipes to live a healthier lifestyle. I will say though, if you sincerely want to change your eating habits with this, there is the premium option which opens the door for all of the recipes, diet and exercise plans for all to try. Overall an amazing helper to live a healthier lifestyle!
response: Thank you so much for your kind words and positive review, we are very pleased to hear that you are satisfied!

title: Pretty but buggy
body: ETA: Got the paid version assuming it would be more useful after so much time. Realized that you canâ€™t measure custom recipes in grams or anything but servings. Useless, am changing to one star.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback. We are sorry to hear that you feel this way, and have forwarded your feedback to the teams in charge.

title: Good Premium Product, some annoying app bugs
body: Overall, a good product. Love the diet suggestions and premium product is good. Diet tracking is okay, lots of missing barcode data so not as good as other mainstream diet trackers. A few bugs in the app around food entry, specifically doesnâ€™t refresh and even if you put in food it doesnâ€™t seem to process entries. I suspect this is an issue with the latest update. Although the lack of refresh in the diary has been a recurrent problem. Overall, I enjoy the product however Iâ€™m neutral on the premium product, itâ€™s okay but their are other more viable alternatives.
response: We deeply apologize for the recent issue.

title: reverting my weight tracking,  lacks meal plans, recipes obscure limited dietary preference
body: Truly wish i didnâ€™t go premium before the trial expired, wasted money and want a refund.  Too difficult to use, consistently reverts my weight back to previous weigh ins so while iâ€™m progressively losing and NOT regaining weight the tracker looks like a yo yo, (i was at 158# last week and when i went to log my new weight is 157# today, the tracker had changed my weight to 162, has happened multiple times) lacks dietary preferences options, only very broad categories available to choose from like vegan, vegetarian and one other,  recipe ingredients in meal plan are complex and unrealistic, not enough dietary preferences and lacks meal plans for most dietary preferences.  Do not like at all.

Please, reach out to us freely at contact@lifesum.com for assistance with the issues you are experiencing or for assistance with your Premium subscription.

title: A little disappointed
body: The interface is beautiful but difficult to navigate. Some foods Iâ€™ve scanned donâ€™t match the package nutritional content at all.  I do a lot of my own cooking and adding recipes would be a lot easier with a bulk ingredient import option. Getting to your saved foods and adding new ones is not intuitive.

Regarding the calorie feedback on the similar meals, can you please send us more details and some screenshots at contact@lifesum.com so we can look into it? Thanks in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Great app but buggy
body: Lifesumâ€™s done a great job with diet goals and making recording food consumption easy (barcode scan database is impressive).
response: We apologize for the issue you are experiencing. Please feel free and contact us with details, step description and screenshots at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Please also include phone model, OS and Lifesum version. Thank you!

title: Why premium?
body: I give this app a 3 star rating because if you donâ€™t have premium, then when you go in recipes or need the IMPORTANT information, you need to pay to get premium which is not fair... We should at least get the important information... The good things about it is that itâ€™s fun to use when you want put what you are and it really is a good diary! Then if you are too little calories, then it will say you need to eat only a little bit more and it will also say if you are too much! I got this app from a YouTuber! Anyway, thatâ€™s what I think about this app! Ok but also horrible at the same time! ðŸ¥³ðŸ¥ºðŸ˜¡
response: We are charging for some of our features in order to cover our running expenses, which include a team of designers, developers and nutritionist and a total of over 60 employees. Thanks for your understanding!

title: Would love to use but
body: Offers no free trial, offers no free recipes, offers really nothing. In order to use anything, you have to shell out money straight away and with all the different apps out there for helping with weight loss, being able to try before buy is extremely important.

title: Love it!!
body: Iâ€™m back to 5 stars because the bug that didnâ€™t allow me to add foods to the tracker has been fixed. The developers responded to everyone complaining about the issues by fixing the problem and Iâ€™m really glad I can use the app again, the problem was solved pretty quickly and efficiently and I applaud them for that, many apps donâ€™t care to fix problems quickly. Itâ€™s a great app, and Iâ€™ve tried just about every food/nutrient tracker out there, this is by far my favorite.
response: We deeply apologize for the recent issue.

title: Worthless
body: Downloaded the app and got stopped in my tracks. Unless you go premium, some of the basics needed donâ€™t work. So this was deleted immediately.  So I get a response back but all they want to do is justify the cost. I donâ€™t even know what it costs because one key factor not in the trial is key to know if I want to spend the money. Iâ€™m not spending a dime without knowing if this really works. You talk about your 60 employees but never asked what the issue was.
response: Hi again, thanks for updating your review! On our last reply we sent you this: "Feel free to send us your registered email through contact@lifesum.com for a free trial!" Offer still stands of course!

title: Beautiful mess
body: (Disclaimer I absolutely never write reviews but this had to be said.)
response: Thank you for your review. Itâ€™s a big challenge for us to allow people all across the world to track their everyday foods. Our users help by contributing missing foods to our database. Unfortunately, these contributions can have errors, as you discovered. We are constantly working to fix these errors, so we appreciate your feedback!

title: App could use marketing work
body: I havenâ€™t actually used the app yet because when I open it (a few months after I downloaded) and I had no idea what the app did. Having a splash screen with benefits is key to explain your product - my only other option was to approve the use of my data...
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: The app is saying the server is down
body: I went to input my exercise for the day and when I tried to search the exercise , it wouldnâ€™t load. I waited for about 10 minutes, exited out of the app and turned my wifi on and off. It still wouldnâ€™t load. I went back out of the app one more time and when I went back in, the option to track my workouts was gone. I tapped the plus button and it still let me click on the workout tab, but still wouldnâ€™t load the workouts. I decided to delete the app and re-download, hoping it would reset whatever was wrong. Now it wonâ€™t let me back in and is saying there is an error with the server, which disappoints me because I like using this particular app.
response: We deeply apologize for the recent issue.

title: Updated ( sometime went wrong with the new update)
body: I started using Lifesum about 3 months back and it had been amazing. It used to be user friendly and straightforward. I managed to loose 2 kg / monthly and still going . However, something went terribly wrong with the new update. It crashes and requires logging in and gets stuck when I try to log in with my apple account. It made me regret paying for the next 3 months. I also noticed that the number of calories of the classic diet plan has been changed to 1600 , why? Please fix all these glitched and get it back to how awesome it used to be.
response: Hi  there, thank you for reaching out to us! We are very sorry to hear that you are experiencing this! Please update to the latest version in App Store (v. 12.4.0) and if that should not fix the issue, please contact us directly at contact@lifesum.com. In regards of the calorie intake, you can change this by overwriting the number under Settings > Personal details > Calories/ day. Once again, we apologise for the issue and please let us know if the issue still persist after the update! Thank you!

title: Easy to use
body: I absolutely love the ease of this app. The Bella Twins from WWE, shared info about this app. Of course I thought , here goes - another celebrity endorsed product , but itâ€™s a great food diary. The best part is that I can scan in my food items with the barcode scanner. I tried out the free app for a couple weeks and wasnâ€™t bombarded by ads which I was very surprised about. This made me upgrade to the premium app because the makers â€œgot itâ€. You can get more users when you donâ€™t overwhelm users with ads . Thanks!!!
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! That is highly appreciated!

title: Self entering macros
body: I have really come to love this app! Itâ€™s a bit overwhelming at first but once you get into a groove itâ€™s very user friendly. I actually prefer this app over MyFitnessPal personally. I like that you can just add in calories if the app does not have your food items stored though I wish we could manually enter macros in ourselves also. Sometimes I have a recipe with calories, carbs, protein and fat written out but I am limited to only entering my calorie number in the app. It would be nice to be able to put in the macros myself to keep an accurate count!!
response: Thank you very much for your positive review! You can create your own custom made items where you can manually enter all nutritional details under Me > Favorites. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp

title: All the features!
body: Everything I didnâ€™t know I was missing in those other food tracking apps. Love that it correlates with a diet plan and adjusts for your individual needs. Love that it connects with my Fitbit so I donâ€™t have to enter as much data. Love the tips and reminders to help me know Iâ€™m doing alright and keep me on track with the plan. Love that I can save groups of foods as a meal and reuse it again next time I eat the same meal without hunting down each individual ingredient again. Button line, love.
response: And we love that you love our app, this makes us very happy! :) Many thanks for sharing and good luck with reaching your goal!

title: A Great way to be healthy
body: This app makes recording your meals and tracking your calories so much easier than any other app that Iâ€™ve ever used. Plus all of the feedback that you get when youâ€™re recording your meals helps you to know whatâ€™s better for you and worse for you all without forcing you to be on a meal plan. Premium is definitely worth it if youâ€™re trying to get your health on track plus they give you a discount for like 30% on your first year subscription.
response: Thanks you so much for your positive feedback! We are very happy to read that you are satisfied!

title: Great foundation for a better life
body: Without paying, there is already a great number of resources to help track my calories and know what foods Iâ€™m eating are good for my desired diet. Visually interesting enough to provide a sense of accomplishment when being healthier and already feeling the results in the first week. Would love for the option to see why certain foods are unhealthy for my diet to be a â€œfreeâ€ addition to the app, but understandably an app needs paying customers to keep running without huge advertisements plastered over it.
response: Thanks a lot for leaving your feedback! We are glad to read that you are satisfied with your Lifesum experience.

title: I lost 32 lbs in 10 weeks!!
body: I love love LOVE this app!!!!! I wish I couldâ€™ve given it a bonus star! In just 10 weeks, I went from 249lbs to 217lbs, my waist went from a 47 to a 44, and my BMI went from 44.1 to 38.4! I did this with just the free version. This app kept me accountable and is beautifully designed. Watching my charts change and been so motivating! I coupled this app with the Fitness22 Workout app to achieve my results and I couldnâ€™t be more grateful! Thank you so much for such a fantastic app! I recommend this to everyone!!
response: We are super excited to hear that Lifesum has helped you improve your lifestyle! Thank you for sharing your positive thoughts on our app!

title: Great app, wish it persisted data better
body: I really love this app, the ease of use, design, thoughtfulness of features. I wish it persisted data a little better. Every few days it will reset my weight back to my starting weight and log that instead of my input, which has gotten annoying. It also loses connection to the Fitbit every other day and I have to go connect it all back up again. Iâ€™m sadly searching for a new app even though I love this one the most. I hope they fix those issues because otherwise itâ€™s perfect!
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We will inform the responsible team regarding your feedback.

title: Beautiful, Buggy Mess
body: I've been using this app for over a year now. This is the only food tracking app that I've stuck with solely because of the UI. But the user experience is made awful by the clunkiness of its execution. Surprisingly often I'm unable to scroll past my lunch entry when I attempt to input dinner. Or looking at past days I'm unable to scroll. Syncing is also hit or miss. Overall, using this app is sort of tragic since it's so close to a seamless experience but they haven't yet taken the extra step to make it as reliable as it could be. I'm hoping they can update this app to be as seamless as other cloud-reliant services.
response: We are sorry to hear that you are having a bad experience with our app and we thank you for your feedback! Could you please send us more details regarding these issues through contact@lifesum.com so we can investigate them? Thank you in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Canâ€™t customize a â€œplanâ€ for vegetarian or Vegan
body: Unfortunately even though this app is lovely and easy to use, itâ€™s hard to customize vegan meal plans with limited choices. You are forced itâ€™s choices for dieting but when you click vegan there are about 3-4 choices for breakfast, lunch and dinner qhich gets boring fast. Additionally adjusting your cal goal is also nearly impossible, while itâ€™s under settings, it doesnâ€™t actually adjust no matter how many times you save so itâ€™s hard to track how on target you are. Lastly you canâ€™t change your macros by day so you are stuck to whatever macros you enter as the target regardless if you likely have variations by day. ðŸ˜ž
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Good But ...
body: This is a good app ! I like all the features and how easy it is to use , I also like how you can add water and have veggie / fruit / sea food goals as well for the day / week !! The only thing I don't like about this app is that the water tracking feature only allows you to track two different amounts , this makes it very hard to add in water when your water bottle / cups aren't that amount . it would be great and would really help the apps likeability if the delevopers could make it so you can add your own custom amounts to their liking !

title: cool app, BUT...
body: Think this app is awesome. The layout is great and beautiful. I love that you can get a feel for the app before paying for it, which in my opinion is awesome. I love that you can customize your settings, and make it fit your goals. So it truly is a beautiful app.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Videos on cooking
body: I sign up for three months, not sure if Iâ€™ll renew. The application is great but it doesnâ€™t give any feed back. Thereâ€™s not a coach on line to give you ideas on what to do, where to cut back exercise. For the price I was expecting more. I like that I can keep track of food and with the faces I know Iâ€™m on track or not, but then I could do that with other apps for free. Iâ€™m a visual person I would like to see videos of the recipes given on the app. I really hate the measurements in grams there should be a way to change them to cups, teaspoon, etc.
response: We are very sorry to hear that you feel that way! We will make sure your feedback reaches the responsible teams.

title: Wonderful  BUT...
body: This app really helps me be aware of the things I eat and serving sizes . The only problem I have is that I will click a day and log my meal then I will go back later to log my snack and my progress is gone . I looked at the day before and my information had moved days . Thinking it was user error , I would double check to make sure that Iâ€™m logging my progress on the correct date only to have the data move again . Iâ€™ve had several sequential days shifts dates and this has happened on several occasions .
response: We apologize for the issue you are experiencing. Please feel free and contact us with more details at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Thank you!

title: Needs more
body: Cool app and very helpful to track macros. Really helped me on my start with keto. However, the diet options are pretty minimal and I really wish I could construct my own goals rather than buy into pre-set ones.
response: Here you find informaion on how to manually set your macros: https://lifesum.helpshift.com/a/lifesum---healthier-eating-better-living/?p=all&s=user-profile-settings&f=how-can-i-change-my-macros-carbs-fat-and-protein-settings-individually---ios

title: Confusing units
body: I like this app a lot. The design and features are helpful for successful and consistent tracking. However, the units listed for many foods when trying to add to the food diary are often confusing or just wrong. You might see something listed as â€œone servingâ€ or listed as 190 calories when you know it to be 100 calories. I believe it is possible to edit these, but I do not always know the number of calories in my foods or Iâ€™m in a hurry. This is not a great app if youâ€™re often on the go, because you may have to double check the number of calories using other sources.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! Please, feel free to send us examples of the items you're referring to at contact@lifesum.com so we can look into the issue. Thanks in advance!

title: Will there be new plans?
body: So far Iâ€™m really enjoying the app, so much in fact that I have become a subscribed user. I enjoy the way it recommends meals and allows you some options. So far my only question is whether or not there will be anymore plans added in the near future. Personally Iâ€™m looking 16/8 hr fasting option. The last option that would really advance my experience would be if there was an option to enter your personal MACROS to try and follow. Are either of these options available in the near future? Thank you.
response: Thank you for your review! If you use the Classic plan, you can set your own calorie allowance and macros. For any suggestions regarding new plans added and more, our developers are collecting all feedback here https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd - we really appreciate all ideas and suggestions for improvement!

title: Could be better
body: Lifesum is a good app that could be better. I started this year trying get on track with my health and weight. I like the ability to track my calories, however with this app there are some problems. Most of the things you want to track are premium.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Please change this !!!
body: Iâ€™m only give four stars because everything is perfect in the app EXCEPT for the fact that youâ€™re not allowed to change your carb intake! I donâ€™t know why they would lock that SINGLE feature. It says pay for premium to be able to edit your macros but when you do you can only change your proteins and fat. Iâ€™m so annoyed with this because itâ€™s saying I need to intake way too many carbs for my ketogenic diet. Please PLEASE unlock this feature ASAP, this feature alone might make me cancel my newly paid subscription.
response: Thank you very much for your review and for sharing your thoughts on our app! It is possible to customise your calorie allowance and all macros when following the Classic diet plan. The percentage for the carbs is locked in the keto plans as we otherwise do not have any technical solution to allot matching recipes. You can now choose between three plans (20, 50 or 100 grams of carbs) and you are able to manually change fat and protein. Good luck with reaching your goal!

title: Iâ€™m Amazed by this App

title: Love the app! But confused...

response: It is up to you if you want to consume the calories you burn when exercising. It is most likely that you will reach your weight loss goal faster if you exclude those calories, however, faster doesn't always equal a better result in the long run. You should also make sure, if you decide to exclude your exercise calories, that you are never hungry and that you feel well. If you feel hungry, fatigued or have any other symptom of unwellness, this most likely indicates that you are not consuming enough calories. The important thing is to listen to your body! Thanks for your 5 star review and good luck with reaching your goal!

title: Beautiful Interface Awful Frustrating Inaccuracy
body: I downloaded this and another food tracking app.  Both offer free and premium subscriptions. Even when scanning my food via barcode the calories, serving sizes, and other specific nutrition info is BLATANTLY WRONG.  I logged the same food on the other app the same way by scanning barcodes and everything came in correct.  I definitely wonâ€™t be getting a premium subscription with Lifesum when itâ€™s free service canâ€™t even log food accurately.  Donâ€™t waste your time or money.

Unfortunately, these contributions can have errors, as you discovered. We are constantly working to fix these errors, we hope youâ€™ll try us again in future.

That is tedious though because not all of the recommended recipes are appropriate for your selected diet plan. There is also a feature where you can select diet preferences and allergies. That doesnâ€™t seem to inform any of the recommendations either as most of my recommended meals contained dairy of which Iâ€™m allergic to. This app was a total waste of time and money.

title: Changed Everything
body: Iâ€™ve suffered from eating disorders since I was 12, and I started using this app to keep track and regulate what I eat. title: Be careful when purchasing premium
body: This app is very misleading when purchasing Premium. It gives you a break down of how much you would pay each month when purchasing multiple months. This leads you to believe you paying monthly and can choose to cancel at anytime if you choose. After receiving a $30 bill, I realized that you pay the total upfront and you are not billed monthly. When I reached out to the App Store, I was told the purchase is non-refundable. Even though I am now stuck with the app for a year, I doubt I will even try it now. I am disappointed that I was lead to believe I had the flexibility of cancelling if I chose to do so.
