title: Great but needs a little work
body: Great app but definitely some glitches. Iâ€™m doing a keto diet and had the strict plan, I wanted to see what the keto medium plan had as a limit for carbs but found it to be too many carbs and now I canâ€™t go back to the strict one. They should let you see all of the plans available vs limiting you based on the quiz. The quiz on a web browser is also different. Making meals/recipes is a little wonky too. Everything else works out great tho. Love the barcode scanner!
response: Hi there, thank you very much for your feedback! Please feel free and contact us with more details at contact@lifesum.com so we can take a closer look at this. Thank you!

title: Just need accurate calories
body: All I ask from these apps is that there is an accurate calorie database. I don't even care about macros. I've use this app for two days and it's incredibly inaccurate. Bush country style baked beans - it says 80 cal for half a cup and it's really 160 for a half cup. Van de Kamp beer battered fish fillet says 210 for one fillet when it's really 220 for two. Skippy natural peanut butter is 190 for 2 tablespoons but the app says 190 for 1 tablespoon. These are all listings with a blue checkmark beside them saying that Lifesum has verified them. I am 5'3" with a small frame so being that far off in calories would make the app completely useless to me.
response: Hi there, thank you so much for your feedback! We have sent it through to the responsible team fÃ¶r their knowledge. When you find verified food that has an incorrect name or wrong nutritional information, you can report it to us in the app following these steps:

title: Okay, but not great
body: It seems to be a bit glitchy, old information in my measurements tracking where I had mistyped kept popping back up. I would delete it and it seemed to be gone when I closed and reopened the app throughout the day, but reappeared the next day.
response: Thank you very much for taking the time to share you feedback, we appreciate it and will make sure it reaches the responsible team!

title: Love it but not inclusive
body: I love these kinds of apps and recently switched from FitnessPal (was using for years) because I like the iWatch complications better but all these apps lack inclusivity for other cultures. Really hard to add meals that are my general homemade Mexican dishes because I can never find anything or will have to add everything one by one which defeats the purpose of the app.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Great Health Tracker!
body: Iâ€™m loving life sum because it doesnâ€™t push you hard to eat healthier. It just helps you set your goal and accomplish it! It is a amazing app in all but I have one problem. I would like to count my steps. When I go to count my steps it says choose you goal. I choose my goal. But when I hit set it doesnâ€™t save it! If you could possibly fix this I would be very thankful. But overall this app is incredible!
response: We apologize for the issue you are experiencing. Please feel free and contact us with more details at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Thank you!

title: So many bugs.
body: I really want to love the app but Iâ€™m having so many issues. The app never connects to the internet so I canâ€™t use certain features, I have to click â€œ+â€ for every single pound I weigh instead of being able to type it in, I canâ€™t connect through FB or my email (the buttons just donâ€™t work), I canâ€™t update goals because the app canâ€™t connect to Internet (I also have it okay to use data), and the calories eaten and burned are always at 500 and 300 respectively. No way will I pay for an app with so many issues. I do enjoy the branding aesthetic and food tracking.
response: We apologize for the issue you are experiencing. Please contact us with details, step description and screenshots at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Please also include phone model, OS and Lifesum version. Thank you!

title: Great app BUT
body: So I started my diet today and after really liking the app I went ahead and paid for the premium for 3 months, well not so happy after purchasing the premium I went to hit the plan icon and it keeps shutting my app out/ closing the whole app.. so after trying over and over even making sure the app was up to date I just went ahead and cancelled the premium would have gave it 5starta if it didnâ€™t shut down hopefully I get my money back!
response: Thank you for your feedback and our sincere apologies for this error! If you are still experiencing this issue, can you please send us more details through contact@lifesum.com so we can look into it or your registered email address so we can fully refund you? Thanks in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: I love this app!
body: This is my favorite tracking app ever. And no this is not a paid review. They do have a membership that you can pay for to get more â€œtoolsâ€ but like other people I donâ€™t want to pay for a membership. Unless you want to use the app to find and save recipes or want more food ratings, then you donâ€™t need the paid membership. Anyways, I donâ€™t usually do reviews but I just had to share how great this app is.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! That is highly appreciated!

title: Itâ€™s Okay
body: This app is just like every other calorie counting app on the market, but what adds a little value is the real time â€œfeedbackâ€ you receive in the way of emoji faces to indicate if the food youâ€™re eating is good, neutral, or bad. My only complaint is they keep trying to promote this new Life Score thing, but every time I take the test it crashes while Iâ€™m halfway through and then it wonâ€™t allow me to try taking it again for like a month. Iâ€™ve gone through this cycle like three times. Seemed like a cool feature if only it worked.
response: Thank you very much for your review and feedback, we are happy to hear that you like the app and meal feedback. We are however very sorry to hear that the app crashes upon taking the Life Score test. Could you please either leave your contact details so we can reach out or send more details directly to contact@lifesum.com so our support can take a closer look at the issue. Thank you!

title: Nice visually, but tons of bugs
body: I purchased the premium version yesterday to track keto. I like how it calculates net carbs and the app is visually appealing. However, I am so disappointed with the bugs! First of all, Iâ€™ve used many diet/fitness apps and never had calories and macros so off as this! One listing of a cup of pistachios says 170 and another says 617!! Also the measurements are way off on a lot of items. One tablespoon of half and half is 3.5 ounces?!! And then the calculations are off. For example I put in 2 tablespoons of half and half which is 40 calories, and then 3 tablespoons is 105! Please fix these issues!
response: Thanks for your review. Our food database is partly user-created and that results in some items having inaccurate nutritional values. We recommend that you either select items verified by us or, for items that you cannot find in our database, create custom items under Favorites. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp.

title: So glad I found this
body: Iâ€™ve been struggling so much to plan meals and stay healthy because of a cognitive disability and this tool has FINALLY made me feel more empowered to plan meals, do meal prep and meet my nutritional goals after looking for months and not finding anything that worked. Itâ€™s more helpful than professional providers I have go to for help. I wish I had found it sooner and the paid plan is worth every penny!
response: Thank you so very much for your positive feedback and kind words! We are very happy to read that you are satisfied!

title: wont let me record my weight
body: I started attempting to lose 15lbs about a week ago with help from Lifesum. I accidentally forgot to record my weight yesterday, and needed to update my weight today. For some reason, every time I put in my weight (only 1.5lbs lighter than the last time i updated it in app) the app gives me a notification saying they thought I typed the wrong numbers and wanted me to try again. Iâ€™m super frustrated as I obviously want to track my progress, but cannot. Is it because it thinks I lost weight too quickly? Iâ€™m pretty young and have had an active lifestyle my whole life, so losing 1.5lbs in ~2-3 days isnâ€™t concerning to me.
response: Thank you very much for reaching out. Could you please either leave your contact details so we can reach out to you directly or click on this link https://lifesum.com/deep/settings?page=support, then on the contact option and send more details so our support can help you further? Thank you very much in advance! We apologise for the inconvenience.

title: Lacking in homemade foods.
body: Lifesum does a pretty good job if everything you eat is from a known restaurant. The database for homemade foods in extremely lacking. You can always look up brand name foods but if you eat chicken breads with rice and broccoli good luck finding and accurate nutrient spread without adding it yourself. Really makes me angry because this is basic foods. I made a half pound Hamburger and salad and I canâ€™t get a proper count, but a Big Mac or some obscure fast food is easily found. Honestly the only reason Iâ€™m using this app is because I made a mistake and purchased it because I thought I was choosing Lose It. Maybe check them out before paying for this one.
response: Thank you for you feedback! We are sorry to hear you did not like app, and will make sure your feedback reaches the responsible teams.

title: Change of heart
body: Iâ€™ve been using the premium version of this app for almost a year. I loved the interface and how easy it was to use. I also enjoy the ability to connect my exercise and my scale so that I donâ€™t have to manually enter those things in the app every time. As of late the app has been very glitchy! It logged a weight for me incorrectly and I canâ€™t figure out how to remove it. I was missing the updated plans and only had the option of 4 plans. Like other users have stated the food log database is way off and the scanner will not work sometimes just keeps scrolling. Back on the hunt for something better!
response: Thank you for your feedback and sorry to hear that you've been having a bad experience lately! Please, update your app to our newest version and, if these issues persist, make sure to send us more details and screenshots through contact@lifesum.com so we can assist you - thank you in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Loving it for years.
body: I've had this app for about 2.5 yrs and even though I haven't been super consistent about notating my meals and workouts, I absolutely love it. The recipes I love. I love that I can give myaelf a check up on how I eat and drink and the type of workouts I do.
response: In case you are missing any specific kinds of yoga you can always create your own exercise under FAVORITES in the app: https://lifesum.helpshift.com/a/lifesum---healthier-eating-better-living/?s=food-exercise-tracking&f=how-can-i-create-or-remove-items-under-favorites---ios

title: Nice app, but..
body: i really enjoy this app aesthetically and it is really nice with tracking.  unfortunately, what you get without a subscription is really minimal.  iâ€™ve had it for a week and while iâ€™m not certain iâ€™ll get rid of it, it appears things i had when i first downloaded it are going away as time progresses.  for example, at first it allowed me to see my day summary, which was nice, now i can only see it if i buy premium.  WHICH i wouldnt be so against if i had the option to pay monthly, not the entirety of a year all at once.
response: We are charging for some of our features in order to cover our running expenses, which include a team of designers, developers and nutritionist and a total of over 60 employees. Thanks for your understanding! Also, please visit www.lifesum.com/premium and sign into your account to see our available offers. Good luck with reaching your goal!

title: Still no progress with the app...
body: The app still has its tracking issues. There was an obnoxious work around of logging out and back in and resetting the automatic tracker. Now it is no longer saving the want to track NetCarbs, as well as not being able to set my personal macros. I think it may be time to cancel my subscription. I kept giving it a chance after the update that killed the tracking because all of my stuff has been stored for months. At this point, iâ€™ll just count it as a loss and find a reliable app to use. I really liked LifeSum, so disappointed.
response: We apologize for the issue you are experiencing with net carbs. Please feel free and contact us with details, step description and screenshots at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Please also include phone model, OS and Lifesum version. Thank you!

title: Waste of money
body: I spent money for a 3 month subscription, and I honestly regret it. The app is beautiful, but I feel like thatâ€™s all it is. Trying to search for foods, even just basic ones, is like pulling teeth. I searched eggplant, and nothing came up. The meal plans themselves leave a lot to be desired, and honestly, seem a little bit sketchy to me. I also donâ€™t like feeling like Iâ€™m being shamed for food that I eat with the little frowny faces or smiling ones. Especially when theyâ€™re not even necessarily accurate. Healthy foods that Iâ€™ve eaten have been given an :|. Iâ€™ll stick with My Fitness Pal. It might not be as pretty, but at the very least, it seems more accurate.
response: Could you please be so kind and contact us with examples for your search at contact@lifesum.com? We can see that you are writing from the US which is the biggest database in our system with the USDA and MyNetdiary and we would very much like to investigate why you would not get these basic keywords up in your search. Thank you very much!

title: Been loving the app up until a few days ago
body: I had been loving this app up until a few days ago when I noticed the calculations of my macros eaten was NOT matching up to the total calories eaten. It is off on multiple days. For example. Today remaining macros are 49c 16p 19f. That equals 431 calories but app is saying 465 remaining. This has been happening everyday. Might not be a big deal to some for for those of us trying to dial in our nutrition it is incredibly frustrating. Not satisfied with this app anymore. And no I am not consuming anything like alcohol that would affect the calories and not the macros
response: We are very sorry to hear about this! Can you please send us more details and some screenshots showing the problem at contact@lifesum.com so we can have the team in charge look into it? Thanks in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Aggravating
body: I did like many aspects of this app, but there were some things that were very aggravating which is why I deleted instead of purchasing premium. 1. I answered vegan in my questionnaire and yet I was recommended non vegan meal ideas. 2. I accidentally entered a whole day of meals on the wrong day and could not find a way to easily change the date instead of having to delete everything and re-enter on the correct day. 3. Food database isnâ€™t the best and I could not figure out how to add my own foods or my own measurements.
response: Our product team is collecting all user suggestions directly here: http://lifesum.uservoice.com/forums/274566-feedback-ideas/filters/top

title: Easy to use app
body: So easy and fun to use. Has most everything I need to follow my healthy meal plan and reminders to weigh in and exercise. Only request: add options to customize workout/ exercise plans. Some of us are starting over after surgery or long term inactivity. So, these limited choices-â€œmoderate aerobic exerciseâ€ are not applicable for us. No option for stationary biking that I can see....Otherwise, this app is just right! Thanks!
response: Thank you so much for you feedback! Glad to hear you like our app! We will forward your feedback to our developers, thank you!

title: YesðŸ‘ðŸ»
body: Honestly my favorite thing about this app is that itâ€™s not enforcing that you need to eat less to lose weight. It gives your meal a bad rating not only if you overeat but also if you undereat. Also I love that I can just scan the barcode of something. And also how it factors in different types of exercise. Lastly I love how it gives you water tips. Overall great app! Even without the whole premium thing!
response: Thank you so much for your positive feedback! We are happy to hear it! If you wish to test out our premium features, please, feel free to email us at contact@lifesum.com and we are happy to provide you with a free trial! Thank you!

title: UPDATED: Bad start gives me little hope
body: Prior rating low because I couldnâ€™t login. Very pleasantly surprised the developers saw my review and addressed the problem. The Login with Apple ID now works. Thanks for addressing. Havenâ€™t yet determined whether Iâ€™ll subscribe but will update rating again if/when I do. Personally, Iâ€™d prefer a free trial of seven days like most subscription apps offer (with automatic renewal payment at end of trial), otherwise pretty expensive service to try without full confidence it will do and track what I want it to track.
response: Thank you for your feedback! Glad it could be solved!

title: Great Fitness App
body: This app is very easy to use! Most apps are confusing and get you lost in the settings trying to do anything.

title: I like it but would like to see more
body: I like the app and I think it have a
response: Currently we provide this feature in the 3 weeks weight loss plan, please check it out: https://lifesum.helpshift.com/a/lifesum---healthier-eating-better-living/?s=plans-nutrition&f=3-week-weight-loss&p=all

title: Good but some flaws
body: This app tracks calories, daily protein, carbs, and fat very well and it is very quick easy to use. However, you canâ€™t do much because most of it is limited to paying for premium. Also, one thing I would like to change is that this app sends you lots of spam mail. There is an option where you can unsubscribe from it, I have tried to unsubscribe multiple times but it always fails to deliver the unsubscription mail so I donâ€™t know how to stop getting them unless I delete the app.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! The unsubscribe link should lead you to the webpage - there is no additional email needed. If the link is not working, please contact us at contact@lifesum.com and we will make sure that you will be deleted from the mailing list right away.

title: Unexpected Crash
body: I love this app and have been using it for awhile and with the new year was really excited to try the 3 week weight loss meal planner. After planning all day and buying food to complete all the recipes, the app decided to crash every time I click the plans tab. Now I just updated yesterday to the newest version, and the plans tab has worked fine all day- until I finally decided to track a meal. Since then itâ€™s crashed every time Iâ€™ve clicked the plans tab, Iâ€™ve restarted redownloaded so just beware!
response: We apologize for the issue you are experiencing.

title: No longer retains information
body: I started using Lifesum based on reviews.  Initially the app worked great and I liked it more than MyFitnessPal.
response: Thank you very much for contacting us!

title: Was great until update
body: Now itâ€™s completely useless and Iâ€™ve been trying to get someone to help for a week with no success. All Iâ€™ve been told is to log out and log in which has done nothing. My data is gone, the macros are way off, I have to resync with phone daily, and the exercise tracking is waaaay off. Used to love this app but the latest update has rendered it useless and getting support is like pulling teeth. Iâ€™ve emailed, tweeted, and contacted in app but have had minimal response just telling me to log out. Case was closed by company without resolution :( I hope they fix this because this was my go to app for calorie and exercise tracking.
response: We have just launched a new version in the App Store that should fix your issue.

title: Enjoying this App
body: Very simple to use. Helps me stay on track. Especially nice for reminding myself to drink water. I have been using this app for a week now. I have been using it mostly to track my net carbs since I am a newly diagnosed diabetic. With eating less refined carbs, drinking water and intermittent fasting, Iâ€™m down 5 lbs this week! This App is a huge benefit to reaching my health goal. I go back to see my endocrinologist in Jan and I am hoping my A1C will be down!
response: We are super excited to hear that Lifesum has helped you improve your lifestyle! Thank you for sharing your positive thoughts on our app!

title: Canâ€™t add anything since the â€œupdateâ€
body: I really like the idea of being rated on the quality of food Iâ€™m eating instead of just the calories in it. Itâ€™s more helpful to be told why a food is unbalanced instead of getting on the scale every week or so and wondering why your hard work isnâ€™t paying off. However, whoever programmed this app kind of dropped the ball. Whenever you give it too many commands in row, it just crashes which isnâ€™t ideal for an app, especially one thatâ€™s being paid for.
response: We deeply apologize for the recent issue.

title: Okay product, prefer FitBit but only this tracks with Apple Watch
body: The app is handy for tracking apps and easily picks up barcodes, but the calorie tracking isnâ€™t as flexible as FitBitâ€™s. For example, it automatically defines your serving as, letâ€™s say, 2 tablespoons, but you canâ€™t edit the number. So if you only had 1 tbps, youâ€™d have to write it as 1/2 serving. Not that big of a deal, but annoying if youâ€™re accustomed to more flexible UI. Similarly, the ads for getting premium service are obnoxious and make navigating the app frustrating at times.
response: Thank you for your feedback and sorry to hear about this issue! Can you please send some screenshots showing the problem so we can report this to the team in charge? You can contact us through contact@lifesum.com. Thanks in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Watch app not good
body: While this app is pretty good (if you pay for premium), it leaves a Lot to be desired for the Apple Watch version.  Very little functionality for the watch. It doesnâ€™t really do anything, and wonâ€™t update my â€œcalories burnedâ€ which always stay at â€œ0â€, despite my workout, health, and activity apps showing thatâ€™s not the case.  Not impressed with this app. Even less impressed they force you to pay for subscription for just basic functionality, and again; nothing useful for Apple Watch.
response: Thank you for your review and sorry to hear that! Can you please send us more details regarding the issue through contact@lifesum.com so we can further assist you? Thanks in advance and apologies for the trouble!

title: Great for tracking
body: This app is great for tracking your calories and macros. However, I donâ€™t recommend following the amount of calories it tells you to eat especially if you input how many calories you burned during your workout. The amount is way too high. As long as you know how many calories you need to eat this app is great. I chose the lose weight option and it told me I needed to be eating over 4000 calories which is way off.

title: Love it!
body: The aesthetics of this app are great, as well as the functionality of it. Iâ€™ve used a lot of apps and food trackers, and the fact that this reminds me to drink water, gives me calorie goals for each meal and provides the option of following different diets, makes it easy and streamlined.
response: Thank you very much for your review!

title: This app is great ðŸ‘
body: So I woke up one morning, realized I wanted to lose weight, so I downloaded an app that my friend told me about, and that was this app. The day I got it I felt motivated to eat healthier because I could see how much I was eating way better than I originally could. I even tested the app myself and the calorie counts are very accurate. If you want to keep track of what and how much you eat I definitely recommend this app!
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! That is highly appreciated!

title: New to the app
body: I just downloaded this app because Iâ€™ve heard good things about it. I was thinking of buying the upgrade version but I just realized I input my lunch and when I opened it again it was missing. Iâ€™d hate to have to input my meals over and over because itâ€™s not being saved correctly. I really like everything about the app but that one thing would frustrate me. Can it be fixed?
response: We apologize for the issue you are experiencing. Please feel free and contact us with details, step description and screenshots at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Please also include phone model, OS and Lifesum version. Thank you!

title: False advertisement.... be warned.
body: I just paid for the premium, the app advertises that you get a shopping list and meal plan. Well none of that exists on my app once I paid. So I basically just spent money on nothing. Why donâ€™t I have these features? What am I paying for? I see that other people are able to make the meal plan but I canâ€™t. This is very frustrating, I do like the rest of the app but the fact I paid for your 3 week program advertisement and itâ€™s a false advertisement. The 3 week program is not on the app. And premium does not give you access to it. Very disappointed....
response: The 3 week weight loss plan requires specific settings in order to be available under Plans. Please, visit this FAQ article https://bit.ly/2RdOobk and find out more about our plan 3 week weight loss plan. Good luck with your goal!

title: Love it
body: Love this app! So user friendly and it really gets me motivated to eat healthier. Iâ€™m fairly conscious of what I eat already - or so I thought - but this makes me think twice before I mindlessly snack on something because I know Iâ€™ll have to log it later. I feel full of energy and excited to eat well, which is no small feat! Also love the barcode scanner which makes keeping a food diary so much easier.
response: We are very happy to hear that you are satisfied with Lifesum - many thanks for your review and good luck with your goal!

title: I lost weight but...
body: The app works. If you stay on the program, you will lose weight. However, their recipes lacks variety. I wish they constantly add more inspirational recipes from all over the world. Personally, because I'm from Japan, I  wish they include more REAL Japanese good. After three months, I get bored looking at the same recipes and having hard time to go back on my diet. People at Lifesum, if you are reading this review, please work on this matter. I won't renew my subscription if there were no improvement.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We will definitely be working on additional content in the recipe section as well as for the Meal Plans.  We apologise for the waiting time.

title: Freezes up just as soon as look at you
body: This app has long had its quirks and annoyances (Iâ€™ve paid for a subscription since 2015). But it continues to get changes instead of fixing old bugs, or new bugs instead - or worse, in addition to - existing bugs. Recent versions (since even before the new version 12) have frozen frequently and at very inopportune times, usually resulting in the app crashing or my having to force restart it. Then it takes minutes to start up again (iOS 13 and 14). I wonâ€™t be renewing my subscription this year.
response: We thank yo so much for your valuable feedback, and are very sorry to hear that you are experiencing this. Your feedback has been sent to team in charge, but would love to know more details in regards to where and when the app freezes and/or crashes. If you would like to provide us with these details please do so at contact@lifesum.com. Thank you so much and again, we deeply apologise for the inconvenience!

title: App Bug or Simply Not Working?
body: Iâ€™ve been using this app for about a week and a half now and Iâ€™ve enjoyed being able to track my food intake. With that being said, users who are using this for free already have such limited access to features on this app so I will admit I became quite frustrated when I noticed that the graph that depict ones overall calorie intake over the course of the week was not showing the calorie intake every third day despite having filled out my food intake for those days (also frustrating I canâ€™t show my proof but thatâ€™s neither here not there).
response: Thank you for your review! Can you please send your details and issues directly at contact@lifesum.com so our support can help you further? Thank you very much in advance! We apologise for the inconvenience.

title: Very little recipes and menu options
body: Was very excited to try the Keto Burn Plan option, after making a 3 months purchase I saw the plan and was surprised to see only few menu options to choose from, only around 8 dishes to choose from for each meal. This is not worth the monthly commitment. If I were only looking to track my macros many apps does it completely free, really only signed up for the menu planning but with such few choices it is worth paying for the app. I also reached out to the Contact us and no response after 4 full days after multiple efforts on my side to reach out. Very disappointed :(
response: We are sorry to hear that our Premium version wasn't what you had in mind and we thank you for your feedback! Also, please make sure that you're contacting contact@lifesum.com and we will get back to you as soon as possible. Thank you for your patience!

title: You get what you paid for
body: Iâ€™m currently using the free version and itâ€™s okay. Iâ€™m not in the habit of tracking my meals, so I wonâ€™t be paying for the premium version just yet. The free one doesnâ€™t have much to entice me to purchase the full version. Maybe when I use it more often my opinion will change.
response: Hi there and thank you very much for your review!

title: 6 stars if I could
body: This app totally turned my life around, premium is affordable and offers you the ability to transform your lifestyle easily without prior knowledge of advanced nutrition and exercise. The barcode scanner is AWESOME!! My only problem so far is that I have to double check all labels when adding new items since Iâ€™ve noticed a few discrepancies (very minor ones though, Iâ€™m just way anal)
response: Thank you very much for your positive review! We are glad to read that you are satisfied!

title: 5 stars!!
body: Beautiful app, very useful. I only just started the app so havenâ€™t seen any results but I definitely feel better. Iâ€™ve been trying to lose weight for a really long time now and itâ€™s been really hard. But I believe this app will really end my struggles. It makes keeping track of calories so easy and provides lots of encouragement. I feel like I have to prove to the app that I can, and I WILL!
response: We are happy to hear that Lifesum motivates you towards a healthier lifestyle and many thanks for your great review! :-)

title: Canâ€™t build my own recipes
body: Iâ€™m searching for a food tracker that is straight forward, doesnâ€™t freeze constantly, and doesnâ€™t automatically assume that I only eat packaged foods.

title: I love the new UI update, but...
body: I love this app, and I love tracking my meals; however, with these new UI improvements, I liked using it even more.

title: Vegan propaganda
body: I eat mostly animal products, because they have the most bio available and highest amounts of micronutrients compared to plant products. Protein too, because I want to be fit and plants are lower in protein by calories and amino score. Though this is basic knowledge, this app doesnâ€™t allow you to specify you eat grass fed only and that all the meat you eat must be conventional low quality meat. Your health score is based off the amount of plants you eat and though I hit all my micronutrients almost everyday, Iâ€™m classified as â€œunhealthyâ€. Also, the biggest issue is the premium. Itâ€™s not monthly, so if you want to cancel, well there goes $40 to $80.
response: Thank you very much for your valuable feedback, we have forwarded it to the team in charge for their knowledge! Regarding the subscription, please choose the 1-month subscription if you wish to pay monthly. Should you need further assistance please contact us directly at contact@lifesum.com.

title: Says its vegan/allergen friendly but its really not
body: Has no diet plans for vegans or vegetarians. Fighting to get my money back now. What a disappointment. I can see how this would be useful for people who eat meat, thoughâ€”otherwise, not many choices or options to choose from, and not as customizable as advertised. However, the calculator for the macros isn't beneficial and doesn't guide you through what the proper % balance would be for your goals. It presets it but not to what would be accurate for what your goals are. The app isn't exceptionally user friendly all in all. Great concept of an app, though; just needs a lot of work.

title: Canâ€™t customize macros
body: I really, really love this app. I love the overall aesthetic and it has come a long way in terms of the food bank. Itâ€™s fun to use. However, the fact that you need a paid premium membership to customize your macros is a huge let down. Especially when there are free tracking outs out there that let you do it. Itâ€™s the reason I always go back to MyFitnessPal. I would switch to LifeSum if they let up on this feature and made that free.  My nutrition goals change and I need the ability to change it myself.
response: Thank you for your rating and feedback. We are charging for some of our features in order to cover our running expenses, which include a team of designers, developers and nutritionist and a total of over 80 employees. Thanks for your understanding! Feel free to send us your registered email through contact@lifesum.com for a free trial! :)

title: Good app but...
body: The app is visually appealing and easy to use. I love the fact that you can take pictures of your food and it gives you the calories for it, but when it comes to logging in workouts itâ€™s annoying. Some workouts you donâ€™t time, you do reps (Ex. Squats, push-up, etc.). Itâ€™s annoying that you can only log in the amount of time that you did that workout for. If this gets changed then u would give a a five star rating but because of this issue I canâ€™t do that.
response: Many thanks for your rating and feedback! Our developers are collecting all feedback here https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd - we really appreciate all ideas and suggestions for improvement!

title: Good, but a few things...
body: This is a great app with a wonderful concept that is very helpful. However, 1: The age that you have on the App Store doesnâ€™t match on the app. 2: It was quite confusing to navigate at first. If a tutorial was created that walked the user through everything before letting them access the app, I feel that it would be less confusing.
response: Could you please be so kind and send us more information about the age issue to contact@llifesum.com? Thank you very much!

title: Fatal bugs
body: This app was great at first, but after 3 days the step counter stopped linking up to my fitness app. After an hour working through the troubleshooting and another half hour to find the place in the app where one communicates directly with the designers, they insisted I send them screen shots of the relevant apps rather than simply believing that I had an issue. Then they told me, essentially, â€˜Too bad, so sad, youâ€™re SOL.â€™ They donâ€™t know how to fix the problem and donâ€™t know when it will be fixed. And, no, they wonâ€™t refund what I paid. Iâ€™ll have to go through Apple for that. The moral? Donâ€™t give them any money.
response: Thank you for your review. Since we don't know which email you contacted us from, we cannot specifically search your case and see what the issue is, but we assure you that we aim to solve all issues reported. We need screenshots in order to be able to recreate the issue and resolve it. We also do not give up on a case until it is solved so, we are sorry if that is what you got from our correspondence and we apologise if you misunderstood our reply. Additionally, due to Apple not allowing us access to our user's iTunes accounts, we have no technical way of manually refunding you ourselves and that is the reason we sent you the directions that you received. Have a nice day!

title: Helpful
body: I have been losing weight with the help of this app. It has a clean, fun look and hasnâ€™t crashed on me.
response: Thanks a lot for leaving your feedback! We are glad to hear that you are satisfied!

title: Keto or bust apparently
body: I am vegan, meaning no meat or dairy. Typically vegan is also high carb, low fat, whole foods (whole foods meaning fruits, vegetables, nothing processed). Keto is a low carb, high fat, meat galore diet that I am so not interested in. I was excited for this app until I realized their diet plans are entirely tailored to low carb keto. Itâ€™s infuriating. This app is exactly what I wanted until I realized they are front runners for keto. I want a plan for EVERYONE. Meat eaters, paleo, keto, vegetarian, all the other diets out there, AND VEGAN. Itâ€™s not fair to push one diet in an app thatâ€™s made for people looking for options.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback.

title: Great app for staying on track and getting ideas
body: I have been really enjoying using this app. Easy to track your food, very visually appealing and not too cluttered like some others. I always double check new food I track, because I have found several incorrect foods. I would love to see the ability to create a manual or custom plan based on your individual macros. I think that would make it a five star app for sure.
response: Thanks for your review! Our food database is partly user-created and that results in some items having inaccurate nutritional values. We recommend that you either select items verified by us or, for items that you cannot find in our database, create custom items under Favorites. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp. Note that you can customise your daily calorie allowance and macros when following the Classic diet plan. Good luck with reaching your goal!

title: I love the app!
body: I liked it so much that I paid for the enhanced version. Adding your food is super easy! I just wish there was a way to set up your own macros. I know the ones in there working really well, but Iâ€™m trying to play around with mine and wanted to enter them manually, but canâ€™t. Do you know if thatâ€™s a future feature you plan on adding like a â€œcustomize your ownâ€?
response: Please check out these instructions:

title: Disappointed
body: Got the app to specifically log daily intake through Apple Watch because that feature isnâ€™t offered on my My Fitness pal app but apparently I canâ€™t do it with Lifesum either. All it shows you on your watch is what youâ€™ve logged on your phone with no option of adding intake through the watch itself. A little bit upset since Iâ€™ve already paid for a premium account had I known I canâ€™t log right through my watch I wouldnâ€™t have purchased premium. Other than that the little Apple character is a cute touch.
response: We are sorry to hear this! Can you please send us more details at contact@lifesum.com so we can further assist you? Thanks in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Letâ€™s see
body: So Iâ€™ve been using this app for a few weeks and was doing the three week plan but switched to the 5:2. I think it will go well but I have two complaints. Iâ€™m the calorie tracker it has the amount of calories on the wrong days. Saying I skipped somedays and ate on days I havenâ€™t started yet. Also on the plans tab it no longer has a summary of my plan just the â€œtake a testâ€ screen. I liked the meal layout the 3-week had. Not saying it needs meals but maybe tips and goals for the diet.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! Could you please send more details on the issue you described so we can look into this for you? You can send us an email through contact@lifesum.com. Thank you and apologies for the trouble!

title: Food Tracker is frequently Wrong
body: I bought this app because I was looking for a simple food tracker. Eating restricted calories is easy. Screwing around counting everything in an app is a pain, and I am disappointed that this one is no different. Half the things I track have incorrect values, when you click on â€œedit foodâ€ it wonâ€™t let you change the mistake in the database. It is also common to scan something and have it come up as another. Sorry guys. I had high hopes, now I feel stupid for paying the fee. Maybe Iâ€™m just hangry.
response: Thank you for your feedback. It is indeed a big challenge for us to allow people all across the world to track their everyday foods. Our users help by contributing missing foods to our database.

title: Took My Money and Ran.
body: I was a loyal user of Lifesum and have seen success with the app. However when I automatically reviewed my subscription, it took my money but never updated my app. I googled the FAQS to see if I could solve the problem myself. I couldnâ€™t and had to email the app developers itâ€™s been a week in a half with no response from them, and I still have no access. Iâ€™m upset because this app is not cheap and I have been needing to use it. Iâ€™m very disappointed and would like a refund. I only have 14 days, but idk if theyâ€™ll even see it by that time. Who knows?
response: Thank you for reaching out and sorry to hear this. We currently have no emails unanswered since the amount of time you are suggesting. Can you please make sure that you are contacting contact@lifesum.com so we can fix this issue for you? We will get back to you as soon as possible. Thank you for your patience!

title: Very Disappointed
body: Very disappointed with the premium version of this app. On 98% of the plans, you cannot adjust the macro percentages, which is essential to the plan I follow. Of course, you donâ€™t know this until you pay the $30 for a 6 month subscription to their service. I attempted to contact the company to get this remedied, they offered a refund, but Apple is not working with me on this. I am so annoyed I wasted $30 on a program I canâ€™t even use. I really like the design and other functions of the app too, if only it worked as expected.
response: Thank you for your review. Unfortunately, we do not have access to your payment data making it necessary that you contact Apple to cancel and refund your subscription. Please, make sure that you are within the 14 days limit for requesting a refund and please try contacting Apple again. Thanks!

title: DO NOT GET FOR KETO
body: I was hoping to use this for keto. They advertised keto recipes. When you buy it, you find out that there are not a lot of recipes that are keto compatible (less than 10g of carbs per meal). There are less than 20 recipes. They are still working on building their database for tracking macros, so itâ€™s difficult if you are in the US to just find a meal that already has the macros. Itâ€™s also difficult to find very common foods and ethnic food. Yes it is pretty and the user interface is better than MyFitnesspal â€” but I will take function over UI any day! You also have to at minimum get 3 months. Save your $20!
response: We are very sorry that you are not satisfied!

title: Amazing app
body: Iâ€™m thankful for something like this it helps me stay on track all day long I work 12 hours a day 5 days a week so itâ€™s hard to meal plan and remember all the things I need to lose weight and body build but itâ€™s been a great help and the recipes are great itâ€™s worth the subscription if you run out of ideas to cook it can help and help you lose or gain what you need.
response: Many thanks for your great review and good luck with reaching your goal!

title: Wishing for a Vegan Option
body: I only have the free version right now, however it is really fun and easy to use, I only put 3 stars because I was hoping there would maybe be a vegan dieting option. I have a vegan lifestyle and that would make this app loads better! I will probably give a rate of 4 so as long as the premium is worth its price. Thatâ€™s really the only complaint I have! Please look into that, I would really love to see a vegan option on the app. Other than that I really like it so far! :)
response: Many thanks for your positive review! Our developers are collecting all feedback here https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd - we really appreciate all ideas and suggestions for improvement. Good luck with reaching your goal! :)

title: Great app, would love to add my own recipes tho

My husband downloaded a different app and itâ€™s not nearly as good. The design is nice and itâ€™s very user friendly. I just wish so bad that I could add my own recipes, it would make it so much easier! I find myself entering lots of ingredients and guessing the quantities I ate.

title: Meal Tracking Fun!
body: One issue I have with most meal tracking apps is that the user interface is unappealing. The colors and ease of use in the Lifesum app make meal tracking an enjoyable experience.
response: Thank you so much for your feedback, we are happy to hear that you like the app and have forwarded your feedback to the team in charge! :)

title: Nice interface, buggy graphs and calculations
body: This app has a good interface for tracking calories. However, Iâ€™ve noticed a few bugs and quirks, which I donâ€™t know how to report, such as,
response: We apologize for the issue you are experiencing. Please contact us with details, step description and screenshots at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Please also include phone model, OS and Lifesum version. Thank you!

title: Great for Calorie Counting
body: If you are counting your calories and generally keeping track of your carbohydrates the app is great. Itâ€™s low profile and integration into Apple Health is pretty seamless. My chief complaint is the ability to to count my Active & Exercise   against my carbs and not just my calories. I find that counting carbs and using my net carbs is a great way for me to lose weight fast. I signed up for the year and after six months I dropped the app. That alone is a testament to how many good features the app has.
response: Thank you so much for your feedback, we much appreciate it and have also sent it through to the responsible teams!

title: Several bugs are inaccuracies
body: I got really frustrated having to look up calories elsewhere to confirm them - sooo many foods are listed incorrectly in the database. Measurements for foods are all wonky too. Weight tracker kept reverting to my starting weight. You canâ€™t edit or remove favorite meals.
response: Thank you for your review and sorry to hear that! Can you reach out to contact@lifesum.com with more details and some screenshots showing the problem so we can further assist you? Thanks in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Donâ€™t bother with premium or maybe this app at all
body: I just paid for premium. I started a planned meal program and there is a button to add things to a shopping list... but that shopping list doesnâ€™t exist anywhere that I can find. Also looking through thing they just recycle about 4-5 recipes so really repetitive. Finally a future start date to plans would be cool. From what I see these are things others have said for a long time, so probably not changing. Sad I paid now, but glad I did it for the shortest amount of time.

body: The details interface used to work perfectly for tracking my macros intake and ratios. I eat a keto diet and need to make sure I always have enough fats and protein and not too many carbs. The old interface showed a pie graph and the exact macros already consumed. With the new chart you can only see what you have left to consume according to the diet youâ€™re on. Now you have to pay for the premium account to see any graphs and change the diet so it fits your needs. The current free version of Lifesum is merely a sampler and no longer works for my needs.

body: There are no Keto recipes in the program. My husband and I are both trying the Keto Genic diet. He eats different things than me but we eat the same stuff a lot of the time. I prepare the food and he enters the food items on both our phones in our logs. I wish we could just enter the food items one time and not have to re-enter entries. Though weâ€™re glad that it remembers our recent entries. Now our phones need to connect.
response: Thanks for your review! You can find Keto recipes under Recipes and then selecting the correct tags. Our developers are collecting all feedback here https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd - we really appreciate all ideas and suggestions for improvement. Good luck with your goal!

title: Great App but...
body: I love the app and have been using it for sometime. I just wish we could still choose our own plan while using free but have to pay for access to recipes and other things in the plan. The app also doesnâ€™t accurately track my step telling me I had 0 when my phone said I had 10,000. I wish we could connect it to other apps so it could be more accurate but otherwise great app
response: Many thanks for your review and feedback! Can you please send us more details and screenshots at contact@lifesum.com regarding your issue with Health so we can have the team in charge look into it? Thanks in advance and apologies for any inconvenience!

title: Wish I had tried it out before committing
body: I have only used it a day and I like it but I immediately saw one thing that is making me want to cancel my purchase and thatâ€™s the ability to add a recipes ingredients to a shopping list so I donâ€™t have to keep looking back at the recipe to figure out what I need to buy and I hate to have to write it down. Thatâ€™s a feature I forgot to look for before I hit yes to sign up. Now Iâ€™m gonna have to look for another app that will do that ugh buyers remorse.

title: So far so good
body: So far I like this a lot! Last year I used MFP which I love for all the food options and how good it was to save recipes. title: Helping me lose weight
body: I really enjoy this app.  I needed something where I could put in my weight loss goal and it could tell me how many calories per day to consume in order to meet that goal.  It connects with other work out apps to keep track of calories burned that ways as well.  Itâ€™s exactly what I needed and so far Iâ€™ve lost 1 lb per day since I started using it.

title: Great app
body: Iâ€™ve been using the app for only a few days now, but really appreciate the feedback that is given about your food choices & how to improve them nutritionally.  I was on WW for 6 months & although I lost weight & learned a lot, I find this app easier to use & provides more individualized guidance. The premium version is definitely worth the price!

title: Gorgeous interface, fun ...but needs a data cleanup
body: This app offers a gorgeous (and motivating) user interface. I love the veggie, fruit and fish trackers. I would upgrade to a Premium account ...but the calorie tracker links to data thatâ€™s not always clear or accurate (e.g. multiple options for a Coke - some correct, some wrong such as 140 calories for 0.4 ounces of coke?) App relies on users to report incorrect info but this user sourced approach does not seem to be working.
response: Thank you for your feedback. It is indeed a big challenge for us to allow people all across the world to track their everyday foods. Our users help by contributing missing foods to our database. Unfortunately, these contributions can have errors, as you discovered. We are constantly working to fix these errors, but always recommend to track foods that are marked with the Verified by Lifesum tick. Please also feel free to report the errors you encounter in the app. Thank you!

title: Great, but needs minor improvements
body: Absolutely love this app BUT could use some

title: Well
body: I loved this app it has a lot of good uses to it. Ultimately though it has some downsides. I cannot connect my fitbit to it without paying a subscription, which I dealt with, but I just updated it and now it closes itself out everytime I open the app, before even making it to the home screen. It is a great app if you do not want to use a Fitbit with it, but if youâ€™re on a budget that is not feasible. They also should really do a better job ensuring that their updates are not going to ruin the app experience completely.
response: We are sorry to hear that you are having some issues with our app and thank you for your rating. Can you please send us details and some screenshots showing this problem through contact@lifesum.com so we can investigate as soon as possible? Thank you and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Useful app, but...
body: Attractive UI, but UX has a long way to go. Iâ€™m not going into to details, just one example. First I gave you 3 stars, because I could not switch to metric system. Later I tried to search google â€œLifesum metricâ€ and found out that it is possible to switch to the system, through many levels of menus I found it.

title: Working out
body: When I workout it says how many minutes, to me it isnâ€™t fair because I can do 25 sit ups 4 times in a row and still not get the right amount of calories I burn, I can lunges or go for a 3 mile run in 20 min or something and still not get the rightful amount of calories I like the food I think there just should be more for people who canâ€™t pay 3.99 a month because they canâ€™t pay it there should be more and the workout area needs to be improved..
response: Thank you for your feedback! Our developers are collecting all feedback here https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd - we really appreciate all ideas and suggestions for improvement!

title: I really wanted this to work
body: But unfortunately the food database is too limited. Adding foods was next to impossible, so that didnâ€™t help either. If this app had a more robust and dependable database of foods, the ability to enter in more foods with more specific measurements, and the ability to enter eaten servings by more specific measurements it would be perfect. Maybe I will check back in a year or so, but for now Iâ€™m sticking with clunky old MyFitnessPal. Itâ€™s ugly, but at least it is flexible and accurate.

Our food database is partly user-created and that results in some items having inaccurate nutritional values. We recommend that you either select items verified by us or, for items that you cannot find in our database, create custom items under Favorites.

title: My Daily Partner :)
body: I have been active my entire life and never had an issue with weight...until that life change and age :(  Slowly weight kept creeping up on me and no matter what I did I would continue to gain.
response: Hi! We're happy to hear about your success with Lifesum! Keep it up!

title: Donâ€™t get if youâ€™re doing Keto
body: I had high hopes for this and subscribed for a 3 month premium subscription since it was cheaper than MFP. First of all, you cannot put custom macros in this. It does their own calculation for you. Secondly, the way it calculates net carbs is different than any other app (and way) I have seen, and you cannot change it. The meal plan is ok. Food is good. BUT they had some food on there that was 7-10 net carbs. I cancelled it and downloaded Carb Manager instead. Iâ€™m mad that I bought someone that Iâ€™m not even going to use for 2.5 more months.
response: Thank you for sending your feedback and we are sorry to hear that you are not satisfied with our Premium version. Please, make sure to send us some screenshots and more details regarding this issue through contact@lifesum.com so we can look into it for you. Thank you in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Diabetic
body: I love this app to start on good terms. I wanted to lose some weight without keeping a paper pencil and math! The only problem is that I have type one diabetes. And I have to take a certain amount of carbs a day. This app doesnâ€™t have something where I can show in which I am a diabetic to help with a meal plan. Iâ€™m also a vegetarian. Which is harder as well since I do not eat meat. Other than not using some medical problems, I love this app!
response: Thank you for your review! You can customise your macros and calorie intake under Settings > Personal Details if you choose to follow the Classic plan. We hope this helps and wish you the best with reaching your goal!

title: Premium user: canâ€™t edit meal times or track micros- fail
body: I like the app but wonâ€™t be renewing.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! Please feel free to leave suggestions for improvement on UserVoice: https://lifesum.uservoice.com - our product team is regularly browsing through the information there to make sure we are aware of the different demands.

title: Extremely unreliable food database
body: The app is visually appealing and user friendly. But the food database is extremely is unreliable. Almost always, the database is different that what the label says on common packaged food. Many, many times the nutrition facts are correct, but the serving size is wrong. For example, the label on Organic Valley Cottage Cheese (4%) says 1/2 cup = 110 calories. But the Life Sum database says 1 cup = 110 calories. And, to make matters worse, there is an icon that says â€œVerifiedâ€. Clearly they are not verifying anything. Unless you are willing to manually enter your own nutrition facts for everything you eat, this app is pretty much unusable.
response: Thank you very much for your review!

title: Inaccurate information
body: This app has been very helpful to use and has a nice design also. My one problem is that the calories on the app are usually never right when going to put food items in. Even the ones with a verified check mark are wrong 98% of the time. If this issue were to get fixed I would give it five stars. But for now 3 stars will do because one of the most important things about the app is constantly wrong.
response: Thank you for your review and sorry to hear that! Can you please send us more details regarding the issue and some screenshots showing the problem through contact@lifesum.com so we can further assist you? Thanks in advance and apologies for the trouble!

title: To difficult to cancel subscription
body: I didnâ€™t want to purchase this app and when I tried to get in contact with the company I got an automated response. In the response it say that they canâ€™t cancel your subscription in order to do it you need to go thru what ever way you payed and cancel thru them. I donâ€™t usually rate any things I buy but all the stuff that I need to do just to cancel (now mind you it was only to cancel, not even get a refund back) is not worth the app. It does not make any sense to me that they canâ€™t cancel your subscription. But then again thatâ€™s just my thought on it.
response: Thank you for your review. You were sent directions on how to cancel your Apple subscription. We cannot do this our selves because we cannot access your iTunes account. This would be different if you had subscribed from our website, since we have access to this payment platform. Please, make sure that you contact an agent at Apple directly in order to apply for a refund.

title: Total calories 30% off, big bad bug
body: I used it for 2 days. The second day, when i added 350 calories for breakfast, the app showed the total as 570.  I used my fitness in conjunction, and it correct. I double checked each entry. Uninstalled app. Useless if the calorie count add another 30% error to the errors we already get from processed and restaurant food.  This was while using it on the iPhone.  Then I checked the sync on the iPad app. It showed the correct calorie count. Looks like a bug. A big one. Also the iPad app does not go to landscape mode. Unusable on a 12" iPad Pro if I can't see it in landscape mode.
response: We apologize for the issue you are experiencing. Please feel free and contact us with more details at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Thank you!

title: Great App, but needs a better exercise tracking option
body: The app is great for tracking my caloric intake. Lots of built in foods and the ability to custom add my own is a plus. I wish this ability to add custom items extended to exercises as well. Iâ€™d like the ability to create an exercise and routines with weights and reps completed including the option to add calories burned if they are not calculated properly through the app. I would like this app to continue sending all the info to the Apple Health Kit.

title: Nutrition facts all wrong
body: App is user friendly and easy to navigate but when I was scanning bar codes all the nutrition fact for everything I scanned were wrong. You also canâ€™t adjust the servings. Example: peanut butter 1 serving = 2tbsp but the app was set at 1 serving =1 tbsp and there was no way to change it. Sure you could just change it from 1 serving to 2 but the very few nutrition facts that were actually right would double. Itâ€™s not accurate that way and will mess you up! I deleted and went with another app thatâ€™s all been accurate. Would try again if this was fixed.
response: We are very sorry to read that you are not satisfied!

title: Better than my prior app but...
body: This is so much better that the app Iâ€™ve been using. It could be because it is newer and has less wrong input from the world. However, I have in just two days found calorie data that is incorrect. On McDonalds food so it is readily available and should not be wrong. Also, It has been randomly adding foods from yesterday to my log. Not just suggesting, but adding it when I log my food.
response: Thanks for your review! Our food database is partly user-created and that results in some items having inaccurate nutritional values. We recommend that you either select items verified by us or, for items that you cannot find in our database, create custom items under Favorites. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp. Good luck with your goal!

title: Not suitable for most Americans- European App
body: They do not have any tool to convert measurements to the imperial system within recipes and meal plans. I have to use an additional app every time I use a recipe, write down the conversion for each ingredient. I also have to use the conversion app when entering my meals. It really makes me avoid using their built-in meal plans which would otherwise be great. However because of this issue, this is basically a calorie calculator (they have many of these available on the App Store that have imperial measuring system). If this was changed I would really like the app.
response: Thank you for your feedback. Our developers are collecting all feedback here https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd - we really appreciate all ideas and suggestions for improvement!

title: Signed up was supposed to get 30% off charged full price
body: When going premium there was a discount of 30% listed in the app. When i upgraded it charged me the full amount. Received an in app response from support asking me for more info but wasnâ€™t able to reply because support closed the issue, before I could respond as soon as they sent it to me. I would not have purchased the upgrade for full price. So watch out when upgrading. Bait and switch!
response: Thank you for rating our app and sorry to hear this! If you rate a conversation you initiate through our support feature and it closes, you can simply open a new one. We will still have all the communication history. Please, send us another message so we can correct this error!

title: motivator
body: I have really enjoyed using this app.   It is very user friendly, and give so much information.  I love that it syncs to the Apple Health app and adjusts calories according to your activity !
response: Thanks a lot for leaving your feedback! We are glad to read that you are satisfied with your Lifesum experience.

title: Love the app but have suggestions
body: I have been using the app for about a week and I have a few minor suggestions. I donâ€™t think the way to custom add a food is very intuitive. From a good UX perspective I think it would be helpful to have the option to custom add a food on the screen where you can search and add recent food. That is where I would expect to find this feature - a fellow mobile app developer

title: Carefully read your subscription!!!
body: Overall a great app, I love that it can track so many different kinds of food. However, I wanted to pay for the yearly subscription and it said it would charge me monthly but instead charged me for that whole year and overdrew my account. I would watch out for that. The app itself is fantastic though for getting fit and healthy so I will continue to use it.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Hard to cancel, very complicated
body: You can buy it through about five sources of payment, which makes it hard to cancel the recurring membership.
response: Thank you for reaching out again. We see that we already responded to your previous review. Did you send the required information that would allow us to further assist you? That is, your registered email and a copy of your transaction receipt. Please, send your information through contact@lifesum.com. We will then be able to help you with a cancellation asap.

title: Lifesum
body: First of all, amazing app. It has really helped me start gaining weight. But, I wish they would show your progress better. Maybe showing if you are on track for how much weight you have lost(or gained) each week so we know if we need to eat more or less. Also, it said that â€œDaveâ€™s Killer Bread; Good seedâ€ is unhealthy, but I donâ€™t see why at all. I eat it everyday and it lowers my score because its â€œunhealthyâ€. But all in all, really good app
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Comparable Apps are Better
body: I would like to get premium, just because this app works better on my Apple than Samsung Health does. Unfortunately, Lifesum doesnâ€™t allow you to set your own eating times (for things like intermittent fasting) and ends up telling you that youâ€™re bad for eating too much for lunch. I also canâ€™t create my own recipe meals with a higher detail and I canâ€™t input nutritional value. So, Iâ€™m sticking with Samsung Health until updates are made to fit multiple lifestyles
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Beautiful app
body: This app looks amazing... and thatâ€™s about it. They donâ€™t tell you until youâ€™ve already created an account and given them your information that nearly every feature of the app is locked behind a premium subscription pay-wall. The only thing thatâ€™s free is the food and calorie tracker. If thatâ€™s the only thing I wanted I would just use the basic health app that comes preloaded on my phone. Iâ€™m tired of things that pose as free and end up requiring premium plans and â€œin-app purchasesâ€ to access. Weâ€™ve officially reached the technological version of â€œnickel-and-dimed to death.â€
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Love!
body: So much prettier than MFP. I love the fruit, vegetable, seafood (great idea!), and water trackers.  My only complaint is not being able to add another snack and rename the labels in diary.  Iâ€™d like a spot for post work in the morning and an afternoon snack.  Currently snacks all have to be lumped together.  Itâ€™s not a big deal right now, but Iâ€™m amping up for a marathon.  I need to see food for preworkout/breakfast, postworkout/snack, lunch, snack, dinner, and pre bed recovery.
response: Many thanks for sharing your positive feedback and your suggestion! Our developers are collecting all feedback here https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd - we really appreciate all ideas and suggestions for improvement!

title: Pretty good
body: I like the tracking system for food. Simple and easy to use. However I canâ€™t change any of my notifications for when I need to log my food! Every change I make, I leave the app, come back, and they have all reverted to defaults.
response: Thank you for your review! Could you please either leave your contact details so we can reach out or send more details directly to contact@lifesum.com so our support can help you further? Thank you very much in advance! We apologise for the inconvenience.

title: Mostly ok
body: Overall design is well conceived, but there are an unusual amount of errors when it comes to calculating calories, specifically with macros.
response: Thank you for rating our app and sorry to hear that you have found some issues with our food database! Please, find out more about our database in this article https://bit.ly/3dsILkS and feel free to reach out to us with your questions through contact@lifesum.com. Thank you!

title: Great App, could use some improvements
body: I love the interface of this app and all of the personal details it gives. Daily updates and â€œscoresâ€ help keep me motivated and on track. However, I feel like several functions donâ€™t work properly. I am unable to delete certain measurements and if I am able to, it does not save. It also does not upload my Fitbit data despite being connected and synced. As a premium member, I would love to see these fixed.

title: Great Health App
body: I have been using this app for more than a year and I really love it. From the diet choices to the daily support with my exercise programs, this is the best app for the day to day support of my health. You can change your plan whenever you want.  I recommend you turn on the notifications as it is so helpful in keeping me on track. ðŸ˜‡ðŸ‰ðŸ¥‘ðŸŽðŸ’ƒðŸ½ðŸ‘©ðŸ½â€ðŸ¦¯ðŸ¤¸ðŸ½ðŸ‹ï¸â€â™€ï¸
response: We are so happy to hear that you are enjoying the app, thank you for sharing your feedback!

title: Free version lacks features
body: I was looking for an app that would be a little more user-friendly to track my meals then my fitness pal. I really liked the look of this one end it certainly beautiful and seemed to be a little easier to use.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Easy to use
body: I really like how easy it is to use with one exception, itâ€™s not always possible to edit the amounts of foods/calories.  You just have to pick something close. I like how it breaks down carbs, fats, and protein. I like the quiz which helps you pick the right diet for your lifestyle.  The connection to Fitbit needs a little work but after a few syncs the information pulls in.  It is much more encouraging than Weight Watcherâ€™s app.
response: Thanks for your review! Our food database is partly user-created and that results in some items having inaccurate nutritional values. We recommend that you either select items verified by us or, for items that you cannot find in our database, create custom items under Favorites. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp. Good luck with your goal!

title: Wish you could customize
body: I really like this app, WAY better than 3 other macros tracking apps Iâ€™ve tried. I will say that my protein goal needs to be way higher than what his app allotted me and thereâ€™s no way to customize it. So Iâ€™m technically like 50g over my protein daily but i know that going into it. Still a bummer though.

title: Donâ€™t subscribe
body: Very disappointed that there are all these diet choices to cater the app to but there are so few recipes to chose from. Iâ€™m trying to follow a ketogenic diet and am not losing weight. I upgraded hoping there would be more recipe choices to help keep me on track but thereâ€™s like maybe 10 recipes for each breakfast, lunch, and dinner and theyâ€™re not even appetizing or common foods. Vanilla cod tartare?  Very limited selection.  Atkins has a free app and actually has a decent recipe selection. The only positive is seeing the breakdown of the micronutrients for protein, fat and carbs.

title: Great in general; could use consistent serving size measures
body: Iâ€™ve enjoyed using the app and generally have found it easy to use, but it would be great if each food item came with the same suite of measurements. Too many of the foods only allow for measurements by weight (ounces or grams), which arenâ€™t intuitive or easy to know for all users. Adding cups, tablespoons, and teaspoons for everything would be really helpful.
response: Thanks for your review! Our food database is partly user-created and that results in some items having inaccurate nutritional values. We recommend that you either select items verified by us or, for items that you cannot find in our database, create custom items under Favorites. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp. Good luck with your goal!

title: Visually appealing - pushy on the Keto diet
body: Iâ€™ve used other food tracking apps and have lost interest quickly because it wasnâ€™t engaging enough.  This app keeps things appealing and so far has had all the food Iâ€™ve eaten so far.  I am dropping 1 star because it has been very pushy about the Keto diet.  Iâ€™ve gotten emails, taken the test (which does not give an option to choose if youâ€™re a vegetarian) and itâ€™s always the Keto diet.

title: Exercise tracker Works for three days
body: I started using this app recently (paid for 3 months ). First three days no glitches. However, fourth day comes, the app is no longer connecting with my iwatch to track the exercises. I canâ€™t use your exercise tab on the app because itâ€™s not accurate to my workouts. Please let me know what to do step by step! (Btw my iwatch is not even a year old itâ€™s a 5.3 version)
response: Thanks for your review and sorry to hear about that! Can you please send us more details and some screenshots showing the problem at contact@lifesum.com so we can have the team in charge look into it? Thanks in advance!

title: Sync Problems
body: Great app, however it lacks consistent updates to my Apple Watch. I enter my meals to the app on my phone, however it rarely syncs the information to my watch. For example- right now it reads the caloric input from breakfast. However I entered information from all of my courses. title: Most of the services are premium
body: Recipes? Tips? Advice? Got to pay the premium. Dissappointing, but they have to be paying health experts and healthy chefs in order for their work to appear on it. The little quizzes they offer are free though, so you can take your results and research what to do separately.

title: Love it but..

title: Love It!
body: This is a great app and fits my needs almost perfectly. My only issue with it would be in the workout section. For some things (swimming, running, etc.) having it so you can set it for __ minutes is perfect. However, for things such as sit-ups, push-ups, etc. It would be better if you could enter how many you did, instead of how long you did it for.

title: Very unsatisfied
body: I bought the app on 8/26 and was quickly prompted to get the Premium upgrade. I unfortunately decided to do the year because it said $3.99 a month well it charged me the whole this.... 1st strike. Then I realized that I really didnâ€™t need the extra stuff as there are support groups and Pinterest for Keto recipes and decided to unsubscribe from the Premium before the 14 days were up. Beware donâ€™t do the Premium Upgrade you can find the recipes free on Pinterest

title: Great app, easy to use!
body: This app is very easy to use. It also is visually sleek and pretty. I love the helpful reminders and encouraging tips. The only thing thatâ€™s making this not a five star review is the fact that finding the right foods is a little bit tricky in the search menu option. title: Solid.

title: Great, but....

Iâ€™d love if there was a diet catered to that, since Iâ€™m finding it hard to reach my 2,000 calorie goal/day. title: Great calorie tracker

title: Calories never add up, lots of bugs.

title: Great app but few issues
body: I love the app itâ€™s helped me make a lot of progress.

title: I like but...
body: This is my favorite app, with one exception. When I set my calorie intake to be 1800, I want it to stay there, no matter what my workout is versus increase calorie intake! title: Itâ€™s ok..

Iâ€™m not finding it very accurate when it comes to nutrition labels, many foods arenâ€™t even stored in the app unless they have a barcode, and it seems like people add things in but have many typos so it makes it difficult to find the right foods. I really wanted this app to be my go-to, especially for the price, but I may be going back to my old tracking app.
