title: The worst âŒâŒâŒ
body: I was struggling with my weight for a long time until a friend recommended this app and I was at 165lbs before downloading this app. But after I downloaded this app and let it control the amount of calories I intake during my day I didnâ€™t lose but I gained 4 pounds instead. Please fix whatever problem caused this. It took me only 4 days to gain 4 pounds and now imagine how long it will take me to lose those 4 pounds and get back on track?? A very long time and I am very disappointed right now. Please fix this. I donâ€™t want anyone to go through the same thing as I did.
response: We are sorry to hear that you havenâ€™t reached your set goal. We calculate the individual kcal recommendation based on BMR, your Activity Level and Goal in Settings. Therefore, make sure you have the correct Settings and an Activity Level that corresponds to how active you are. Remember, also factors such as stress and sleep affect weight loss. If tracking everything and still not reaching your Goal, you are more than welcome to contact us at contact@lifesum.com for further guidance.

title: Itâ€™s Ok
body: Iâ€™ve lost 12 pounds following the Ketogenic Medium plan from Lifesum. It is by far my favorite tracking app, however, Iâ€™ve recently switched back to another app. I do a lot of my own cooking, using recipes from internet sites. The other app makes the input of recipe data much more simple and less time consuming then Lifesum. I was spending too much time putting in every ingredient to get an accurate count. If Lifesum ever gets this feature Iâ€™ll definitely be back!
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! Agreed, that would be an improvement. We will make sure your feedback reaches the responsible team.

title: Took All My Money At Once, Don't Upgrade
body: I decided to upgrade to premium and since I didn't have much money, I chose what I thought would be the cheapest option. On the screen, it said I could buy a 12 month subscription by paying about $3.50 a month. That would be fine with me, $3.50 is no big deal. I could easily take a small amount from a part-time job paycheck. I look at my bank statement later today and it says that it billed me THE WHOLE $44 ALL AT ONCE! What the hell??? So now I have no way of getting my money back and have to pull from my savings just for a stupid app.
response: We are sorry to hear that our payment page wasn't clear for you! We will forward this feedback to the team in charge for a review. Can you please send us your registered email address at contact@lifesum.com so we can fully refund you?

title: FACEBOOK INTEGRATION!!!
body: Functionally speaking this is a great app, and Iâ€™ve already lost 5lbs in the first week and a half....but I have friends and family who are following my progress and REALLY like when I share the recipes I use with them. With MyFitnessPal, I can share those sorts of things on Facebook, and several apps I use also syncs with my friends list to show me who else is already using them...but not lifesum. Add Facebook integration and this would automatically be a five star review for me.
response: Many thanks for your review and well done on your success! Our developers are collecting all feedback here https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd - we really appreciate all ideas and suggestions for improvement!

title: Glitch

title: I like it.

Black Friday sales are supposed to be enticing. Iâ€™d love to try premium, but Iâ€™m not really interested in the price tag theyâ€™ve got. Iâ€™ll stick to the basic option. title: Pretty, but not reliable
body: I considered paying for the app, but decided against it for one main reason: wildly inaccurate calorie counts on common foods. I suppose that the verified foods was meant to correct for that, but it doesnâ€™t.

Unfortunately, these contributions can have errors, as you discovered. We are constantly working to fix these errors, we hope youâ€™ll try us again in future.

title: Review
body: Ok im 49 but still love the smiley faces lol. The little guy tapping his foot to enter your weight makes me smile. Had used ww for years love this app too. I wish you could manually adjust your calorie goal and also if u track something at wrong time just hold on it and change from breakfast to lunch without deleting and then rewriting. title: Disgruntled
body: I spent years as an RN in cardiac & diabetes care. Initially I was impressed with this app, but found it to be regularly grossly inaccurate, representing daily sodium â€œsumsâ€ as being lower than actual sums.
response: Thank you for taking the time to write your review and sorry to hear about these issues! Also, please feel free to send screenshots showing the inaccuracies you discovered so they can be reported to the team responsible. Thank you in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Awesome app!
body: I absolutely love this app! Not only is it beautifully designed, but itâ€™s so simple to use! Itâ€™s also great how itâ€™ll sync to other health apps on your phone / watch. Inputting food is also easy, whether itâ€™s already in the system or something new! I just wish you were able to use other meal plans besides the classic without paying for premium. Iâ€™d like to be able to adjust my macros!

title: Best App Iâ€™ve used so far

title: Really Helpful
body: Having struggled with an eating disorder for a majority of my life, this app sends me cute notifications reminding me to eat and to drink water which is really nice since it is easy to get distracted and let myself go without eating. title: Helpful, but would love to see caffeine tracking and larger food catalog
body: The app is helpful for tracking your progress through the day and seeing your status on the watch. Would love to see caffeine tracking added and an expansion to the food catalog. Also would love to understand what the little green guy is doing on the watch. Doesnâ€™t seem to be consistent with my food and water consumption, so would love to understand how to make use of it.

title: Great app, but keeps crashing
body: I just downloaded this app today and I am already obsessed. Itâ€™s very useful in nutrient insight and what I need to watch in order to lose weight. title: ABSOLUTELY GREAT APP!

title: Itâ€™s alright but not great.

As in if I want to add food onto â€œyesterdayâ€ it somehow forgets that I said itâ€™s food I ate yesterday and then changes the day while I add the new food adds it onto the current day. title: Notes

Donâ€™t get me wrong it is a wonderful app and I donâ€™t have a thing wrong to say about it but I really think it would be beneficial if it had a place to write things about your food/workouts/and water intake.
response: Hi there, thank you so much for taking the time to leave your review! It is possible to leave notes at the moment as well; when in the Diary, tap on the arrow just below the Life Circle. title: Great app but at times inaccurate

Like serving sizes for different foods and the calories in those foods. I ate some Waffles by Kodiak cakes this morning and went to enter the calorie information and found that on the box the calories say 250 however the app tells me 230.

title: Really nice app!! One small issue.
body: Although this app has been so helpful and is so simple to use. I think that the feature of syncing wearables and other apps should NOT be a premium feature. I'd like to have it all in one app and not worry that my Fitbit's usage will not go to as much use because I cannot sync it up. Please hopefully fix this ðŸ™ðŸ¼ðŸ’•
response: Thanks for the feedback! Please feel free to leave suggestions for improvement on our UserVoice: https://lifesum.uservoice.com

title: Need Widget
body: I think we need quick widget so that we can do quick scan of the food that we are about to eat or more precisely this widget should be able to help us in doing everything quickly without the need to open the app for every small activity like to track how much water we have drink.
response: Currently on the iPhone you have the option to search for food and scan a barcode by pressing your finger on the app icon on your phone. There you will find the two shortcuts.

title: Crazy good
body: I donâ€™t ever rate apps or count calories but since downloading this and letting it count calories I realize itâ€™s just that simple. I now pay attention to what I eat and have lost 2 pounds a week for four weeks. That said I exercise five times a week as well, even before the app. But before the app I never actually lost weight.
response: Thank you for your review! We are happy to read that you like Lifesum!

title: Watch Complication Broken
body: Overall a great app with a delightful UI, but I donâ€™t understand how LifeSum could leave the watch complication broken for six weeks and counting. I counted on it as a source of feedback when I logged to quickly tell where I was macronutritionally at any given point in the day.
response: Thank you for your review and sorry to hear about these issues! Feel free to send us more details at contact@lifesum.com so we can investigate further - thanks in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Lose it is WAY BETTER
body: All this app wants to do is to get in to your wallet. Lose it is the best trust me. The smiles that say how good your meal is made me eat foods that I didnâ€™t like beacause I just wanted to please the app I lose 0 pounds on life sum but on lose it I have lost 6 and havenâ€™t changed a thing about work outs or eating so get the app lose it if you wanna see change
response: We regret you did not like the app but thank you for your feedback!

title: Love flexibility/access to barcode scan, donâ€™t like restrictions behind paywall
body: I love that I can create and save my own re pies as well as scan barcodes for quick nutritional info. Do not love that for more detailed nutrition info beyond calories, Iâ€™d need to pay for the premium app. Calories are such a poor indicator of overall health. Would be nice to try the premium for free to see if itâ€™s really worth the extra money.
response: Thank you for your review Kathy, we are glad to hear you like the app and of course we are happy to provide your with a free trial.

title: Home cooked recipes
body: Like the app a lot but I wish you could put in your home recipes and portions. Also the portions on like a raw onion you donâ€™t get to put in your  portion only the few options they give u and I donâ€™t have a scale and u better know fraction decimal conversions if you want to put in your portion. But a pretty good app. Wish I could try premium for one month instead of having to commit for three.
response: Hi there, thank yo uso much for your feedback!

title: Inaccurate database
body: 2020 update:  Food database is still not accurate. It would be worse if it was way off, but it is off like 3 calories which is more frustrating.  I have no idea how this app gets such good reviews when the database is so poor.
response: The verified foods are from several food databases: the USDA, food items from Livsmedelsverket in Sweden, from the UK Food Standards Agency and the BLS from Germany.

title: Mixed feelings
body: Iâ€™ve used this, and even the unlocked version, and have decided to stop at this point. While the app interface is nice on my mobile devices, without a synchronized desktop app the program just doesnâ€™t work for me. MyFitnessPal has that, as well as better integration with other devices and applications. I tried to like it, and I do, but itâ€™s missing a critical component to be my one go-to app for tracking food and exercise.
response: We are sorry to hear that Lifesum didn't meet your expectations and we thank you for taking the time to share your feedback!

title: Buggy App
body: My water settings NEVER stay at 7 glasses instead of the default 8 glasses which is too much for my weight. Trying to add food to the previous day always adds it to the current day instead on the first and sometimes second attempt. These are just two of the more prominent bugs currently in this app.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We will forward it to the responsible team for their knowledge.

title: Judgmental with no explanation.
body: This app is well made. However, it rates your food choices with smiley faces and frowny faces...I eat very healthy, I just wanted this app to help keep track of protein intake. I entered a banana as a snack and it showed me a frowny face...so now bananas are bad for you!?? When I clicked on the face to get more information as to why it is labeled with a frown face, ofcourse it says you have to upgrade to premium. Itâ€™s EXTREMELY LIMITED if you donâ€™t pay for the premium. Disappointed. Donâ€™t need an app telling me I shouldnâ€™t eat a banana. Going back to LoseIt app.
response: Thank you for your review! Our food rating depends on many factors, which you can read more about here http://bit.ly/2iVK9WL. We have to charge for some of our features to be able to cover our running expenses, including a team of nutritionists and developers and over 60 employees. Many thanks for your understanding!

title: Just downloaded, already a bug
body: I just downloaded this app and when I go to the app it automatically goes back to my home screen and it keeps on doing that repeatedly, which is my only problem. I've heard many good things about this app and I'm have really
response: We apologize for the issue you are experiencing. Please feel free and contact us with more details at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Thank you!

title: No cal count
body: Even though it is a counter I like this app because it helps make it easy for me to log in my food every time I eat and is more of a food journal also the people help and give you some good advice and is very nice on this app too. I had this a few years ago and now Iâ€™m decided itâ€™s best to just keep it on my phone so I can stay in track of my goals.  Go forth and wander. âœŒï¸
response: Thank you so much sharing your feedback, happy to read you enjoy the app! :)

title: Ok so far but needs improvement
body: I just got done with support and was told the app cannot log exercise correctly thatâ€™s imported from partner apps. Thatâ€™s a pretty big issue for a weight loss app. I have to manually log each exercise even though the information is being imported. Also, the nutrition information for several foods Iâ€™ve scanned for meals is highly inaccurate according to the label on the food. I wonâ€™t be renewing my premium subscription if these issues arenâ€™t fixed by then.
response: Thank you very much for your review! We will inform the responsible teams regarding your feedback. We have recently implemented a change to make sure only fully correct items can be saved in the future and hope that this will lead to more accuracy with the user added food items. Thanks again!

title: Great app but...
body: This app is absolutely amazing and I love the easy way to use it. Sometimes it hard to find the exact food that I am eating but that is fine. My one complaint is that, I know that you need to make money but, there is an option for â€œhow to make this meal healthierâ€ and that is the one thing that I think should be free because without this the app doesnâ€™t really help you with losing weight, because it doesnâ€™t tell you how.
response: Thank you so much for your feedback, we much appreciate it! We will make sure your feedback also reaches the responsible team. If you wish to try out all of our premium features please do not hesitate  to contact us directly at contact@lifesum.com for a free trial! Thank you!

title: Love this app
body: This app is great. I love the habit trackers for things like fruit and fish. I just wish we could set meal frequency (6small meals rather than 3 and a snack) and the weight tracking goes back to your starting weight every time you donâ€™t enter your current rate. Would love to see that addressed. Other than that I love this app. It is motivating without leaving me with a guilt trip when I forget to do something.

title: Super simple way to track meal habits!
body: Love how easy the app is to track daily nutrient intake, especially with the built in barcode reader! The recipes are also tasty and made with ingredients that that I am already familiar cooking with.

title: Great but needs a few adjustments.
body: I like the way the app is set up itâ€™s really cool and I havenâ€™t seen a calorie counter quite like this one. But I am concerned for the users of this app. This app is very popular among young people suffering with eating disorders and anorexia. It is very easy to use this app for the purposes of starving yourself. It would be great to see a diet option for eating disorder recovery available on the app considering so many people use this app to track their eating disorders.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: New to the app
body: Just downloaded this app today and was super excited about the grocery list planning! But when I chose my meal plan and swapped a couple meals, it would still add the old mealâ€™s ingredients on the grocery list. So even though I chose veggie omelets for breakfast, it would add chia seeds and bananas and coconut flakes to my grocery list when I clicked the add button on the omelet... I really hope this can get fixed soon â˜¹ï¸ if it gets fixed, this app would be great!
response: Thank you for your review! You can remove items from your shopping list be clicking on the shopping cart of the meal it added ingredients from. If this remains an issue for you and you need further assistance, please do not hesitate to reach out through contact@lifesum.com and we will get back to you as soon possible!

title: Fix activity calories
body: Wherever you guys are getting the caloric expenditure data from, its overestimating by almost a double. For example running 6mph for 30 mins does not burn 500. Itâ€™s 300 at most. Or climbing for an â€œhourâ€ which the climber is not excepting full force during the full hour will not burn 1000 calories.
response: We apologize for the issue you are experiencing. Please contact us with details, step description and screenshots at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Please also include phone model, OS and Lifesum version. Thank you!

title: I love lifesum!!!
body: Lifesum is so versatile. Every app Iâ€™ve tried using is strictly for weight loss & thereâ€™s such a minority of small-framed people looking to gain weight and Lifesum has this option! It tells me how many calories I need to eat for each meal as well as in a day. So far Iâ€™ve gained five pounds & counting since my fitness journey :)
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! Currently we are still very dependant on the Premium features so price changes downwards will probably not happen in the near future. There is a team with more than 50 bright minds behind the app. And these costs have to be covered. Thank you very much for your understanding!

title: Terrible Food Data Base
body: I bought this subscription because I loved the format and layout of the app way better than others I have seen before. But after buying the subscription Iâ€™ve noticed that the food data base is very flawed. There is limited food options listed, and often it will not pull up options for simple searches such as â€œeggâ€ or salad. In addition, there is little to none data of any sort of fast food. So overall Iâ€™m pretty disappointed since I payed for it.
response: Thank you very much for your review! We have been experiencing a search issue last week that had an impact on the results. We apologise for the inconvenience! The issue has been solved in the meantime. Should you still have any problems, please contact us directly at contact@lifesum.com

title: Food database is too small
body: I like this app but the database is too small. I like how it keeps track of my calories, fat, protein, etc but when I try to add food items they arenâ€™t always there. Also, if they are in the database, the portion doesnâ€™t match and you canâ€™t change it. Iâ€™ve used other diet apps in the past that had a much larger food database. I think if the food choices and portions were altered it would get a higher rating.
response: Thank you for your feedback. Itâ€™s a big challenge for us to allow people all across the world to track their everyday foods. We are constantly working to improve the database and we hope youâ€™ll try us again in future.

title: Forced Portrait Mode on the iPad Makes the App Unusable for Me
body: I canâ€™t believe after all this time that the app still forces Portrait mode on its iPad app, which is primarily a landscape device for most people.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We will make sure it will reach the responsible team.

title: Promising but buggy
body: Overall great app for keeping a food diary, good database of food although relying on customers to input nutritional data leads to lots of inaccuracies. The biggest downfall is the lack of consistent syncing with Apple HealthKit in both directions and must be fixed to make this a top-rate app. Tips and game-ification aspects are pretty tired in 2019, but you can turn them all off. Personally less interested in their diet plans and recipes so I canâ€™t comment on those.
response: Thanks for your review - we very much appreciate your feedback and we have forwarded it to the team in charge!

title: UI is awesome, nutrition tracking is not
body: Iâ€™ve found that some of the barcodes scanned donâ€™t show the accurate nutrition information.
response: Thanks for your review and for your suggestion! Our food database is partly user-created and that results in some items having inaccurate nutritional values. We recommend that you either select items verified by us or, for items that you cannot find in our database, create custom items under Favorites. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp. Good luck with your goal!

title: Best app for weight loss and healthy living!
body: I donâ€™t ever leave reviews, so thatâ€™s already saying something. This app is SO user friendly and has the largest database of foods Iâ€™ve seen yet (for the daily diary). Itâ€™s extremely detailed, informative, and versatile. I like how you can track everything from water intake to exercise. Itâ€™s also quite visually appealing!
response: Thank you so very much for your positive feedback! We are very happy to read that you are satisfied!

title: Premium is simply big disappointment
body: It seems very promising from non premium look but once you get the premium itâ€™s not what you are expecting it to be! Not all meal plans have the â€œshopping listâ€ option (only about 10%) and their meal preparation instructions are super simple, most of the time it is just 2 sentence instructions ðŸ¤£ you might as well just write nothing. I wish they let you try it for a day to see what you are signing up for. And it was featured in â€œapp of the dayâ€ ?! It should be on top list of worst premium apps! They need to change a lot.
response: We are sorry to hear that Lifesum didn't meet your expectations and thank you for your feedback. We do offer a free trial upon request. Please, send us your details through contact@lifesum.com if you wish to be refunded.

title: Great Interface & Easy to Navigate
body: The water, fruit and fish trackers make it super simple to keep track of your intake. The food database is leagues above what else is currently out there. But best of all are the diets and meal plans â€” they make it super easy to test out different ways of eating. Also, love the iPhone widgets. Simple and helpful, thatâ€™s all I want for a nutritional app.
response: Thank you so very much for your positive feedback! We appreciate it and are very happy to hear that you are satisfied!

title: Pretty but less functional than it should be
body: App looks nice, but doesnâ€™t write to Health and you canâ€™t export. Competitor apps do. Widget is nice but I assume that other apps will catch up to that. In their FAQ there is a question of how to share data with healthcare professional, and their answer is to â€œgive them your log in info, then change ASAP.â€
response: Thank you very much again for your feedback.

title: Wanted to use
body: It was starting to grow on me, after switch from my fitness pal, however to the best of my knowledge you can build recipes/meal and thatâ€™s a deal breaker. I donâ€™t want to input every food item separately when I eat the meal frequently, or calculate a portion of a recipe I cook for my family. For me, being able to do so really gives me a better understanding of what I can and canâ€™t eat, while tweaking the recipe to fit my needs. Hope this can be added some day, Iâ€™ll probably be back if it is.
response: Thank you for your review and feedback. We are sorry to hear that Lifesum hasn't met your expectations! Our developers are collecting all feedback here http://lifesum.uservoice.com/forums/274566-feedback-ideas - we really appreciate all ideas and suggestions for improvement. Thanks in advance!

title: Helpful but limited
body: I like how easy it is to plug in calories and exercise - extensive data list. Iâ€™ve not found anything not in there in the 2 weeks Iâ€™ve used it. However it keeps pushing to buy the upgraded version. App should give a sample of what the upgrade offers. Iâ€™m curious to know what the different smiley faces mean but enough for that price. So the smiley faces are ignored. I am disappointed the recipes arenâ€™t really available on the free app either.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: I love this app!
body: This app has been so helpful for me to track my calories and eat the right amount of foods! It also helps me to get my exercise in and can connect to your healthy app if you have an iPhone and can track the amount of calories you burn by walking or exerting when you have your phone with you!
response: Thanks a lot for your positive feedback! We are very glad to hear that you are satisfied!

title: Not the greatest but okay
body: I like the fact that I can track my meals and it gives some recipes but I think it would be better if there was a meal planner and shopping list included. Could that be added? In fact, I bought the app thinking they were included bc the pictures include a shopping list pic but I canâ€™t find it. Thanks. Will continue to use the app for my year membership but after that year, weâ€™ll see.
response: Thank you for your feedback!

title: Excerise
body: When you record your exercise, I think you should have the option to not go by just minutes of your workout (ie treadmill). I like to intensify my workout on the treadmill to burn more calories. What it says on the treadmill vs the app are totally different. And also crunches. You should be able to record how many you did. Not go by how many minutes. Please fix this.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We will make sure it reaches the responsible team.

title: Will not let me upload meals
body: I just got this app 3 days ago and have been adding all of my meals very easily. I have been staying on track and have loved it. However, today I have been unable to add any meals. I have tried deleting and re-downloading the app, I even had to delete all of the progress that I have made so far. It is very frustrating and it doesnâ€™t help that there is nobody to call or get in immediate contact with. Very frustrating. Although I really enjoy the app, the customer service needs work along with the technical issues.
response: We deeply apologize for the recent issue.

title: Donâ€™t do it
body: I bought Lifesum to help me lose weight. They said if I got the premium it would be like 12-14 a month, I thought it wasnâ€™t a bad deal until it charged my account over 50 dollars when it said the charge was monthly. I tried to delete it and receive a refund but the app is awful to navigate if you want to actually delete your account. On top of that it said I had to get rid of my subscription before I deleted my account and they gave me no information on how to do it. Overall this app is something that you shouldnâ€™t get.
response: The reason we show the monthly cost is for our users to see the difference in price from subscribing yearly and monthly. A monthly subscription is also available. The total price is shown to you before you pay. We are sorry if this wasn't clear enough. Please, note that deleting your account will not cancel/refund your payment - you need to do that manually. Please, reach out to us through contact@lifesum.com if we can offer further assistance!

title: Do NOT get Premium
body: I think this app is visually appealing and it makes me want to use it. So much so that I purchased 1 year of premium.
response: We truly apologise for this. Can you please come back to us through contact@lifesum.com with a copy of your transaction receipt and your registered email address so we can find your Premium account for you? Thank you in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Recipe instructions need work
body: Great app for tracking food, I go between this and MyFitnessPal as the best ones. I love that Lifesum has recommended recipes but when I go to actually make them the recipe instructions are usually confusing or lacking information. Would also be great if you could see recipes from other diet plans without having to switch your plan.
response: Thank you very much for your review! Please, make sure to send us examples of the recipes you find unclear through contact@lifesum.com so we can look into this. Thanks in advance!

title: Pretty good watch app. Odd designed app, can be confusing to navigate.
body: One really frustrating thing is that it doesnâ€™t read water data from other apps from the Health app so it never knowns my water intake. I use WaterMinder app.
response: Hi RodChristiansen, thanks for the review! Really glad to hear you're enjoying the Apple Watch app, we love it too! In regards to your idea about importing water from other apps, it sounds like a really interesting idea! We collect some user feedback here, if you're interested, adding a feature request would help us see if other users are interested in this idea too! https://lifesum.uservoice.com/forums/274566-feedback-ideas/

title: WOW! So far, it's Great!
body: I can't believe all the options in the food diary there are. Like, even generic food options from my local grocery store. I like the food plans it has an an option, it has synced to my Fitbit, and has been user friendly. I'm excited to see how this plays out. I'm always a skeptic, but off to a great start!

title: Database is lacking
body: I switched from MyFitnessPal to Lifesum so I could follow a keto diet plan more specifically and see my macros more easily. Layout and aesthetics of this app are great. But the database is seriously lacking compared to MyFitnessPal, which makes tracking a hassle. Even creating your own recipe is a lot of work bc of the small and sometimes in accurate database. It would be nice if things you logged as one meal would auto populate for other meals as well.
response: Thank you for your feedback! Our developers are collecting all feedback here https://bit.ly/2gB0KKd - we really appreciate all ideas and suggestions for improvement. Good luck with reaching your goal!

title: Like it!
body: I do like the app. Been using it for several months... My problem is when it tells you to take a pic of your food, it's almost always wrong and they only give you a few options of what they think it is. You can't take a pic and say what it is. So I end up putting each ingredient in one by one and it gets a little annoying. I like the day ratings and the little advice they give. Overall it's a good app!
response: Thank you for rating us and sorry to hear about this issue! Can you please send us more details and your registered email address at contact@lifesum.com so we can further assist you? Thanks in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: Easy to use but has some bugs
body: This app is easy to use but I have been having some issues. For example I selected a food and it said â€œ5 caloriesâ€ per serving.  This seemed off but I continued using the calories I knew I had eaten.  Upon leaving a renter if the app my calories were way off and it when I went to edit the food the calories per serving was 350.  I have to close the app and restart it and the verify my entries every time.
response: We deeply apologise for the issue! The team has already found the reason for the problem and is working on a fix for it. A new version with the solution will be published as soon as possible!

title: Overall love the app but they need to fix...
body: This app is great and visually appealing which helps motivate me to use it but recently Iâ€™ve been experiencing a glitch that basically â€œforgetsâ€ when Iâ€™ve updated the amount of food entered.
response: Thank you for your review! Can you please send your details and issues directly at contact@lifesum.com so our support can help you further? Thank you very much in advance! We apologise for the inconvenience.

title: Good idea, poor execution
body: I have been using this app for about a month now. In principle, I like the whole concept and design. It is very easy to use and makes calorie tracking very convenient. That being said, the weekly statistics of the calorie intake never matched up with the 1-month or 3-month view. Worse, all of a sudden my history of the calorie intake got corrupted with some meals missing now and other meals shifted to random days. In other words, the whole history has become useless.
response: We deeply apologise for the issue you are experiencing. Please either leave your contact details so we can reach out or contact us with details, step description and screenshots directly through https://lifesum.com/deep/settings?page=support - so we can start investigating your issue. Thank you!

title: Donâ€™t waste your money
body: This app could use a lot of work. The nutrition information isnâ€™t always accurate when you try to log items by scanning barcodes. The app constantly glitches and disconnects from my Fitbit, so my exercise calories are rarely correct. It usually takes me 4-5 tries to get the app to show the correct information. You also have limited access to features if you donâ€™t buy the premium version. Which is a waste of money due to all the glitching. Sure it looks cute, but myfitnesspal is a better app.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We will forward it to the responsible team for their knowledge. We apologise for the inconvenience this may have caused.

title: Canâ€™t change serving description Update
body: I figured out how to add a new food and just put in the correct nutritional info. I think this will have to be the only way to have correct nutritional info.

title: Something you should read first!
body: This is in the Terms and Conditions. â€œNutritional information found in our database has not been verified, investigated or reviewed by Lifesum. Lifesum cannot guarantee that the nutritional information provided in our database is accurate, reliant or complete. Lifesum is not responsible for any personal injury or any other damages that may have been the result, direct or indirect, of any use or misuse of the Services.â€
response: Thank you for your feedback. Itâ€™s a big challenge for us to allow people all across the world to track their everyday foods. Our users help by contributing missing foods to our database. Unfortunately, these contributions can have errors, as you discovered. We are constantly working to fix these errors, we hope youâ€™ll try us again in future.

title: Not letting me enter in any food?
body: Yesterday it was fine and let me search and enter in any food and meal and it would add my eaten calories like it normally does, and now today after my app updated, it wonâ€™t let me put in ANYTHING I go to add in my breakfast and I put all of the ingredients I used and when I went to add it to my log, it cleared everything and all of the food I entered in, got put in as 0 calories and nothing was added to my calories eaten. And Iâ€™m so frustrated because it keeps doing this and Iâ€™ve tried everything to fix it and nothingâ€™s working
response: We deeply apologize for the recent issue.

title: Useful... sometimes
body: This is a great app with amazing features and really has gotten me to eat healthier. Along with eating healthier includes not eating out as much. Home made meals are near IMPOSSIBLE to track with this app unless you want to take out a ruler and measure each noodle of spaghetti you eat. I feel like this app is more tailored towards people trying to get in shape and have a healthier diet, because to a lot of people a healthy diet is one you cannot simply buy at the store.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We will make sure that it will reach the responsible team. We assume that you would prefer the option grams for recipes?

title: Customizable Calories & Macros
body: I like this app, but it would be a a lot better if you could customize your daily calorie & macro goals/set them yourself. For those of us following a program where these numbers have been personalized for us, itâ€™s frustrating that we canâ€™t set this up ourselves. If this is already an option, it needs to be much easier to find because I havenâ€™t been able to do so.
response: Thank you for your feedback! It is possible to customise your macros in the 5:2 diet plan and the Classic plan.

title: Good but could use work
body: I enjoy the app and the interface but my allotted calories for the day seem to change frequently, without adding any exercise, and my Fitbit is connect but will not sync which is the most frustrating of al.  The calorie and nutrition entry could use a bit of a cleanup and the barcode scanner as well.  Overall i genuinely do enjoy the app, the diet plans and the recipes but I also feel like Iâ€™m working with a beta app.
response: We apologize for the issue you are experiencing. Please feel free and contact us with details, step description and screenshots at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Please also include phone model, OS and Lifesum version.Thank you!

title: Great weight loss app
body: This app has so many plans to help you reach your goals. The constant track of carbs and calories really helped me. I lost over 50 pounds over 9 months and have used this app to continue maintaining my weight while dropping toward my final goal. Also the exercise tracker is helpful to track calories burned.
response: Great accomplishment! Thank you for sharing your feedback, we are very happy you like the app and that we can support you with your goals!

title: Good app - wish it had more
body: Really enjoy the app more, I totally understand not everything can be free.  However I wish it had more options for the free version instead of just going to premium. You can basically put in your food, exercise, weight, & water. But you are unable to get any insight on anything else. I wish it allowed you to get some feedback without having to pay for the premium.
response: Thank you so much for your feedback, it is like you say, we are charging for some of our features in order to cover our running expenses, which include a team of designers, developers, and nutritionists, and a total of over 85 employees. However, we have sent your request through to the team in charge for their knowledge! Please also feel free to also contact us at contact@lifesum.com for a free trial. Thank you!

title: Poor Food Log
body: The app itself is great to look at.  its easy to navigate and has a decent widget for ios. Compared to MyFitnessPal, the search option to find foods is awful.  When searching for a food item, your list is littered with nonrelevant or incorrectly entered items by other users.  There is also no option to find only verified items which is disappointing.  will be switching bad to MFP until Lifesum improves.

Unfortunately, these contributions can have errors, as you discovered. We are constantly working to fix these errors, we hope youâ€™ll try us again in future. We will make sure to forward your feedback and request to the team in charge! Thank you!

title: A much better lifestyle!
body: I have been using this app for about a month and have already seen great results! I have lost 8 pounds in the first two weeks and have found myself to feel happier, drinking more water, and doing exercises! Would definitely recommend this app to anyone who finds eating to be a hobby!
response: We are super excited to hear that Lifesum has helped you improve your lifestyle! Thank you for sharing your positive thoughts on our app!

title: Charged me more than anticipated
body: Cool app. Great concept. Excited to give it a go. Learned about it from a sponsorship. But when I was signing up for a subscription, the fees were presented as a small monthly charge, come to find out I was charged an almost bank-breaking fee that I had to cancel through Apple. Had a panic attack while trying to fix what happened. Gonna keep playing around the app, but Iâ€™m definitely avoiding the subscriptions.
response: Thank you for your review and feedback! The reason we show the monthly cost, is for our users to see the difference in price from subscribing yearly and monthly. A monthly subscription is also available. We show you the total price before you pay. We are sorry if this wasn't clear enough. You are welcome to request a free Premium trial so you can test the differences - simply send us your registered email address through contact@lifesum.com!

title: Continually signs out of Apple Watch and other minor issues

title: Great way of keeping track

I do not follow the calorie tracker to the extreme, more to keep track of my nutrients and vitamins.
response: Thank you for your feedback, we are very happy to hear that you like the app! We calculate the energy (kcal) recommendation though the Harrys Benedict equation. This is a validated formula that gives a BMR value (basic metabolic rate). Depending on what activity level and goal the user then chose, we get the total energy recommendation. However, you can always change your calorie intake/ day in your setting to whatever is suitable for your needs. This you can do under Settings > Personal details > Calories / Day.

I don't follow those guidelines and would need to change the macros to what I do try to follow but couldn't find any way to do that. response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

Last year I lost a ton of weight VERY unhealthily, and predictably, gained it ALL back, plus some mental health problems. Not this time. Iâ€™m using this app to set maintainable goals, lose it slow and steady. Thanks xx
response: Thank you for leaving your review, we appreciate it! We are happy to happy support, motivate and help you reach your goals in a healthy way. Have a wonderful day!

title: Nutritional info and sizing is way off
body: I keep finding that the serving size nutritional information is WAY off on many things. 100 calories for a whole cup of blue cheese? I wish. 160 calories for a whole cup of roasted pumpkin seeds? No. Someone needs to really fix this information - isnâ€™t this a large part of the value of the app? And those were â€œverifiedâ€ listings! I bought a 6 month subscription but Iâ€™m seriously considering canceling it until this issue is fixed.
response: Thank you for your review and sorry to hear that you have found entries like the ones you mentioned! Please, make sure to contact us with more details on this issue through contact@lifesum.com so we can report it to the team in charge. Thank you in advance and apologies for the inconvenience!

title: This app is fine just donâ€™t get Premium
body: The app is fine and cool. If you upgrade to premium you are wasting your money. I upgraded, it said 5.99 a month I think for six months. I got access to plans like keto things, which I wasnâ€™t interested in the diet plans they have and more diagnostics for your fat,  calories, etc and it wasnâ€™t worth it. Then I tried to cancel my subscription and it charged me the full amount that would have been charged in six months.
response: Thank you for your review. You were charged the full amount upfront and not when you tried cancelling your subscription. The reason we show the monthly cost on the 12 month membership, is for our users to see the difference in price from subscribing yearly and monthly. A monthly subscription is also available. We show you the total price before you pay. We are sorry if this wasn't clear enough. Let us know through contact@lifesum.com if you need assistance with a refund!

title: Loving it!!!
body: Super helpful. I love this app. I never write reviews or rate stuff but I really have found this app to be great. It has helped me to be much more aware of the number of calories I am consuming. It has helped me to become a more healthy individual and I have lost weight using this app. I found It to be very easy to use. Great app.
response: Thanks you so much for your positive feedback! We are very happy to read that you are satisfied!

title: I used to love it.
body: Until about a week ago, I loved this app! For some reason (I didnâ€™t change any of the apps settings or the settings on my Apple Watch or phone), the app stopped accurately tracking my activate calories. At the end of the day, my calories were off by more than 200. Some days it said I burned more than what my watch and phone said, other days it said I burned less. Aside from that, I REALLY like this app and hope that this issue is resolved soon!
response: We deeply apologise for the issue! The team has already found the reason for the problem and is working on a fix for it. A new version with the solution will be published as soon as possible!

title: Ok
body: The app looks nice and seems helpful, but I'm running into issues with inputting food. I found the food I wanted to add when searching, but it didn't have the right number of calories. So I decided to manually input my food instead. But it only let me put in the calories and nothing else, so I'm on track for my calorie count for the day, but all the other nutrients are lacking. It also won't let me go back and edit or delete anything, so I'm stuck with the mistakes.
response: Thanks for your review! You can create your own items under Me, Favorites where you can add all nutritional details. Also, please note that it is only possible to delete or edit an item through Favorites, not through your Diary. Feel free to contact us at contact@lifesum.com if you need further assistance!

title: Great app but at a cost
body: This is a great app but really buying the premium package is the best option. It has a setting where you can sync you Health app on your iPhone and that is about the most accurate way to see how many calories you burn. But I used to just use the free version and still enjoyed it.
response: Thanks a lot for your positive feedback!

I hate the fact that I paid so much money for this app and keep finding such stupid and obvious bugs! hello to your QA ðŸ‘‹ðŸ»ðŸ˜¡ hope you sleep well at night. and day. at your work! ðŸ’©

title: Totally just got robbed
body: I saw that they had a promotion going on for 30% for a 12 month subscription so I decided to sign up. I was billed and got a receipt but itâ€™s not showing up on my app. The â€œrestore purchasesâ€ button doesnâ€™t even work and I tried uninstalling and reinstalling it and that did nothing also. I have no clue whatâ€™s going on but weâ€™re not getting off to a good start. Iâ€™ve emailed the company but I got a response back that they have a high volume of emails so who knows when theyâ€™ll get back to me. Iâ€™m so disappointed.

title: Donâ€™t buy premium
body: I canceled my premium subscription a few weeks in, because it wasnâ€™t compatible to my new Fitbit watch as much as I thought it would be. They canceled the renewing of the subscription for a year from now, but didnâ€™t cancel the premium like I wanted or send me a prorate of my money. Whatâ€™s up lifesum? Did I sign a binding 1 yr contract that I canâ€™t get out of? Same thing happened to my friend who also changed her mind...

title: Break it down now yâ€™all!
body: I am a female 24 year old, start weight is 257. This app really breaks it down for me soooo well! I mean how many grams of fats carbs and proteins per meal, how far you are from your goal, how balanced your meal is, all of the above! This has been an amazing experience in teaching me how to fuel and nourish my body! Iâ€™m so glad I found this app!
response: Thanks you so much for your positive feedback! We are very happy to read that you are satisfied!

title: This app recommends STARVATION
body: Hi, prospective doctor here. For people attempting to lose weight, this app recommends you undergo â€œtwo days of fastingâ€ or the keto diet. Both of these options cut out sugar which is necessary for glycolysis, the metabolic pathway that fuels your body and synthesizes the ATP and Pyruvate that is used for Pyruvate oxidation, the citric acid cycle, and oxidative phosphorylation. All these processes keep your body alive and functioning. Eliminating glucose long term will lead to muscle deterioration and in severe cases, keto acidosis or self-canibalisation. Both are LIFE THREATENING. I suggest seeking a nutritionist who knows the bodily processes and not a trendy app that favors body image above health.
response: Thank you for your concern. We believe that both 5:2 fasting and the ketogenic diet are low risk in the short term and indeed many users report success with these diets. We find the risks due to being overweight are far higher, which is why we include these diets in our recommendations. We would like more long-term research on both diets, but unfortunately these studies take time. We always attempt to offer the healthiest version of a diet that we believe is possible today. For individuals with health conditions, please consult your doctor before making large changes.

title: LifeSum is the best!
body: So well designed!! Beautiful simple layout that is flexible and accommodates a huge range of eating methodologies, personal preferences, and peeves. Iâ€™m having more fun with LifeSum than without it. Iâ€™m learning so much and finding great recipes everyday â€” I doubt that Iâ€™ll ever give up this great app, even after I reach my goals. Thank you!! Highest praise :)
response: Thanks so much for your feedback! We are very glad to hear that you are satisfied!

title: Overly Restrictive
body: The app is beautiful and incredibly user friendly. However, donâ€™t let the â€œFreeâ€ label fool you, to get any value out of this app you must upgrade to premium, which is a fairly pricey, monthly fee.

We are charging for some of our features in order to cover our running expenses, which include a team of designers, developers and nutritionist and a total of over 60 employees. Thanks for your understanding and, please, feel free to send us your registered email at contact@lifesum.com for a free Premium trial!!

I did not want to renew my subscription, because the functions of a paid application are not worth the money. I wanted to cancel my subscription a couple of days before the end, but I was withdrawn on January 14th! In customer support, they was answered that this is not their concern and need to contact the app store. So I do not advise using the paid version.
response: Thank you for your review. Please, make sure to send us all details at contact@lifesum.com for further assistance!

title: Lost 2 pounds already!!!!
body: I am in love with this app, got the premium subscription to have access to the recipes and meal plans, never thought I could go on a Leto diet but they have one called easy keto and itâ€™s doing wonders for me!!!! Just not willing to use multiple source tracking...

Unfortunately, these contributions can have errors, as you discovered. We are constantly working to fix these errors, we hope youâ€™ll try us again in future.

title: Good overall frustrating nutritional inputting

Sometimes I will look up an item and it will have different nutritional info regardless of serving size and preparation method - just the raw item itself. We recommend that you either select items verified by us or, for items that you cannot find in our database, create custom items under Favorites. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp. Good luck with reaching your goal!

title: Only good if you pay for premium
body: This app used to be a decent free app, but it is now useless unless you pay to upgrade. I paid for a year subscription but didnâ€™t stick with using it enough to pay for a second year. Since the last time I used it as a free app, they have significantly reduced the available features to non subscribers. If you will use it daily, itâ€™s worth the $45/yr. otherwise, there are many better free options out there.

title: Share meals and recipes
body: Decent app, needs a better food database.  Would be great if you could share meals/recipes.  My wife and I are both on a Keto diet and frequently dine together and eat the same thing.  It would be great if we could â€œeat togetherâ€ or at least I could send her my meal so she didnâ€™t also have to manually build out the meal or recipe.  You release that and thisâ€™ll get updated to 5 stars for sure!
response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We will make sure that it reaches the responsible teams.

title: Macros are not accurate
body: I was really excited about this app. I even signed up for the premium membership. After a few days of logging my food I realized that the macros reported on a lot of food is not accurate. I would have to go to MyPlate app to get the accurate macros. I understand allowing users to add foods but it should show if the macros have been verified like the MyPlate app does.   Also I signed up for the Keto Medium plan but many of the recipes are not even Keto. Very disappointed ðŸ˜¢

Our food database is partly user-created and that results in some items having inaccurate nutritional values. We recommend that you either select items verified by us or, for items that you cannot find in our database, create custom item under Favorites. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/2n1KDcK. Also, please make sure to select the correct tags under Recipes in order to find the ones that best suit your needs!

title: Motivational
body: I downloaded this app because a had vacation coming up where I would get to see my family after Lamont 13 years. I love the water tips because it applies to the problems Iâ€™ve been having. Itâ€™s also shows you the right and wrongs of dieting and whether what youâ€™re eating is good or bad. I highly recommend this app.
response: Thanks you so much for your positive feedback! We are very happy to read that you are satisfied!

title: Not worth it
body: There are so many free apps out there that will do the same thing as the â€œpremiumâ€ subscription of this app. I thought I would be able to do a lot more with it if I upgraded for 3 months. Iâ€™m glad I double checked labels because my calorie counts would've been extremely off. Defeats the purpose if Iâ€™m having to manually enter everything.

title: Eh

title: No thanks- doesnâ€™t work

body: such a GREAT app for logging food and calorie counting. i have tried many apps for this in the past and lifesum def has the most options for food and is the most convenient to use . i donâ€™t have premium and there are no annoying ads or anything, very impressed.

title: Too many pitfalls
body: The app is beautifully designed but horrible when it comes to managing the subscription. I thought I cancelled during the trial period just to find out Iâ€™ve been charged $50. It took a Google search for me to figure out how to manage the subscription and there isnâ€™t a cancel button- itâ€™s just on auto renew! BTW Iâ€™m calling my lawyer to see if thatâ€™s even legal. I should be able to opt out at any time with the guarantee it wonâ€™t auto renew. Also, you have to pay to connect the app to your Fitbit- boooooo!

title: Needs net carbs
body: Iâ€™ve done keto and used a keto specific app to track. That app subtracted fiber and sugar alcohol from total carbs=net carbs. I am currently carb cycling and the carbs are throwing me off b/c I forget to remember how much fiber/sugar alcohol to subtract. Maybe itâ€™s in the premium version? Idk. Other than that itâ€™s the only tracking app I keep going back to. This app would be SUPERIOR if you could custom set your macros. Whew, what a dream.

title: Premium Features Not Working
body: I recently paid to use the premium version on my phone and none of the premium features are working. title: I love it
body: I love this app and if you donâ€™t understand theses is how I use and I love cause I have been losing wheat before you eat you check if the item is good and they may give you a recipe but I donâ€™t do that and I took the one for a month and I loved it but I after that I could do everything alone

title: It canâ€™t be serious..

They do not always sync right away is there a way to force sync so that both devices are on track with each other?

body: The ad made it look like this app planned meals tailor made to your needs. Instead it just gives you the calorie count you need to hit in order to achieve your goals and then tells you to pick out meals. The entire reason I downloaded the app was because Iâ€™m not sure what I should be eating and was looking for guidance. So basically the app is sufficient if youâ€™re looking for a calorie tracker but beyond that, youâ€™re on your own. Def wasted $ Wee!

If you are looking for one of our Meal Plans, make sure to follow the guide in this article https://bit.ly/2pCkBAP and let us know through contact@lifesum.com if you have further questions or if you wish to be refunded - thank you!

title: Good app if youâ€™re serious
body: This app, like other fitness apps is only good if you are serious with your health. The premium does an excellent job of helping you track more than calories. Hey I had really helped me push into my fitness goals. But the app is sometimes clunky to use (things can be hard to find and it occasionally crashes.)

title: Not what I thought
body: Looks good visually but after I purchase premium and started looking at recipes and trying to import my own in there.  First off itâ€™s too difficult to import your own and there is not enough variety of the recipes that Iâ€™m looking for.  Should have stayed with my other free apps instead of wasting the funds on this only find out itâ€™s not what it seems immediately after I purchased it.  A lot of the things that I scan donâ€™t even show up.  Would really like my money back.

title: Potential but flawed pricing
body: Seems like a fantastic app, but I canâ€™t stand how you canâ€™t do much at all without a premium plan, and most importantly, that the minimum plan offered is three months. Would prefer to see a one month or one week commitment, even if priced high (per month), with the ability to cancel sooner than three months. I donâ€™t want to be roped into something for that long until I can at least spend a few days on it.
response: Thanks for your review! It is absolutely possible to subscribe for 1 month and then cancel the recurring subscription. Please, visit www.lifesum.com/premium and sign into your account to see our available offers. You can also send us your registered email address at contact@lifesum.com for a free Premium trial!

title: Can not access my Account.
body: In August 2018 I purchased a year subscription to Lifesum. In September 2018 I got a new iPhone and I have not been able to access my account it is say â€œemailâ€ not found. Under my Apple ID subscription it shows that I am subscribed to Lifesum. I have contact Lifesum multiple times via email and social media. NO RESPONSE. According to their site the best way to contact them is through the app but, unfortunately for me and several other paying customers we can not access our accounts.
response: We deeply apologise for this! Please contact support directly at contact@lifesum.com and they will help you sort this out quickly. Thank you!

title: Totally erratic, I can't trust it.
body: I payed a whole year subscription... I have written 3 times to the support email and NO answer at all... The menu planning and general menu recommendations are very easy to follow and prepare, that I love, BUT the calculations seems erratic and the Apple Health synchronizing is TOTALLY messed up, even after the latest update yesterday..

title: A breath of fresh air, great support
body: So much of a focus on simplicity compared to other apps in the same vein. Also, I did something goofy with my Apple ID/subscription/deleting my account and their support team got me fixed up within an hour. Will absolutely be sticking with Lifesum for my 2021 New Years resolution ðŸŽ‰
response: Thank you so very much for your positive feedback! We are very happy to read that you are satisfied!

title: Macros cannot be trusted
body: The biggest single problem is recording what you eat when the nutrition data cannot be trusted. More often than not I research with google. And yet the diary is the main point of the app. Just take a bottle of red wine for example: 100 grams (silly claim with 95% carbohydrates !!!and a wopping 210 gr. of net carbs!!! ) I pity someone who believes this.  Iâ€™ve used the app for a couple years but I wish I had shopped around for one with an honest macros tracker. This one has never been edited.
response: Thank you for your feedback. It is indeed a big challenge for us to allow people all across the world to track their everyday foods. Our users help by contributing missing foods to our database. Unfortunately, these contributions can have errors, as you discovered. We are constantly working to fix these errors, but always recommend to track foods that are marked with the Verified by Lifesum tick. Please also feel free to report the errors you encounter in the app. Thank you!

title: Fantastic Interface to Apple Watch & Health data
body: I am very impressed with how this APP interfaces with the Apple Watch/Apple health App. A very large range of foods to enter with flexible volumes allow me to keep exact count on the calorie deficit I want to maintain to reach my weight gain goals each day/week/month and the app is super easy to use.

But i cant add the macros thats in it. I think that would be a really good feature to add

title: More options for water
body: Iâ€™ve only been using this app for a couple days and I REALLY like it so far, but think itâ€™s ridiculous that you only have two choices for the amount of water to log. It would be so much easier if there was a 12 oz option, or even the ability to set your own units.

title: Nutrition Information is Wrong
body: I purchased a one year subscription because I was interested in the health quiz. However, when I started to try to log my food I found out that the most basic ingredients have incorrect nutrition information. Old fashioned oats are 150 calories per 1/2 cup. Every entry that I could find for old fashioned oats says 150 calories per 1 cup. This is off by a factor of two. I could adjust but I shouldnâ€™t have to. I will be seeking a refund. Avoid this app. I am going back to my fitness pal.
response: Thanks for your review and sorry to hear that Lifesum didn't meet your expectations! Our food database is partly user-created and that results in some items having inaccurate nutritional values. We recommend that you either select items verified by us or, for items that you cannot find in our database, create custom items under Favorites. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp.

Itâ€™s the reason Iâ€™m still a recovering anorexic. The age limit should be much higher and there needs to be a relook at how they make things bc I put in my weight and height only to be told I could eat 1200 calories a day, at 12 years old. Insane. If I ate more than I could, I was told to workout. If I didnâ€™t, the weight would go up on the app which made me feel awful about myself.

Please find more information here: https://lifesum.helpshift.com/a/lifesum---healthier-eating-better-living/?s=other&f=support-in-case-of-problems-with-behavioural-issues&p=all

This then throws off the amount of calories left for intake. Is this a setting I can correct, or is it something wrong with the App?
response: Thank you for your review! Can you please send your details and issues directly at contact@lifesum.com so we can take a closer look at this. Thank you very much in advance! We apologise for the inconvenience.

Worth the money.

body: This app really makes tracking calories/fitness so easy! Never have i ever come across an app that offers SO MUCH FREE stuff!!! I did however subscribe to the premium($3.75 a month) and itâ€™s even better! Try it out for yourself and youâ€™ll see just how great it is!

title: This app is rubbish
body: Whatever you do, donâ€™t pay for a subscription. You might as well flush your $30 down the toilet. App requires an internet connection, and Lifesumâ€™s servers are frequently down. title: Devs donâ€™t listen / Fonts & Lettering Too Small
body: I complained to Lifesum for over a year for making the caloric wheel and word lettering fonts too small on larger size phones. These devs donâ€™t care what looks good, but only for your money. MyPlate app dashboard is easier to quickly read without squinting and is more visually appealing because everything is bigger. title: VERY Inaccurate

Unfortunately, these contributions can have errors, as you discovered. We are constantly working to fix these errors, we hope youâ€™ll try us again in future.

title: Lifesum is Great!

Thank you!

body: My wife and I have been using this app for a while, finally updated for â€œpremiumâ€ and we really enjoy the macros. The limit on the type of exercises is damaging to the performance of the app. Also, if there was an option to switch from minutes done to reps/sets done, it would increase the accuracy of the workout portion.

title: Good... but could be better
body: I donâ€™t hate this app. Itâ€™s a great way to track your meals and water intake, but itâ€™s lacking in some areas. Our food database is partly user-created and that results in some items having inaccurate nutritional values. We recommend that you either select items verified by us or, for items that you cannot find in our database, create custom items (recipes, meals and exercises as well as food items) under Favorites. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp.

title: Poor performance for a great idea
body: Calorie count, fat count, protein count, carb count... nearly twice a day I add a food to my diary and the counts are all off. Milk doesnâ€™t have 30 grams of sugar. The conversions are not calculating correctly either. This was such a waste of money and there is no way to get a refund. body: I like the layout and ease of adding a goal and foods to my daily log. However, I want to keep track of the total water I drink, not just the suggested goal. I surpass that water goal when I make it the max. Iâ€™d like to just keep adding oz by oz to my daily intake.

body: Iâ€™m 20 years old and 4ft 11 and somehow it wont let me sign up for it. It wonâ€™t let me login through Apple ID, email, nor facebook. Please fix!

title: Really helpful
body: This really shows me what I am doing wrong in my daily health schedule and sense I am using this app I now know that my â€œhealthâ€ schedule wasnâ€™t all that healthy what Iâ€™m trying to say is if you havenâ€™t used this if you get it it will be a huge help in a diet
response: Thank you for your review! We are happy to read that you like Lifesum!

title: Recommend it
body: Best free calorie tracking app. Easy to use and you can get the most out of it for free than almost every other app Iâ€™ve tried l. If you have and Apple Watch you can also add/ connect your workouts in to subtract your calories. Great app!

The design of the app is very user friendly and the overall layout is appealing. My only issue with this app was the use of smiley/frowning faces next to the foods. The whole point of calorie counting is to know the macronutrient breakdown of your food and the appropriate portions. There shouldnâ€™t be an emotional connection to the food itself. Thereâ€™s no â€œbadâ€ food, just food that needs to be eaten in moderation. It seems like an eating disorder in the making.
response: Thank you so much for your feedback! We are sorry to hear that you feel that way. Meal ratings, which appear in the Diary view as emojis, exist to provide feedback on how close you are tracking towards your health goals. These ratings are generated by an algorithm that considers a variety of different factors: your health goals, your dietary preferences, your nutrition settings, if you are getting the right proportions of macro and micronutrients, and if you are close to achieving your calorie goal for that specific meal. We have sent you feedback through to the team in charge for their knowledge! Thank you.

title: Wish there was a free trial
body: Iâ€™m already regretting my purchase and wish I

Please feel free to contact us within the time fram and along with your receipt at contact@lifesum.com and our support will assist you. Thank you!

title: Love the app but..

Love the look and feel of the app and how easy it is to use, but now itâ€™s starting to not load/add my food entries. Please fix because I do love the app.

title: Horrible app, not applicable to most people
body: This app is the worst. Not only did it not allow for a refund after I decided within 8 minutes that the upgrade was trash, but it also doesnâ€™t take into account different types of diets, allergies, and dislikes. DO NOT BUY THIS APP because it is a scam. Iâ€™m so mad Iâ€™m out $30 for an upgrade that was the farthest thing from helpful. Give me my money back & make it possible for people with different allergies to succeed with this horrible app.

Once you have finished editing, you can track the correct version in your Diary. Note that it is not possible to edit an item when selecting it from your Diary.

title: Why aren't the macros always customizable??

This app is a waste of your time and money, do not pay for it.

I have now been waiting days to hear back from any support because my app does not reflect my purchase and therefore I cannot use the features that were my reason for downloading. My app constantly tries to get me to â€œupgrade to premiumâ€ even though Iâ€™ve already made the purchase.

A support agent will be in touch as soon as possible and fix this issue for you. Thank you for your patience!

title: Paleo

title: Incredible and perfect
body: This app is with every penny. I purchased the annual subscription and have been using it for only about a week but so far it's been incredibly valuable. I have been entering in every meal, snack, and my water intake. Drinking water has helped me to be healthier and stay hydrated! I've been hitting my goals every single day. I love the design of the app, it's so beautiful. The designer did an amazing job at creating a very nuanced and detailed experience. It's a joy to use this app and it's fun! The illustrations and colors are fantastic. I was a MyFitnessPal user for years and since they were acquired by UA they stopped updating, improving, and evolving the app in any way. This is fitness and food tracking at a new and modern level. It's really a wonderful app. It is absolutely helping me to reshape my lifestyle. The added bonus is the integration of recipes that you can easily add to your meal tracking, not to mention the food is actually pretty good and simple to make. What more could you want? Also it's really nice to be able to choose between different types of diets, with each adjusting the calories you should be having at each meal. A feature that's really awesome is being able to see a summary of your intake for the day, which is broken down and categorized across protein, carbs, and fat, in a beautiful infographic of graphs and pie charts. I love just looking at this app!  So in that way it's quite personal, which makes the whole experience far more engaging than any other fitness app I've ever used. It's well worth the price and I will continue to use the app throughout my day to stay on track and be as healthy as possible. Keep up the amazing work Lifesum!
response: Thank you so much for your feedback! We very much appreciate that!

title: READ THIS
body: So I think everyone can agree that losing/maintaining/gaining weight or just even remembering to eat healthily can be a very tough thing for anybody. This app, is honestly the HOLY GRAIL of nutrition tracker app. AND YES I SAY NUTRITION, because it is not just a weight loss, cal counter, water tracker, itâ€™s so much more than that. I know this because I can probably say I have used every freakin app to try and make the habit of healthy living stick. So there is a few bugs here and there but nothing I can say that would make me stop using it. Mainly just certain calories not matching up etc. but I doubt the makers of this app can control that due to it probably being inputted from other resources, BUT I will say, itâ€™s almost 75% accurate if youâ€™re not specifically measuring anything out. Iâ€™m saying this because I do measure everything out, and honestly if you do measure your food and put it into the app, it is extremely accurate, some of the work has to be put on your side because a phone screen cannot accurately calculate how much your eating. It is a tool!!!! An extremely useful, well made, and STUNNING tool to help you along whatever health journey you are going on. My FAVORITE function of the app of all is you can create your own recipes where it calculates the calories in what you made, let me tell you, an absolute game changer. If you have an Apple Watch, it pairs the app to your activityðŸ˜. I lost 14 lbs and toned up (of course with exercise and such) but with this app by my side I honestly felt like it was effortless. Just try it for yourself I promise.
response: Thank you for your review and positive words! We are happy to read that you like Lifesum!

title: So many great features, but can be difficult to use.
body: Iâ€™ve actually enjoyed the many many features that are all bundled into this one app, and I donâ€™t think any app can compare! However, I think thereâ€™s still some bugs and things that make it less easy to use. For one, sometimes you can scan the barcode of the food you ate (thinking itâ€™ll be faster and easier), but then the calories that Lifesum logs are actually different from the calories on the package with the same serving size. Iâ€™m often having to jerry-rig the serving size to make it match the package because even an extra ten calories can make the app give you a frowny-face for the meal. Secondly, maybe itâ€™s just my account specifically, but my weight is never recorded in permanence in the weight log. Everyday that I log my weight, it starts me right back off where I weighed before I started using the app, saying â€œwow you lost 5 pounds today!â€ when really I lost one pound and the other lost pounds were logged on previous days. In my calendar of weight statistics, itâ€™s a stagnant, flat line from my goal weight for about a week and then will drop down as soon as I update it. Tomorrow, though, itâ€™ll pretend I never logged a change yesterday and go right back to my starting weight. Lastly, I wish that the units the servings were marked in was more clear. Often â€œpiecesâ€ will actually mean the one serving size as mentioned on the package of the food, yet pieces makes you want to type in te NUMBER OF PIECES you ate. Like pizza rolls. â€œOne piecesâ€ is actually 6 pieces and 220 calories. In spite of all this, I think the app is beautiful in design and I love how many features are available. I also think that premium might not be worth it... Iâ€™m using premium now during a free month trial, and I donâ€™t feel like it gave me a whole lot more. I donâ€™t feel like having this premium month gave me a taste of anything Iâ€™d consider buying after my free period is over.
response: Thank you for your thorough review and feedback! Can you please send your details and issues directly at contact@lifesum.com so our support can help you further? Thank you very much in advance! We apologise for the inconvenience.

response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We think you are referring to the 5:2 diet: you eat normally for five days and then fast for two days. This means you can eat only up to 25% of your normal caloric intake, when on restriction, which is between 500-600 calories. That does not mean that you are not allowed to eat anything but limited in order to get the desired effect.

title: Not what I expected.
body: I decided to do the 3 month Lifesum. I've had enough time to determine it is not for me. (I only used 1.25 months) It doesn't scan food items correctly. I will scan in the package and the calories and protein wouldnâ€™t be accurate to the item I just scanned per serving. Iâ€™d either get the calories right or the protein but not both. Over half the time, you have to measure your food by weight instead of doing it by cups. I have to tweak most of my stuff and you can't look up uncommon food items a little under half the time. And I haven't once used there meal plans because at least one item in the recipe we don't have in our home. It normally is an uncommon ingredient that poor people wouldnâ€™t have in their cupboard. They don't set up planning for a weekly bases or grocery lists like I was hoping. And there recipes aren't exactly set to your style. Chose clean eating and most recipes still lacked the protein factor which is my hardest obstacle. (I can never seem to eat enough in my diet) So don't get this app unless you are only counting calories and if that is the case don't do the upgrade. Not worth it. But I'm glad I did it so I now know what it all entails. This was a good step to finding what I AM looking for. Calorie counter and meal planner combo. But even that isnâ€™t needed if you have the Fitbit app. PS it also doesnâ€™t hook up to MY version of the Fitbit which was disappointing. If you still decide youâ€™re going for it and want to pay for the upgrade double check in your Fitbit app to see if youâ€™re Fitbit is compatible. And if you DO have a Fitbit I highly suggest you just pay the premium for that.
response: Thank you for your valuable feedback, we appreciate it.

response: Apologises for the inconvenience, and thank you for your feedback. Our product is calculating our users Body Mass Index (BMI) by body weight in kg / height in meters2, which is a well used and validated method. In order to prevent an unsafe usage of our product, we have certain limits. If you are below or above our allowed BMI limits, we lack the resources to provide you with the correct guidance needed, and kindly ask you to turn to your health care provider for further assistance.
