title: Very convenient
body: Just starting and I'm looking foward to losing some weight over the next few weeks..!!

title: Great at guiding weight loss!
body: With an Apple watch, the Health App, and Lifesum's interface for tracking what goes in my mouth and how that relates to exercise and steps, it makes loosing weight predictable and sensible.

title: Had high hopes
body: I use this app for two days, and now I'm deleting it. I have the Apple Watch, and the data will not properly sync between the watch and my phone. Everything that I logged on the watch gets overwritten, as soon as I open the app on my phone. Sorry. I tried.

title: Don't Buy It
body: Don't get suckered into buying the Premium version. The free app was promising so I expected the paid version to be better. Wrong. I can't even tell what's different except they alter the macronutrients slightly. $50 to tell me a "high protein" diet has more protein than a balanced diet. Canceled my subscription and will never even use the free app again out of disappointment. Snake oil salesmen.

title: Great little app

title: Its aight
body: This app is average at best, there are other very similar apps that so more and work better. Im disappointed that there are very little exercises you can add in for example I simply tried to put "side crunch" as an exercise I did and it couldn't find a result!

title: Great app
body: I've been using this app for about a month now and it's really helping me stay accountable for eating healthier and to lose weight!

title: Useless
body: While this app is aesthetically pleasing, functionally it's a mess. When it works, it works fairly well and has the potential to be THE food/ activity tracking app. Unfortunately, it crashes, freezes my phone and is utterly useless more often than not. I'm quite dissatisfied and thankful that I'm not paying for the frustration.
response: The fix has just been launched. Please update your app and check if you are still experiencing any issues. Thank you very much!

title: Hilarious

title: I like it

body: Unlike other apps, Lifesum makes it very easy for you to keep track of what you eat without having  to spend extra time counting calories yourself. I love it and this is THE OPPORTUNITY WORTH TAKING!!!!ðŸ‘ŒðŸ‘ŒðŸ‘Œ

title: Great App!
body: I tried to just leave this feedback, if it goes twice, oops... I love this app! It has been very motivating.  Please add other measurements (like cups, ounces, etc) to the "add food" part.

title: Horrible
body: Very few selection of different kinds of food. They don't have a simple turkey sandwich as a meal option, but you can sure select anything from Arbys or mcdonalds menu. Seriously, anybody on a diet or trying to keep healthy shouldn't even think of eating anything from a fast food joint. Not user friendly at all. I want my money back.

title: Please adjust exercise calories to weight!
body: OK but calories lost per exercise should be adapted to weight, which doesn't seem to be the case. If you are little, it will overestimate by up to 1.5x or do the amount of calories you lose per exercise.

title: I love it
body: I love how this app allows me to keep up with what I eat and what I burn. Thanks to this app, I have managed to loose 30 pounds. Keep making lives better lifesum.

title: Love it so far
body: Easy to use. Pretty design. Wish I could easily swap items from one meal to another though.

title: Don't Pay for This!
body: The advertisements for the purchase options are gravely misleading. You get exactly the same thing you would get on a free app - maybe even less. The only nice thing is that you can pick diets, but good luck finding recipes on the app. In addition, the math for allotments is crazy. No one should be eating only 800 calories a day! Not worth a penny.

title: Awesome app

title: Love it

title: Love it

title: Nothing special

response: We are sorry to read that you feel that way. Premium does not just offer recipes but a whole range of features: https://lifesum.com/premium

title: Super App
body: Recently added Lifesum to keep track of calories and fitness. Keeping me on track the pounds are dropping and I can login on the go ðŸ‘ðŸ»

title: Lifesum
body: The best app for tracking your food. The new part that you get graded for your food is really awesome , I would recommend this app to everybody

title: Use Runkeeper and Pinterest for free!
body: There is nothing convenient about this app, it imports data from other workout apps or you have to manually input it. It offers you recipes - but I can tour Pinterest for a more tapered appeal. And there are No Refunds after two weeks. Plus customer service is less then charming. Major thumbs down!

title: Could be better
body: Iâ€™ve used My Fitness Pal for years, and I liked the look of this one. Especially the letter grades for foods or meals. But the database is small and inaccurate. The recipe builder is so bad, itâ€™s not usable. It could be the best food tracking app ever, but itâ€™s not there yet.

title: No customization
body: A fitness app that doesn't let you customize your macros or calorie count MSU use the standard diet. I should be able to make my own custom diet. Terrible. The only good thing about this app is that it is good-looking. Also canceling your subscription or trial is almost impossible. I am really unhappy with this and immediately uninstalling.

title: Good but needs some work
body: I love this app to keep track of my food and help me meet my goals. I do wish the app worked better with my Fitbit. I would definitely give it 5 stars if that part worked properly.

title: Don't switch from MyFitnessPal
body: Thought I'd make the switch after using MFP for a long time. I won't make that mistake again. Every thing I eat throughout the day is not logged correctly into this system so it makes everything difficult to log. If it's difficult to log then I'm not going to do it. Total fail.

title: Great App!

title: Be ready to spend money...

title: Awesome app to track intake levels!
body: I practice a plant based diet, so his app really aids in tracking my protein intake and helps balance everything else involved!

title: Amazing!

title: So far so good.

title: Misinformative
body: Lifesum oversimplifies the information it tries to present, and in doing so it ends up giving you a very warped understanding of your diet. Healthy, wholesome foods like bananas, hard boiled unsweetened applesauce, and mushrooms are given poor scores for "high in natural sugar" or "calorie dense." Also, the nutritional facts such as serving size and calories are wildly inaccurate. There are many better apps out there!

title: Great but....
body: Lifesum is awesome. I have make lots of healthy decisions with this app. The only issue is that to get most of the good stuff you have to subscribe. It costs a lot of money but has a ton of fetuses that come with it.

title: Still lacking for watch support

title: Giving up

title: Awesome App

title: Refund, please
body: You cannot just enter one unit of food and then say you ate one unit, such as a Larabar or a frozen meal. You must enter the calories per 100 grams, then enter how many ounces you ate. Great for anyone with a scale handy. Very inconvenient otherwise. I can't stand apps that take longer to enter the info than it took to eat the food. Please, please refund my money.

title: Don't get if your 12 or younger

response: We are sorry to hear she was disappointed. We believe that as a teenager this should not be easily accessible due to the susceptibility to body ideals and such. At a young age this can do more damage than good as we can not supervise our users closely as an app.

title: This is a great app
body: I really like this program.  The graphs give great feedback, and the diary is easy to use. The food database is great to get one started, but I like to use the labels and serving sizes from the food I'm actually buying in the store or restaurant (if the establishment has a nutritional chart otherwise I look up equivalents on the web for my entries).  These are easy to enter and once you have a few meal items (or meals as the food entries are easily defined either way) in the database it takes no time at all to do the diary.  The program works great and is very intuitive.

title: It's awesome, helpful, and motivating, but could be even better.
body: I've been using this app obsessively for about two weeks now and I absolutely love it. It is SO motivating for me and I'm so thankful I found it, because it has helped completely transform my eating habits. The app itself is designed very well (love the graphics, colors, and animations). I really love the food diary, meal and day ratings, lifescore, the different food/water trackers, as well as the daily and meal-specific calorie tracker. The ratings are what really help me, because they guide me on what foods are best and not-so-good for my health and for my goals. The smileys are awesome. Lifesum even has a weight/body measurement tracker so you can see how many pounds you have lost/gained, as well as an exercise tracker so you can see how many calories you have burned, which is so helpful. I purchased the premium version pretty quickly after downloading, and while it is a little more than I'd like to pay yearly, it's definitely worth it in the long run for me personally.
response: Thank you very much for your detailed feedback! That is very much appreciated!

title: User updatable online database a good think, but a fiasco in practice; Cumbersome to add food/recipe
body: Tracks water. It does not track sodium although screen shots of the upcoming version suggest that sodium will be trackable. While you can enter total fat, you cannot break out the saturated fat or trans-fatty acid numbers. It covers the other major nutritional items and gives you the daily totals of each. Foods are in categories and that works most of the time. However, why are muffins under snacks and not under breads? You can edit just about everything, and there's a trash can where you can go and undelete an item you've deleted. I can add an exercise and edit it. I can "edit" a database exercise but the only thing I can change is the name. Can edit everything about custom foods as well as database foods. When I add a new food to the database, I can't enter the nutritional information by serving as it is listed on the food label -- I have to enter it based on 1 of whatever measurement I've chosen. While on the one hand this makes sense, on the other, I now have to have a calculator so I can convert the nutritional information from the food label serving size to 1 of my measurement. That's what computers are for -- I don't want to have to have a calculator on hand when I'm doing my data entry into the app. I could enter a recipe from a cookbook that already has the nutritional values as a custom food. However, if I'm cooking a recipe that does not already have the nutritional values I have to figure it all out manually before I enter it as a custom food in this application. When I add a food to my diary, one of the categories I can select is "Brand Name" but it's empty. When I search for a brand food, for example "General Mills" nothing is found, so I have to do an online search. I saved a cereal from my online search for "Genera Mills"; *now* if I go to "Brand Name" category I see an entry. If I search for "Cheerios" on line, there are tons of entries for "Cheerios" -- all different (two different "1 cup" servings had totally different nutritional information) -- so I either have to sift through them all to find the accurate entry for my serving type or I have to create my own entry, which would then end up as still another "Cheerios" entry in the on line database, adding to the chaos. The on line database needs more brand foods and restaurant foods and once that's done, the on line database needs to be cleaned up. That would solve the problem of everyone making their own entries a la this "Cheerios" example. We cannot use this app right now because some of the nutritional items we need to track are not available. When the next version comes out and if tracking the additional nutrition items, cleanup of the online database, food entry with "per serving" data entry of nutritional values, and recipe entry with generating of nutritional values are added we'll be happy to use this app and will change the score.

title: Wowâ€¦ just wow. What an excellent app
body: I never write reviews, but this one is so good that I felt compelled to applaud the developers and company in general. Canâ€™t believe how robust this app is and how simple it is to compile â€œmealsâ€ out of individual ingredients just by scanning a bard code, and saving them for use later. Beautiful UI and fluid and intuitive UX. Love the detail of verifying nutritional information with a little check mark next to each product as with most calorie tracking apps youâ€™re given a slew of products and never know which one to choose from the search results.

title: More genders
response: Thank you for reaching out. The reason why we currently only have two options available is due to our current calculation of daily energy requirements. We are calculating the daily energy requirement based a validated equation called The Harrisâ€“Benedict equations revised by Mifflin and St Jeor, were we calculate the BMR and then multiplying it by the given activity level. This equation take into account variables such as sex, age, height, weight and goal weight. Unfortunately, there are only two sexes available for the equation - male or female. In order for us to proivde the correct nutritional guidance for our users, we currently only have these two available. We are, however, currently working on a better solution for this, as we of course want to be able to include all people - and guide them towards a healthier life though better eating.

title: 5 stars for organization
body: While I am happy to award you 5 stars for your app, I found it to be lacking for me and my diet restrictions, so deleted it after just 2 days. I would think that just 2 days use would grant me a refund of the majority, if not all of my payment of $24.95, but have yet to see it. Any help you can give Apple, Iâ€™d greatly appreciate. Thank you!
response: Thank you for your rating. Deleting the app does not interfere with your purchased subscription - this is something you have to apply for separately. If you need assistance with handling your payment, please contact our support team at https://lifesum.com/deep/settings?page=support. Thank you!

title: Not Suitable for Vegans
body: I wanted to start counting calories in order to lose weight. I saw that this app was highly suggested by a lot of doctors that I watch on YouTube. So, I gave it a shot. Spent money for the premium version and itâ€™s not able to track my vegan food that I scan into it. Waste of money for me.

Thank you very much in advance! We apologise for the inconvenience.

title: Not Bad
body: Design of the app is good, but it should be more customizable to input my own measurements. The water log on the watch app is supposed to be easy, but itâ€™s needlessly frustrating, making you choose between a full cup or a full bottle for one-touch input. You have go into the settings to change the amounts each time you want to log a different type. I assume this is because goals are set as cups/bottles per day, but people donâ€™t always drink water out of the same size containers every time every day. I donâ€™t know why I canâ€™t just input by ounces. Itâ€™s also not possible to edit your intake via the app, so good luck if you donâ€™t have a watch, and donâ€™t have a 8.45oz cup or 16.91oz bottle. Most of my daily logs are inaccurate so the water feature is pretty irrelevant and needs a major overhaul.
response: Many thanks for your review! Your feedback is very appreciated and it has been forwarded to the responsible team. Also, please feel free to leave suggestions for improvement on  UserVoice: https://lifesum.uservoice.com - the responsible teams are regularly going through the feedback there.

title: Review
body: Great app as far as calorie recommendations and healthy advice. I love the bar code scanner and it makes tracking a lot easier. The calories burnt during a workout seem a little high and itâ€™s difficult to track restaurants

title: Love the app but could use some tweaks
body: I have been using Lifesum for exactly 347 days according to my ongoing streak. Everything works great for the most part other than some rare times the app doesnâ€™t boot and my phone requires a restart to get it working. My main problem lies in the lack of sharing towards others who use the same app. For example, my sister made a different more low calorie lasagna but even after making the recipe and putting the steps on Lifesum, she couldnâ€™t send it to me. I know there is a feature coming where you can share recipes with people, but if we could add to that and make a way to also friend other people, it would allow some cool features like looking at more creative recipes other people mightâ€™ve made, as well as ingredients people have favorited.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback, and well done on the streak! Please feel free to leave suggestions for improvement on  UserVoice: https://lifesum.uservoice.com - the responsible teams are regularly going through the feedback there. Many thanks :)

title: Great app!

title: Good, but needs some work
body: Great calorie counting app that has a bar code feature to make calorie counting super streamlined. I also like that is breaks down your meal into grams carbs, fat, and protein.  I donâ€™t like how it rates food by smiley faces because it is not very accurate. I am not diabetic and using the classic diet plan, but it rates a medium apple as not a good snack food. I can tell you that an apple is a much better snack than chips, yet they get practically the same rating?? Other things that donâ€™t make sense or could be changed: it adds your calories from exercise to the total number of calories you need to consume. In other words, the app wants you to eat as many calories as you burn???? The whole point of exercise to help you create a calorie deficit to lose weight. If you burn 600 calories working out and then go eat several slices of pizza you just defeated the whole point!!! Because of this the app always shows that I am consuming only 700-800 calories a day, but in reality I am consuming about 1300 a day and also exercising. I also donâ€™t like that you cannot adjust your daily goal calorie intakeâ€” I would like to choose 1300, but the app is set at 1500, so I just watch the total number of calories consumed instead of looking at how many calories I have left. If you are total novice at portion control, healthy eating, and exercise this app could make it difficult to actually lose weight. I also donâ€™t like that I have to manage my progress by weight unless I wantto purchase  the deluxe version. I donâ€™t need meal prep plans, meal ideas, or all the other bells and whistles. I would like to track my weight by body measurements, which is a much more accurate approach since a person can gain and lose up to 4 lbs on average during a day in water weight alone. Also measuring by inches instead of lbs is less disheartening for the above mentioned reason. I just track this on a weakly basis on my own, but the stupid app asks me every morning to input my weight. Overall good for calorie tracking if you are mindful of the pitfalls.

title: Add more fasting options
body: I would like to add more fasting options. I do OMAD which is one large meal (1200-1400 calories) a day and 22 hours of fasting and weekends I eat like normal. You donâ€™t have this as an option so Iâ€™m forced to go over my intake for the day when Iâ€™m fasting since itâ€™s a 500 calorie limit. Please update this.
response: Thank you for your feedback! Our product team is collecting all user suggestions directly here: http://lifesum.uservoice.com/forums/274566-feedback-ideas/filters/top

title: Good tracker poor synching with apple health
body: Most food that I buy at the supermarket is available to track in the app which makes the bar code scanner feature very practical. The process to add foods that arenâ€™t recognized is pretty simple. Only thing is the app inconsistently syncs with apple health. Sometimes the calories match most times it doesnâ€™t.

title: Limited control
body: When I saw this was voted â€œbest health appâ€ I wanted to give it a try but it turned out to be so much less than I expected. The food tracker is so dumbed-down, it lacks the option to customize your entries in the most basic ways. For example, you tap a water glass icon to enter your water but you canâ€™t adjust glass size- itâ€™s 8oz or nothing. My glasses are 12oz pints. Yes, I can do the math but for a $49.99 app, I shouldnâ€™t have to. It also doesnâ€™t sync accurately with my Fitbit. Only a fraction of my steps show up in Lifesum- it seems to sync once early in the day but doesnâ€™t update. I do like the look of the interface and the way it shows your macros- very easy to read & understand. Just overpriced for what it is- I have found it more frustrating than helpful so far!

When I got back some lab work that made it clear I had to watch my nutrition more closely and switch off the high protein diet I had been following (history of kidney disease in my family and routine blood work showed some early detection red flags) I started looking for a way to track my protein intake and maintain my sanity.

My only problem is the lack of fine tuning for your personal goals. For example Iâ€™m following the 5:2 diet plan and for the 5 days that Iâ€™m not fasting during the week Iâ€™m expected to eat close to 3500 calories a day? Thatâ€™s absurd considering I put in the same information (height, weight, etc.) on a separate website and I was told I needed to take in at the most 1700-2300 calories a day depending on how active I am during the day, to lose weight. The math doesnâ€™t add up and itâ€™s kind of frustrating to have the app telling me Iâ€™m failing at meeting my daily goals outside of my 2 fasting days. I suggest a future update that allows members to pick their diet plan and then be able to fine tune it to their individual needs. Other than that itâ€™s an outstanding app thatâ€™s been really keeping me committed to eating healthier!

title: Scam
body: Beware that even though the app states $3.95 per month and can cancel anytime they will charge you $44.95. Our food database is partly user-created and that results in some items having inaccurate nutritional values. We recommend that you either select items verified by us or, for items that you cannot find in our database, create custom items under Favorites. And lastly, please send us your details through contact@lifesum.com if you wish to be assisted with a refund directly from Lifesum and not Apple. Thanks!

response: Thank you very much for contacting us and please apologise the waiting time!

title: Calorie counter is TOO HIGH
body: This would be a great app, but it allows you to eat too much. I know itâ€™s healthy to do so, but Iâ€™d rather it allow me to lose weight faster by limiting my calories a lot more. Other research has shown me that itâ€™s perfectly reasonable to eat less than the 1600 calories LifeSum believes I should eat to â€œloseâ€ weight as fast as it will let me. I end up gaining weight instead even if itâ€™s perfectly clean eating because thatâ€™s A LOT of food. Sometimes Iâ€™m sedentary so I logged my lifestyle in to fit a diet for that, but 1600 is impossibly high for my low metabolism to keep up with & I start to feel bigger and bigger & the scale reflects that. I do want to be more active, but that has nothing to do with the app so any progress I make that way is now help from LifeSum. Many other approved sites suggested I subtract 500 calories a day from my regular intake (about 1600 more or less) to lose 1 lb (3500 cal) a week. And then raise my cal intake back up to 1300-1400 to maintain my weight once I reach my goal. So if I donâ€™t BURN 500 extra cal per day while eating 1600 cal, Iâ€™ll never see progress, and I may actually see worse. Itâ€™s annoying that it will not let me lower the counter one bit. 1600 cal is hardly a weight loss diet for anyone! Itâ€™s just about normal for maintaining for most people (especially sedentary) & easily well fit for GAINING for sedentary or less active people in general.
response: Thanks for you feedback! Our normal plans/diets are calculated on an individual calorie goal, based on the Harrys Benedict formula. This formula gives us the BMR (basic metabolic rate) and then, depending on activity level and goal, we calculate the users TEE (total energy expander). We do not recommend a deficit of more than -500 kcal per day since that has been proven less successful for a long term weight loss. A larger deficit than that also makes it very hard to retain muscle mass.

title: Horribly inaccurate!
body: I used Lifesum for several months a year ago and it was excellent because of the accuracy and ease of use. Using the app to track my macros really helped me accomplish my goals. Over time, I fell out of the habit of tracking my diet because, well, life.

title: If youâ€™re counting carbs or care about accuracy at all, skip this app!
body: TLDR: bought the premium app at 50 percent off since the user face is so beautiful (thatâ€™s my one star). If youâ€™re looking for any sort of accuracy in the recorded nutritional content, you're best using a different app like My Fitness Plan, Senza, etc. So utterly disappointed that nearly every barcode scanned calculates the wrong information. I can accept some errors here and there since the data could be user submitted, but holy hell, how many things could be so far from what the nutritional content is for mainstream products like Fage yogurt cups. 17 carbs in 5 ounces of yogurt? Can your app even read?!
response: Thank you for your feedback. Itâ€™s a big challenge for us to allow people all across the world to track their everyday foods. Our users help by contributing missing foods to our database. Unfortunately, these contributions can have errors, as you discovered. We are constantly working to fix these errors, we hope youâ€™ll try us again in future.

title: This company stole my money
body: I purchased a premium membership on May 24th, 2018 for $29.99. It is now February 27, 2019. For several weeks I used the Ketogenic Strict diet plan and then tried out several other plans in the app. After a few months I fell off the plan. I never deleted the app but did log out. I am now attempting a lifestyle change again and logged in to my account using the email I originally purchased my membership under. The app now tells me I need to resubscribe to premium and am only on a free access account. On the free account you canâ€™t use the Keto diet plans. I should not have to resubscribe when I already purchased a subscription that has 2 more active months. This app stole money from me by changing my account status without my consent. I do not recommend this app due to this shady practice. No telling how many thousands of other people have had this happen to them without realizing it.
response: Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Amazing to use
body: I have been on the hunt this year for the best of everything. Iâ€™ve literally downloaded 8 different apps developed for the purpose of losing weight and/or living a healthy lifestyle. I downloaded and learned this one, sadly, last. Itâ€™s so straight forward. I just wanted a little push to help keep me on my goals. And Iâ€™ve seen the competing apps, some I didnâ€™t even understand what they were asking for me to input. This one has everything I need, in a comprehensive and straight forward layout. Itâ€™s detailed but simplistic. I think the only way I could do better is if I hire an actual nutritionist and personal trainer to follow me around everywhere, and goodness knows Iâ€™m not doing that. Thanks for the great and easy to use app!

title: SCAM!!!!!
body: I havenâ€™t even started using this app because initially they were offering premium packages for better results while using this app. It varied with different packages but the prices were stating $3.33 a month and other prices around there. When I selected this premium package, willing to pay that amount a month for their services and if I ever decided I didnâ€™t want to use the app anymore I could just cancel the subscription, right? Well when I selected this package and allowed it to charge my card, the total said $47.51. At this point it had already processed through and the only thing I could do was cancel the subscription, which I did immediately. I also immediately contacted the app support and informed them of the situation. I didnâ€™t hear anything back from them, and the next day I got a receipt from apple saying the charge went through. I contacted them as well and only received an automated message back saying they could do nothing about it. I now am dealing with overdraft charges and canâ€™t get through to a single person about the situation. Leading people to believe they are going to pay minimal prices and then charging $50 is completely ridiculous. And anyone who thinks paying that amount for an app that simply calculates your food intake is insane. Worst app experience ever.

title: Unhappy with customer service
body: This app is advertised as being a certain price per month so I purchased the one advertised as being $3.99 a month for a 12 month subscription which would be $44.99 for the year. I expected that I would be charged monthly as it was advertised but when I received an email with my bill I was charged the full $44.99. I reached out via email to ask about this and get a refund and the company responded that I must get permission from Apple iTunes to get this refund. So now I have to jump through hoops to get my money back and what is their response when I ask why it is advertised that way instead of â€œIâ€™m sorryâ€ or â€œhow else can we help?â€?? That I should have read the purchase before subscribing. Now that is just sneaky. Do NOT advertise your company as being a monthly payment then charge people the full amount. Iâ€™m sure it was written somewhere in tiny font that no one can even read. That is just bad customer service too. I am very disappointed with this company and how they handled this.
response: We are sorry to hear this! The reason we show the monthly cost, is for our users to see the difference in price from subscribing yearly and monthly. A monthly subscription is also available. We show you the total price before you pay. We are sorry if this wasn't clear enough. If Apple doesn't refund you, please contact us again through email for further assistance.

Also I dislike the fact that I canâ€™t customize the meals I make and it gives me options for meals in restaurants that Iâ€™ve never heard of because we donâ€™t have them in the south. As well as the water intake. It only gives you options for 8.45 & 16.91 fl oz. The cup I use is a 32 oz. I feel like there are a few things that need to be fixed if theyâ€™re going to charge for a subscription.

title: Disappointed...
body: Iâ€™ve been using this app for a little over a month; starting out with the classic diet then 2 weeks in switched to keto strict. I love the setup, the meal ratings, the tips & the ease of use but Iâ€™ve found that SO MANY food nutrients are incorrect, even when scanned. For example: International Delight Sugar free Coffee Creamer is labeled on the bottle as <1 carb per tablespoon. When scanned it says 0 everything & even when I go in to manually edit the food for correct information it changes back to the original incorrect information. I was trusting the info in the app when scanned & thought wow I can have more than I thought. Come to find out my few cups of coffee with cream that I thought was no carbs was actually 9g of carbs! Thatâ€™s half a days worth of carbs in 3 cups of coffee ðŸ˜³ also Ground Cinnamon says you are -2.5 per teaspoon; also incorrect. I scanned the label & got so excited that I was negative carbs! Wrong again. I had to go out of my way to find the correct nutrients online & come to find out it actually was adding carbs. Too late though, cause I had already ate the food. I feel that paying $49.99 for a yearly subscription is extreme when I have to go out of my way to research anyway to ensure what is in your system is correct. I really loved this app until I found out that information on things Iâ€™ve been eating was wrong. Now Iâ€™m questioning if Iâ€™ve even been in ketosis at all because who knows now what my carb intake, fats, & proteins really were for all the times I just scanned & trusted your system. Also with the exercises, there are so many standard ones that arenâ€™t even listed. Iâ€™m just really disappointed.
response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts on our app and we are sorry to hear that you have been disappointed. Our food database is partly user-created and that results in some items having inaccurate nutritional values. We recommend that you either select items verified by us or, for items that you cannot find in our database, create custom items under Favorites. Find out more here: http://bit.ly/2CSyBYp.

title: Love this app!
body: Found this app randomly. Downloaded it accidentally. Itâ€™s been love ever since. Shared it with a table of friends at dinner who couldnâ€™t stop asking me questions about the app and my results. I chose the Keto Strict, and will move to Keto Moderate when Iâ€™m ready however there are many great options with inspiring meal plans, Mediterranean, etc.   I never knew how sated I could feel. Ever. The app showed me how much fat, carbs and protein it wanted me to have at any given meal for my â€œdaily diary,â€ and even made adjustments to allow me more food after exercising. This makes me want to buy myself more calories and fat just by exercisingâ€”again and again. The app made me feel good about not following it perfectly. (Since when was guilt never part of dieting?) anyhoo, I love the reminders and alerts. Know that Keto is not the â€œhigh protein low carbâ€ and this app has made all the difference in my education on the issue. I have found that Healthy fat is King and is probably the vital nutrient missing in most peopleâ€™s diets these days. ...Never knew how much fat one could/should have in a day on a Keto strict diet. Freaking amazing! Once I got up to par on my daily intake needs, the rest was a piece of cake, without the temptation!
response: Thank you very much for your positive feedback! This is very much appreciated and we are very happy that you are so satisfied!

Right now my goal is kinda in the middle of being healthier/cutting fat and gaining muscle. Iâ€™m skinny, a tad muscular but have some fat to lose. My macros I like to aim are 30-50/30-40/20. 2) more choices/variety for the â€œhow muchâ€. Itâ€™s pretty difficult to exactly see how much I eat or drink but how I would measure it isnâ€™t on the list so itâ€™s difficult to track on the app. 3) recommendations for food products. title: Needs net carbs calculation
body: Pretty good app. Recipes are great. What is seriously lacking for Keto diets is the calculation of net carbs. For a day that is limited to 20g carbs, the app calculates based on carbs and not net carbs (g carbs - g fiber), so you have to manually calculate how many carbs you have left and be â€œout of syncâ€ with the apps recommendations. The food nutrient database and accuracy of bar code scanning also needs expansion and improvement.
response: Good news: we are soon launching net carbs - the functionality is currently tested.Thank you very much for your feedback!

title: Highly Recommend
body: I never write reviews for apps, but this one is an exception. Iâ€™ve been going to the gym a lot lately and wanted to start to balance out my food calories and burned calories. To be fair, it might take some time to get a hang of logging certain things, but I keep finding new features and I love it! As a rule I never buy premium versions of apps (with the exception of Spotify) but I bought the premium version of LifeSum and I donâ€™t regret a penny of it. This has helped me out so much - I highly recommend the Clean Eating Plan, or the Keto Easy Plan (even if you arenâ€™t keto â€” Iâ€™m not, but I am trying to cut down on carbs and Keto Easy helps so much). I love this app

title: Junk...makes you buy a "ShapeUp Club Gold"
body: Paid full price for the old app. Never updated it. Liked it a lot. The new app is garbage. Most of the functions now require you to buy a ShapeUp Club Gold monthly subscription account or go to their website for their "online food database, containing 400,000+ foods." Umm, I think that defeats the purpose of buying an "app". If I wanted to go to my computer & browse the web, why would I pay you a subscription to be limited to just you site?...because it syncs to your app? Just purchased LiveStrong app. Hmmm seems you can search right from the app...genius!

And it is pretty simple to use. Only issue is that you have to sign-up with Shape Up Club for a rather high price to access all features. Would recommend, definitely.

title: Horrible update!

title: Basic but very helpful. (pre-update)
body: I am happy with this app. Not thrilled but happy. It's helped me lose 5 pounds in 4 days (since beginning my New Year's Resolution) but that is a testament to counting calories in general. I enjoy very low-cal crash diets and this app doesn't hassle you about not eating enough like others do so that's a plus. I often have to enter my ready-meals myself as this app doesn't have as many entries (brands and varieties) in its database as I would like. It doesn't do anything special but definitely serves its purpose and was free when I uploaded it. However, I am reading the newest reviews and see that it is no longer a free service as of the update. Some have mentioned a recurring membership fee?!? I'm sorry you guys were duped but I thank you so much for warning me before I updated this app. I do like this app but it is not worth paying for. Sorry. If you folks are willing to pay, I'd recommend the Calorie Counter Pro by MyNetDiary which is much more comprehensive and user-friendly. No recurring membership fees, just $2.99 up front and worth every penny. I was unable to transfer that app to my new iPhone4 because my MacBook operating system is antiquated so I tried this app instead. I will continue to use this for as long as I can without updating but I would not pay for it. It just isn't worth the money. Especially since I have no interest in joining their club. I just want to log the calories I eat and burn and there are other apps that make doing so simpler and more fun.

title: Calm down people
body: I updated this app to v3.3.1. My backup data is still saved within my iphone. You only need to sign up for the account and get the Gold feature for 3 months such as complete sync etc. After gold expire, you'll status is just back to free account like before, and you still can use this app for its core feature. The free account is only lack feature of complete sync(etc.?), and you can only backup your data for last 1 month(maybe?), the data older than that will be deleted. I still love this app.

title: Update killed this once great app
body: From start up after update you have to enter an email if you want to use the app!!! Do not update unless you want to signup!!!!

title: Fantastic!
body: I love this app I started using it last January through may of 2010 and lost 40 LBS. I am now using it again in 2011 and love the improvements! Keep up the great work shape up.

title: Pretty good
body: I have used this program on and off for three years. I always lose weight when I use it. I generally get tired of entering everything I eat individually and wish the database had more commercial items, like common restaurant items at major chains. Even if the exact item I ate wasn't in there, I could more easily find a substitute. It's a good program overall and for the price I think it's a great deal.

title: Great!
body: Easy to use, tons of foods available through the online database. My only complaint is that there aren't enough activities. And I question the number of calories burned for each activity. Seems a little high.

title: My all time favorite!
body: I've tried several apps, as well as old fashioned paper & pencil.  Shape Up is the easiest to use.  I love the meals I've created as well as the huge database of foods.  Sure held keep me on track.

title: Nice functionality, poor search quality
body: I like the form of this app better than MyFitnessPal, but unfortunately the search algorithm needs some work. The two searches I did--eggos and Illy--were found immediately by the MFP app, but this one required the qualifier "waffles" to be appended to "eggos" and only found "Illy" as parts of other words (e.g., Philly). You've got the form nailed--make the function match it, and you'll have a 5-star app.

title: Great app!!!!
body: I lost 4 kilos since October) it's very useful)) now I just can't live without this great app! Thanx)

title: Overall good app.
body: I like the app. However, I think there should be away to manually write your own fat, protein, and carbs in as a custom meal. It will allow you custom calories, but why not further that and also allow the fat, protein, and carbs which should then auto calculate the calories. There are times when there are unique foods you cannot search for, and would be easier just to estimate the fat, protein, and carb grams manually. If you could do that, I would give it 5 stars.

title: Wonderful management tool
body: I like counting calories instead of points (too complicated). This is easy to use, has an extensive food database plus you can add your own favorites and custom meals. I've tried other apps but keep coming back to this one for its simplicity.

title: Good program
body: This is a good program for different weight loss Programs since it easily tracks protein, carbs and fat along with calories on the home screen.  Lots of settings for goal planning and like yhat you can go online on pc or Mac and print stats out for a week or month, etc.  Food database isn't as robust as others I've used, but still good.  Highly recommend for low carb dieters.

And there are constant bombardments to upgrade--to the point where I'm going to accidentally hit the button and have my card charged $34.00. Changing back after my trip I need tracking for. Does trap exercise and food. My fitness pal is better and provides more info.

title: best app for counting macros!

response: Thanks you so much for your positive feedback! We are very happy to read that you are satisfied!

title: Using for ketosis
body: Great UX. Wish we could modify macros for ketogenic plans (to 75/20/5) without it making you switch to a generic plan. The keto tips are helpful but following the Hopkins ratios can be tough for "civilian" use. Also wish net carbs are the carb counting.
response: Currently we unfortunately do not separate net and total carbs. That can, of course, still change in the future.

title: My honest opinion
body: This App is great and on the rare occasion it isn't.
response: Please feel free and contact us with more details at contact@lifesum.com so we can start investigating your issue. Thank you!

title: Great app, but
body: Very useful for weight loss or gain efforts, but since I'm also trying to monitor my water intake I'm frustrated by the fact that the container sizes are fixed. I don't own any glasses or water bottles that hold exactly 8.45 or 16.91 fluid oz. and try to avoid mental math where I can, so for now I'm using a seperate app to log my water intake.
response: Please feel free to vote for your request directly on Uservoice where we collect all user feedback like this: https://lifesum.uservoice.com

title: Better, but premium is not worth it
body: I am a premium member. Aesthetically, this app is leaps and bounds better than MyFitnessPal. However, it's extremely biased towards on the calories-in-calories-out paradigm. There are very few customization options for paying members. For instance, there is no way to easily view net carbs, and viewing the carb breakdown takes several clicks. The weekly graphs dont display much more than your caloric intake, which is frustrating if you are trying to figure out how you did on your macros. There's some weekly test that a)doesn't work most of the time and then b)grades your responses by some pop culture nutrition nonsense. There is also an annoying emoji that reprimands at ever.single.meal if you for not adhering to the standard American diet. Most of the navigation options are useless. Why are plans so incredibly persistent? I don't need to see that all the time after I've picked a plan. Strangely, low carb and keto plans are listed, but they lack any customization options. You're stuck with whatever white girl nonesense the app has decided is good for you.
response: Thanks for this great and detailed feedback, we really appreciate it.

title: Seems to be ok
body: I have struggled with my weight all my life. Got up to 410lbs. Trying to loose weight has really taught me something. It is cheaper to be fat than to loose weight. This app proves that. $44 a year. Every app cost a fortune. Add to that the cost of eating healthy, which is much more expensive than eating junk food. No wonder so many people die fat. Waiting for the day when it is cheaper to eat healthy and to loose weight. Until then, guess I need to look for another app to help me.Edit: Fitbit sync fir free would really be nice. But your response shows you have no desire to help, only make money.
response: The basic/free app already offers you all options you need to start living healthier and keep on doing that. We wish you all teh best with your goals!

title: Okay, but paid version is a no

I thought "whatever, I'll buy the premium version" because like I said, I had heard good things AND because the little upgrade screen says "$3.75/month".
response: Hi, thanks for your feedback! Can you send us a message with your registered email at contact@lifesum.com so we can see what we can do for you? Thanks!

body: Hey!
response: Some of this does sound a little bit odd, so I would encourage you to contact us at contact@lifesum.com. As for the issue with newly added weight showing as "Start weight" this might be because you are on the "Be Healthier" Goal. If not, please also report this to contact@lifesum.com!

title: Love it, can only get better
body: Invested in myself with the premium version and use it on both my android and iPhone. Slightly different interfaces but both good. Some nutrition macros are off, but I don't mind correcting them. I Iike how I can add recipes, and the ketogenic "fat burner extreme" meal plan tool offers exactly the kind of tracking I was looking for. After years of different eating plans, this app has been a tool that helps me stay on track, its day 12 and I'm 8 lbs down in ketosis. I like the graphics and feel of this app more than others. A desktop version would be great for rapid entries, but I'll still use this without it.

title: With every new update this app gets less stable
body: Now i have to close the app in order to see the foods that i've add.Updates are meant to fix bugs not to add more of them.

title: Well, it's a good try.
body: They layout and interface are beautiful, gave me hope for over all experience. But even with an upgraded plan I still wasn't able to adjust my macros, I was just given three choices. I like being able to set my own protein/fat/carb instead of having to choose what they give me and then having to figure it out on my own. The app also has a very limited database of food with the bar code scanner. It also does not sink with Fitbit/garmin. Also, some food is WAY off. For instance it told me that 4 large eggs had 135 carbs. Ummmm...escuse me? I didn't eat Cadbury eggs, just regular 'ol chicken eggs. That was more carbs than I was supposed to eat for the day. Since I KNEW that was WAY off it made me wonder about the rest of the food.

title: Don't pay to upgrade!!!
body: It's not worth the money to upgrade. I also misunderstood the subscription terms and paid for 3 months and thought it would be paid per month and not all at once for $21.99. Big mistake. The recipes are very limited and that's pretty much all your paying for. Definite waste.
